Summary: We recently completed a 10 night stay at the Islander at the end of June 2016.  The property is overall very clean and well kept. Front desk staff is friendly. Easy walking distance to both the convention center and Disneyland.  Overall quiet property with only a few rooms in comparison to neighboring hotels.  Room had a modern tiled bath and there was ample space.  Nice, small clean uncrowded pool,   Grab and go breakfast in the lobby.    I'm not a picky person but I am a thorough reviewer, so for those looking for infractions, I will list the few minor infractions we encountered below.  Again we were there for 10 nights.    1. On night 7, lines of small ants started showing up in the bathroom (I reported to front desk on checkout and they were going to look into it). 2.
Manager Response: Dear ngachick,  Thanks a lot for detailing your stay. It seems like you are a regular traveler. This really helps us understand our strengths and weaknesses. We remember you well. You and your family were amazing! Your review will be printed and Memo'd to all our staff : )  I just feel like we owe you something for your time. We would love to see you again at our establishment. Wish you and your family a fantastic rest of the year. Safe travels!

Summary Heading: Great place for my family of 6
Summary: We just needed a place to stay for a night but this was a good find. It's is clean and well kept. We have a family of 6 but our 4 daughters are 21,19,19 and 16 so we need more sleeping room these days. Our room has 2 queen beds and a bunk bed. The bunk beds have a single on top and a single and a half in bottom. It was nice for all of us to have a bed without having to use a pull out couch. Plus, we didn't have the extra cost of having to get two rooms which we often have to do. There is also a fridge and microwave. We didn't eat breakfast so I can't speak for that but all in all, a nice place to lay our heads for the night.
Manager Response: Dear Obeygod,  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim islander for your stay. The bunk bed rooms also known as the kids room are very popular among are regular customers who are aware of their existence. It is exclusively offered on our website as a great room for families who like a big single lay out and like to stick together. There are only a few units of these gems. Booking early always helps to secure one. Thank you and have a wonderful holiday weekend!

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. The room was fine... nothing glamorous, but no issues. There was a microwave and mini-fridge, free parking, and free wifi. With two young kids it took us about 15 minutes to walk to Disneyland. The staff was great... I had an issue with the thermostat (which turned out to be user error) and someone was at the door to help within 2 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer M,  Appreciate you taking the time to review your stay. We always strive to provide excellence to all our customers. We are a simple establishment with mighty ambitions! Glad that you recognized our wonderful staff. Have a fantastic 4th of July weekend!

Summary: This is a very comfortable hotel within walking distance from Disneyland and downtown district. Bus stop right out the front for Disney, about stops away. Family suites available, roomy, clean and well located to eating venues with popular Bubba gump shrimp and other restaurants across the road and a 7eleven on the corner. Pastries, muffins and fruit with juice tea/coffee for breakfast, Disney tickets purchasable from reception.
Manager Response: Dear Paulajm72,  We are glad you and your family had a wonderful stay. We loved having you all here. In addition to the two bed room suite we also offer kids rooms that offer bunk beds which have a different layout. In addition to the 7eleven there is a CVS that is closer and open 24 hours a day as well as a coffee bean and tea leaf in the same premises. We hope to see your family here soon on your next vacation.

Summary: My husband daughter and I stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn for 4 nights during our trip to  Disneyland. We were very pleased with our room and with the service that we received,front desk staff was friendly,  when we arrived on a Monday after a long trip the nice man at the front desk was courteous enough to give us a downstairs room due to my husbands bad knee he even went out of his way to find us a little bigger room .The room was spotless(except for the carpet, needs shampooing),very comfortable beds,and pillows ,room service cleaned our room daily,remade the beds and would tidy up the room and made sure to leave clean towels.Location is perfect not far from disneyland they even offer a shuttle to and from the hotel,coffee fruit and pastries in the morning to grab and go,
Manager Response: Dear Tania V,  Thank you very much for all the kind words. We love hearing from all our customers. We apologize about the carpets. We just resurfaced our parking lot a few weeks ago. Some of the blackness from the newly surfaced tar makes its way in through residents going out bare feet and coming in. We try our best try our best to shampoo carpets as frequently as possible. Thank you again for your time. We hope to see you all here soon.

Summary: I wanted to love this hotel.  The management and staff seem nice enough.  It is within walking distance (about .5-1 mile) to Disney.  However, there were a few drawbacks.  There was mold on the ceiling in the the bathroom. The floors were filthy. My crawling 11 month old had black legs.  As many others have stated, the breakfast isn't even really a full continental breakfast.  Just pastries and fruit.  I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite.  However, I wouldn't stay in that room again.  I'd pay and get 2 separate rooms.   Other than 2 TVs, there was just 1 microwave, 1 mini-fridge, 1 bathroom, and 1 parking space.  Which is a challenge when you have 6 people staying in the room, especially if more than 2 of those are adults.
Manager Response: Dear Docsbob,  Thank you for taking the time to write to us. We would like to apologize to you in advance for the issues mentioned. We are currently looking into the matter. The carpets were probably black as we just repaved the parking lot. Some guest travel outside their room barefoot and come back right in. This may have contributed to the black legs. We generally would have done a quick carpet wash if this was brought to our attention. Thank you again for writing. Have a wonderful day!

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst visiting Disneyland.  The hotel was very clean outside and inside.  It is a small hotel with maybe 40 rooms.  It looks like it has been renovated fairly recently.  The room was very spacious and clean.  The beds were super comfy as were the pillows.  The fridge and AC were is great working order.  It was a 10-12 minute walk to the Disney main gate which was fine.    The breakfast was a simple grab and go with Danishes, muffins, bananas and apples.  It was totally adequate.  We didn't use the pool, but it looked clean.  There is a cheese cake factory across the road as well as a bunch of other restaurants if you don't want to eat in Disneyland.    Great stay and would definitely recommend and stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Arbourvista,  Thank you for your kind words. It’s great when customers give us a thumb up! We know that are efforts have been appreciated. We look forward to serving you again on your next adventure!

Summary: Within walking distance to Disneyland but has shuttle service.  Room came with coffee maker, microwave, safe and refrigerator.  Continental breakfast served everyday.  Anaheim Garden Walk right across street with shops and restaurants.  Can see fireworks from hotel.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Mathnerdmom  Yes, the fireworks can be seen from the upper level. We also sell the shuttle passes here at the front desk. Thank you for reviewing your stay. Have a great day!

Summary: We are a family of 5..we were visting disneyland so only needed a bed that was close.It took about 10 mins to walk to the main gate..too easy..we came back to hotel during the day to cool off in the pool..made the day much eaiser. The rooms are quite small,but worth it for the budget price.Parking is free..
Manager Response: Dear Donnastephen,  Thank you for staying with us. We are glad you enjoyed the stay and the proximity to the main gates. We also sell the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) passes. It stops right in front of our establishment. Please do come stay with us on your next trip!

Summary: We stayed in the hotel from April 17th through the 21st. First off, I would like to thank them and especially, AJ *if I remember his name correctly*. On the way to Anaheim, my 2 yr old son got car sick 2 hours before we had to arrive. We were not planning on doing early check in, just drive to California, get to Disneyland, and check in in the afternoon. Luckily, when I called to ask if early check in was possible because of our situation, AJ was very understanding, told us there weren't any available rooms due to the fact that all the rooms were booked from the day before, but to come in anyway and hopefully by the time we arrived, there would be an early check out. Luckily, there was! When the GRA's arrived, they quickly cleaned our room first, allowing us to be able to shower
Manager Response: Dear Yesenia,  We hope your son is better now. Thank you for you extended loyalty! We always strive to provide all our customers with a memorable experience. Hope to see you soon on your next Disney adventure!

Summary: We recently stayed here for the 2nd time and they didn't disappoint. If you are looking for a 2 room suite this is the place to be. They are walking distance to disneyland and have free WiFi and parking.  They don't have room service which was fine with us the price and service were right on. They were so pleasant and great to work with. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable.  Will go back here again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the overwhelming positive review from your stay. We are absolutely thrilled that we got things perfect with you. We really enjoyed having you here as our guests and look forward to serving soon on your next escape to Disney! Until next time, Hotel Management

Summary: Our family made a trip to Disneyland for my mom's 75th birthday. We rented two rooms  at the Islander Inn and they were very nice, very roomy and very clean. Thank you for a wonderful stay.  Personnel were very friendly and courteous.
Manager Response: On behalf of our hotel and staff, thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review. We’re especially glad you enjoyed roomy two bed room suites and cleanness . We strive to provide excellent service, and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The front desk attendant is amazing! I believe his name is Narin. He was so patient with my mom who's English is not exactly the best. He helped her with about 8 reservations and got her the best deal.   Location, caring staff and price wise, this place wins!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. We are always happy to go the extra mile for our guests. Hope to see you all soon on your next vacation!

Summary Heading: Best place I have stayed in Anaheim
Summary: You know you never know what your going to get when you book a place you have never stayed in before but I was extremely surprised. It was wonderful. The staff was great and the location to Disneyland was within walking distance. I will for sure stay there again. Great experience.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words! As much as you loved staying here we loved having you here as our guests. Thank you again for taking the time to write about us. We look forward to seeing you here on your next adventure!  Until next time, Hotel Management

Summary Heading: Budget hotel for a family that's half a mile from Disneyland
Summary: This place is half the price and at least half the distance to Disney compared to either the Hyatt or the Hilton. After a day of Disney's excitement and expense, including lackluster $7 hotdogs and over-buttered $5 corn-on-the-cob's, you'll appreciate that the hotel (at Katella and S. Harbor) is right across the street from a plaza that houses reasonably priced Turkish and Mexican restaurants (e.g., $5.50 shrimp burritos and $5 kids meals!).  There are also burger, pizza and Chinese joints that we did not actually try; and a liquor store with $10 microbrew six packs for Mom and Dad.  We enjoyed taking the food and beer back to our room.  Our room had a long table and two chairs that could conveniently be re-arranged alongside a bed into a respectable dining room table for a
Manager Response: NZ-Phead  Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review about your stay. We are thrilled that you got your monies worth! We always strive to give all our customers the very best. we hope to see you and your family soon.

Summary: This is our second stay and we will continue to stay here on future Disneyland trips. The rooms are clean and exactly as described. Check in was very efficient. The air conditioner worked great. Parking spots seemed small but we determined that was common in California. Disneyland ticket prices had gone up since we booked our trip but the owner matched the booked price that we had in our confirmation email. Breakfast is the typical donuts, muffins and pastries and they keep it well stocked. Very convenient to Disneyland, various restaurants from fast food to upscale and the CVS pharmacy on the corner. The owner is very nice.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the overwhelming positive review from your stay. We are absolutely thrilled that we got things perfect with you. We really enjoyed having you here as our guests and look forward to serving soon on your next escape to Disney!

Summary Heading: Great stay, great location, not a single worry !
Summary: I hope this detailed review helps someone else - I read most of the reviews on here, but still didn't find all the answers I needed, so have tried to include everything I can think of.  We are an Australian couple aged 63/44 and are travelling around the USA for the first time, for three weeks.  The hotel is family owned, not a big chain, and we chose it based on trip advisor reviews. The hotel is a u-shape, two stories high (no elevators), so if you are in room number starting with "2" that is the second floor, just one flight of external stairs.  Cars are parked in front of the rooms, all room doors and windows face the car park.  No problem with noise at all. Nice white plantation shutters on the windows.   Nothing at all wrong with the room, great condition, clean,
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the overwhelming positive review from your stay. We are absolutely thrilled that we got things perfect with you. We really enjoyed having you here as our guests and look forward to serving soon on your next escape to Disney! Regards Niran

Summary Heading: Fine for overnight stay - at most
Summary: Whilst the staff tried to accomodate an earlier check-in we were told the room would be ready at 11am, however housekeeping told us another hour.  The room was a good size however very dark and the carpet left black marks on our feet. Walls were very thin and the air-conditioners were extremely noisy.  Katella Ave is very busy, however the walk to Disney is only 10-15. The pool is tiny but was heated. Breakfast was a very sad looking assortment of donuts and pastries.
Manager Response: Thanks for describing your stay. We sincerely apologize for the issue you faced during your stay. All your concerns are taken seriously in order to better ourselves. We hope you choose to give us a another chance to make it up to you. Thank you very much for your time.

Summary Heading: Good cheap option for large family
Summary: Stayed here for a quick stop to Disney. Walking distance to the hotel for me and two nieces, and a short drive for the rest of the family. Lots of restaurants nearby, including ihop & subway. Hotel was clean, not the newest but decent. Some blankets were worn but overall average linens. Towels were average. We had the 4 queen bed room, so kids could be separate. Pool area was clean, not heated. Room got really stuffy through the day, maybe leave fan on when gone. Overall above average hotel experience, would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your stay. We are thrilled that you had great service. Thank you again. Hope to see you soon on your next adventure!

Summary: We visit Disney every year. Quite enjoyed our stay here and will stay again.Didn't get a chance to try the pool but the laundry facilities were good. Walkable distance but it can be tiring. Will be very handy when Walgreens opens next door! Parking can be tricky even though it is included. I was a bit nervous parking my giant rental car and at one point staff had to move their car so that I could have a space. Also on one night, I left half-eaten food out (a tiger tail from Disney) and was very disappointed when housekeeping threw it away! My own fault I guess.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your stay. We are thrilled that you had great service. Thank you again. Hope to see you soon on your next adventure!

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on a budget.
Summary: I was looking for good rates on a place that was walking distance to Disneyland. The Islander fit the bill. The one drawback was the limited breakfast that they offered, but it was not a surprise as I had read the reviews before I booked the hotel. There were some donuts, muffins, coffee and milk. Some bananas or apples, but that was it. There was really no place for much more, and with only a few rooms in the place, I don't blame them for not offering more. Free parking made up for the lack of a breakfast. Some places charge  $15 or more per day just to park at the hotel you are already paying good money to stay at. There were no hidden fees, and the rooms had been recently updated. Good sized fridges and microwaves in all rooms. Staff was friendly and helpful. My next trip to
Manager Response: We're thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your complimentary words for our staff, they were very happy to read your comments. We're glad that you loved your room as well as our location. Thanks again, we look forward to welcoming you back again soon next time you visit the area.

Summary: My family and I have been staying here for the past 4 years. Large-spacious rooms(family of 5), clean, and a friendly staff. Great location. Close to Disneyland, restaurants, and event center. Only complain would be parking. We will continue to stay at this location. Make sure to book ASPA! They fill up fast!
Manager Response: We're thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your complimentary words for our staff, they were very happy to read your comments. We're glad that you loved your room as well as our location. Thanks again, we look forward to welcoming you back again soon next time you visit the area.

Summary: My family and I arrived on a Saturday evening. The parking lot was quite full but still enough room for our vehicle. We stayed in a kids suite with bunk beds. It was perfect for us. The room was spacious, clean and a great value. We stayed for 4 nights. Never had one problem with anything. Within walking distance to Disney, which is the whole reason we were in town. The free breakfast was good. Donuts, pastries, fruit, coffee and orange juice. A few of us went swimming on the first night. The pool was a bit chilly but they came out and turned the heater on right away. Our kids loved our room. The bunk beds had a single on top and a full on the bottom. Comfy beds and pillows, awesome water pressure in the shower. Everything was absolutely wonderful. Will definitely be our go to
Manager Response: We're thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your complimentary words for our staff, they were very happy to read your comments. We're glad that you loved your room as well as our location. Thanks again, we look forward to welcoming you back again soon next time you visit the area.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!
Summary: After weeks of research trying to find a hotel suitable for my family, I decided on the Anaheim Islander and I'm glad I did. The hotel had everything we needed; enough space/beds for 6 people, a laundry center, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast and was just a short walk to Disneyland (10-15 minutes). And although not visible from inside the room, we could still enjoy the Disneyland firework display nightly from the balcony area. The front desk staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating and the cleaning staff always did an excellent job straightening our room and keeping the exterior neat. My husband and I agree that we will definitely stay here again. I highly recommend anyone looking for a great room at a reasonable price to stay at the Islander.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words! As much as you loved staying here we loved having you here as our guests. Thank you again for taking the time to write about us. We look forward to seeing you here on your next adventure!

Summary: My boyfriend and I loved our experience at the Islander Inn! The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were simple but very clean, and it was just perfect for a place to sleep and relax after a busy day at Disneyland. The beds were comfy and we got a room that could easily fit 8 people. The room also had a TV, a microwave, and a little refrigerator. This place is perfect! Free parking, free WiFi, free breakfast and a 15 minute walk from Disneyland! What more do you need? The only thing I will say was that the parking lot is really small and was full the night we check in but we were still able to find a parking spot. My boyfriend and I are always going to book with the Islander Inn from now on.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words! As much as you loved staying here we loved having you here as our guests. Thank you again for taking the time to write about us. We look forward to seeing you here on your next adventure!

Summary: Wonderful place to stay! Great Staff!  VERY CLEAN!!!  I would highly recommend and reasonably priced. Close to Disneyland. My visit and stay here was exceptional! We came 2300 miles for this visit and I had read the trip advisor reviews on many places I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel especially for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words! As much as you loved staying here we loved having you here as our guests. Thank you again for taking the time to write about us. We look forward to seeing you here on your next adventure!

Summary: When my family decided late in the Fall of 2015 to visit Disneyland, we searched for a reasonably priced place to stay that would be within walking distance to the Park. We found Islander Inn and Suites and made a reservation only to find out our dates were not quite right. Our final dates had to coincide with a long weekend, and we could not find suites to accommodate us. But Islander came through! We were already on the road when they left a message on our home phone.  Awesome! The place was clean, and front desk and maid service were exceptionally friendly and helpful.  We walked everywhere as parking was free!  When breakfast got a little boring on day 3, we went to IHOP round the corner.  It is conveniently situated near to restaurants, stores, shopping.  We highly
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the overwhelming positive review from your stay. We are absolutely thrilled that we got things perfect with you. We really enjoyed having you here as our guests and look forward to serving soon.

Summary Heading: Hidden gem near Disneyland and Convention Center
Summary: I stayed at the Anaheim Islander for two nights to attend an exhibition at the Anaheim Convention Center.  It's an easy 12-minute walk around the corner to the Convention Center.  The 3 people I dealt with at reception were friendly and courteous and I had a quiet, ground-floor room in a corner of the facility.  The room was clean and everything was in good working order.  I liked the fact that the windows opened and had plantation shutters on them instead of curtains.  My first night there, an AC unit in a neighboring room started making loud noises, enough to wake me up; the unit was replaced the next day.  This isn't a top-end Marriott or Westin, but it's not Motel 6 either.  The price/value would be hard to beat.

We stayed here for the first time in mid-January. The room was very clean albeit a little small. They have a complimentary continental breakfast and free wifi. The hotel is less than a mile to Disneyland's front gate. The rooms were not very sound-proof, but the only thing that really got through was the fireworks from Disneyland. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear BrewMike,  Thank you for staying with us. We do have several types of rooms depending on the size of your family. You may have stayed in one of our smaller standard rooms. We also do offer a family suite with three to four queen beds with separation for future reference. They are pretty spacious. We about a half a mile work to the main gates at Disney which can take between ten to fifteen minutes depending on your pace. Thank you again for your time. Have a wonderful day!

Summary Heading: Close to the park and very clean.
Summary: Really enjoyed the closeness of the park and easy parking.  The rooms were clean and welcoming.  The staff was helpful and attentive.  The hotel is nothing fancy, but after all day at the park you just want something clean, safe and comfortable.  Will definitely come back again.
Manager Response: Dear Ken S,  Thank you for reviewing your stay. We are thrilled that you had great service. Thank you again. Hope to see you soon on your next adventure!

Summary: We picked this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland (with less than 15 minutes on foot, it was a very easy walk even for our kids) and we stayed there for 3 nights in December 2015. We stayed in room 228 on the second floor. The room was very clean and they made our beds and changed the towels daily. Heating worked perfectly. We also appreciated that there was a safe in the room.  The people who work at the reception are very friendly and they go out of their way to help the guests out. When we mentioned that it was our first visit to Disneyland ever, they gave us free maps and answered all the questions we had. Free breakfast consists mostly of muffins, very sugary donuts and danishes, and it would be nice to have some healthier options like cereal and milk or
Manager Response: Dear MonteTamaro,  Thank you for your review and suggestions. Your input as a guest is very important to us in maintaining and excelling in our service. We are glad that you had a pleasant memorable first trip. We loved having you all as our guests. Hope to see you soon in the near future. Best Regards to you and your family!

Summary: We stayed four nights in January 2016.  The room was clean, but noisy.  The rooms all have exterior entries that form a horseshoe around a parking lot that faces Katella Ave., a very busy street.  I asked for a wake-up call on the first night, and all went well.  I asked for a second wake-up call, and I never received a call.  So, I used the alarm clock inside the room from then on.  Wi-Fi was spotty at best.  I only got connected twice, and both times got kicked off after about five minutes.  They have Direct TV.  The connection in our room was broken, I called to advise the front desk, and they fixed it the next day.  The walk to/from Disneyland was easy for myself and my 16 year old son.  There are plenty of restaurants in the area as well as a CVS Pharmacy and convenience
Manager Response: Dear Shannon K  Thanks for describing your stay. We sincerely apologize for the issue you faced during your stay. All your concerns are taken seriously in order to better ourselves. We hope you choose to give us a another chance to make it up to you. Thank you very much for your time.

Summary: Picked this hotel because of the positive reviews on trip advisor. We stayed for 5 nights on the top floor in the back.  When we arrived the room did not smell and it was very clean. We could not hear our neighbors and quiet. We had the room cleaned up two days after the arrival and it was spotless when we returned. (My daughter is messy with her makeup and such). The staff was great and accommodating. I don't recommend more than 4 in the room we had which was two queen beds. Fresh fruit, Danish, muffins, tea, coffee, OJ, and coco for the morning start. The place has been updated, nothing fancy and great price. We wanted a place with a pool which they had but we never used it. We were too busy at Disneyland the whole time and the only time in the room was to sleep. So, if your

Our party of 9 stayed in Two 2 room suites for our visit to Disneyland. Rooms were nicely updated. Would be great if the hotel upgraded their towels. Breakfast every day consisted of donuts, muffins, Danishes, apples, orange juice, and coffee. About a 10 min walk to Disneyland. Was nice that CVS is right down the street for anything you need.  Many restaurants across the street. Would stay again.

I stayed here earlier this year with my family for 4 nights while we had a 3-day trip to Disneyland and we were more than happy with our stay. The rooms were clean and spacious enough - we had 1 king and 2 queen beds and a bathroom. The service and reception desk was very helpful and accommodating and also breakfast was included which was great. We were able to take a short walk to Disneyland easily each morning and night and in between if some of us were in need of a short break and lie down. It was also great as it was so close to the group of restaurants across the road when we needed food other than what is available at Disneyland. Overall such a great stay and will for sure be saying here again on hopefully another great trip over to Disneyland in the near future. The

I booked this hotel room in hopes that we could all be in the same room very hard for 6 adults and 2 kids( ages 2 and 2 almost 3). My father hadn't decided if he wanted to come but he did last minute.  I booked a room with 2 queens and 1 pull out couch. I was already aware that the room had no elevators and it was only a flight of stairs so the kids had a little harder time going up but, we made due.I booked because we weren't going to Disneyland and wanted something we could walk to and its literally  2 long blocks down the St. The Location for this Hotel is small but I didn't mind at all. There ia construction going on next door they are building a Hyatt but honestly I didn't hear anything since we were gone all day at the theme parks. They did close the St due to construction
Manager Response: Dear DomoLove,  Thank you for taking your time to give us a detail review about your stay.  Yes, the construction next door is almost over. They are pretty decent about keeping the noise low during the day when they are active. Some guests choose a downstairs room if they are not able to climb the single flight of stairs. We always strive to give you the best service at all times. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you here soon.

Summary: The Islander was a great place for our family of 5 plus grandma! We had a 3 queen bed room for 9 nights. It was ok, though a little tight for 9 days and only one bathroom.  Breakfast of mini muffins, donuts, Danish, apples, coffee & orange juice was ok, but again kind of repetitive after 9 days, we went out a couple of mornings for breakfast to change things up a bit.  Our kids used the pool a couple of times, and had fun, they were the only ones in the pool. The pool was clean, the water was warm. No hot tub.  Front desk service was great, any concerns were dealt with quickly.  The room was clean, although the floor did make socks/feet black.  Walk to disney was about 10-15 minutes, depending on crosswalks and how fast you walk.  Thanks for a great stay!

We are a family of 4 and stayed for 2 nights. Yes like many of the reviews this is an older hotel. And yes it could use some updating, but you get what you pay for. For us this place was just right. Yes my boys socks were a little dirty from the floor and yes the towels where grey, but we had a great night sleep and would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you're a light sleeper.
Summary: This is an older, small motel that has been renovated.  The interiors are nice, clean and basic.  Bathroom is very tiny and there is no vanity area outside of the bathroom.  The 2 room suites are nice and spacious but not a lot of clothes storage space.  The problem that we had with the motel was the very squeaky walls and ceilings.  We stayed downstairs and we could hear every step that the person upstairs would take.  Not only did we hear the footsteps but the ceiling beams would squeak.  The first night we stayed there I was mortified thinking that the squeaking that myself and my two teenage daughters were hearing were the sounds of a bed.  The uncomfortable feeling of trying to explain that it was probably someone just rocking their baby on their bed or their toddlers
Manager Response: Dear Disneyfamily4ever,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We sincerely apologize for your experience here at the islander. As you advise our fellow trip advisors we too recommend an upper level room for light sleepers. We generally do not hear too many complaints about squeaking sounds. We would appreciate if you could call us back and let us know the room number you stayed in so we could further investigate. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: I was looking for a room for my family of 6 to stay in for just one night. As usual I waited till the last minute as I was still indecisive of what we were going to do.  For the most part we usually only stay in Hotels when we take a trip but since I waited so last minute I could not find anything and especially in the price range I needed. I found this Hotel and saw that it had good if not great reviews. Pictures looked good also so I thought I'd take a chance. It was mainly for us to sleep in since we would be going to Knott's Merry Farm the next day to celebrate my daughter's  B-Day.  We got there Friday afternoon around 4 which was great. We checked in, service was quick and easy. I ended up picking the kids suite which was perfect for us, just enough space. The room to my
Manager Response: Dear bzbeemom,  Thank you for staying with us. We are glad that you had an enjoyable vacation. Your review will help us better our quality and service. Have a merry Christmas and a fantastic new year!

Summary Heading: Lovely place to stay,  good location & value for money!
Summary: We were a family of five from New Zealand who stayed here 4 nights from the 27th September 2015.  We had a one bedroom suite with four beds.  This hotel was clean (except maybe you could look at cleaning the carpets?) and very comfortable. Location was excellent and a nice ten minute walk to DisneyLand although the ART Bus stops right outside but i think it is quicker to walk.  Nice restaurants are close and i would recommend a visit to The Cheesecake Shop!  I read other reviews so i knew breakfast was pastries and coffee/orange juice which was sufficient for us.  The pool is lovely and the Hotel grounds are well kept.  Housekeeping did an excellent job and the Owners & staff here are wonderful (especially Amit), friendly and helpful.   Wifi was okay and met our needs. We picked
Manager Response: Dear Adi1811027,  Thanks a lot for all the kind words. Yes, reviews are a crucial part for most people to make informed decisions about where they are going to stay with no surprises. Here at the Islander we are a friendly bunch and always try to go above and beyond to make your stay as memorable as possible. We hope to see you here soon on your next escape.  Have a wonderful new year!

Summary: We traveled with our grown daughter and 2 small children. I thought we could help her more if we shared a suite, and I found this place. We had a 2 bedroom with 4 queens and one bathroom for $200 a night, and that's the complete price.   There are a lot of good things to say about this 2 star motel. Yes, it's about 3/4 of a mile to Disneyland. The ART bus (not free, okay?) does stop right in front of the hotel about every 20 minutes. FYI, if you miss the ART bus going back to Anaheim Islander from Disneyland, take a taxi! I found myself still in Disneyland after the last ART bus had left, and was surprised to find that a taxi was about $5 (and please add a tip on top of that) from Disneyland to the motel. If 2 or more people take a taxi, that's actually cheaper than an ART bus.
Manager Response: Dear RnBBurgin,  Thanks a lot for the detailed description and inaccuracies in google. We have tried to reach google many times regarding this matter but so far they haven’t corrected their mistakes. We sincerely apologize for this inconvenience. All your recommendations will be addressed to the management as to improve our service and value. You really have taken the time to write to us. We thank you again as this really help our potential customers make a decision and also be prepared when they get here. Have a wonderful Christmas!

Summary: We stayed here for 10 nights in Sept/ Oct we chose it because it had enough beds for all, 1 each in main room and separate room for us ( family of 4 with 2 teenagers). It was spacious and clean - but yes as everyone has mentioned the carpet was black.  Pool was great clean and we swam most days. We took plastic plates and old cutlery which was great and had some meals at the hotel. We had cereal in the morning and topped it up the pastries, donuts, muffins and orange juice supplied by the hotel. The location was great - 10 minute walk to Disney and shops on the corner. The Cheese Cake shop the other way has great happy hour including food. Internet was the thing that was let my score down as not reliable at all. Would I stay here again - yes.
Manager Response: Dear Nics_family,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We have many regular guests who come from New Zealand & Australia. It’s always a pleasure having you folks here. We apologize for the less than perfect experience here. We are looking into fixing these issues. We hope you decide to come stay with us again so we can make it up to you. Have a wonderful new year!

Summary Heading: If it's freee it's for me!!!
Summary: Wifi Free, Parking Free, Danish and donuts free.. YUP, this is the hotel for me. My family and I stayed here in September for the Disney Half and it was just perfect. Spacious and affordable for being so close to the park. Why pay more money for a room you just sleep in considering you spend a majority of your time in the park.. We are already planning to go back this next weekend for another race. Than you Anahiem Islander and Suites for making our race weekends affordable and safe... See you soon.

We had a second floor room towards the back which was almost always very quiet except for one morning when some kids were running up and down the walkway, excited for Disneyland - hey, .  Room was very clean and modern and the refrigerator and microwave came in handy.  Very friendly and helpful staff too.

Stayed here for 3 nights in October. Room was spacious and beds very comfy. Bathroom was a little on the small side,as were the towels.  We didn't have any problems parking but in the busier seasons I think there would be some issues as not very much parking for the number of rooms. Pool is adequate but small but good enough to take a dip to cool off,could be busy in the summer months.  It's in walkable distance to Disney and dining options so saves money on parking.  Breakfast was just some pastries,juice/coffee to grab on the go but included with room so not bad but wouldn't set you up for the day.  Wifi was pretty sketchy with connection bombing in and out all the time or not even being able to connect at all.  I would stay here again for its comfort and location.
Manager Response: Dear Tezza06  We are glad you enjoyed your stay! Thank you for the feedback, We sincerely apologies for the problems you experienced with the WiFi. This has since been fixed. We hope to see you here on your next vacation here at the Islander.

Summary: Hotel was a great deal.  10 mins walk to Disneyland and California Adventure. Rooms have nice interiors and clean, comes with a refrigerator.  Continental Breakfast includes apples, donuts, muffins, and pastries.  If you have 6 people, book the 2 queens and the bunk beds.  My boys loved the bunks. I would definitely book this hotel again.

Very roomy hotel!  The manager was very friendly and the overall cleanliness of hotel and grounds met our expectations!  You can't beat the price either.  It's about a 10-15 minute walk to Disney though, which we didn't mind because we're used to walking! :-)

We have stayed at several of the hotels that surround Disneyland and this is by far our 218322-30favorite. AJ at the front desk was extremely helpful. He saw me struggling to get my stroller up stairs during check in and switched our room to one down stairs. The hotel is small so you park right next to your room which makes grabbing stuff from the car easy. Parking is also free! Other hotels charge between $15-$20 a night. The pool was nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. Disney is only a 10 minute walk.  We already booked another night at the end of October. Great value!

Summary Heading: Decent hotel overall but not great
Summary: This hotel was about $80 cheaper/night than the hotel we usually stay at directly across from Disneyland so we tried it out. It's very small. There was a urine smell when we walked in so we spray Lysol all over the floor when we went to dinner & it was better when we came back. The floors were dirty though - my 1 year old daughter's hands and knees were black after crawling and my feet were black walking on it. Otherwise the room seemed clean and spacious. It was quiet. The beds weren't great, but the pillows were comfortable. The breakfast is very small. It's held in the very small lobby and consisted of some danishes, mini muffins, store bought donuts, coffee and orange juice, and apples. But it's better than nothing. There is no where to sit and eat it, so we ate while we
Manager Response: Dear Kristen,  We sincerely apologize for not meeting your expectations. We are currently looking into this matter. We hope you would give us another try so we could make it up to you. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. Best regards.

Summary: We've stayed here several times and I would recommend it to anybody.  It's a nice place to stay. It's near everything.  The rooms are nice and clean.  Good parking and friendly staff.  We love it and we will stay there again.

We have stayed here several times, always a pleasant experience. The owners and staff clearly take pride in the hotel and service they provide. It's a two story, motel-style hotel, without elevators. Rooms are clean and comfortable, relatively large. There's a bus stop for ART (shuttle to Disneyland) right outside the hotel.  The only negative is the free WiFi provided is only usable in the dead of night and middle of the day, when the majority of guests are out or asleep. Probably don't have enough internet bandwidth for the guests. Sadly, neither Sprint nor T-Mobile LTE data coverage is particularly good in this location (though voice service is fine) so bringing your own internet connectivity doesn't really help much.

I have stayed at many places over the years near Disneyland, but I have stayed at the Islander Inn and Suites for the past three years and have another trip already booked because our experience has been great. We have stayed in both their kid suite with the bunk beds and the double room suites. They were very accommodating, friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly. We have 5 kids so need the bigger rooms and really appreciated the affordable price and sleeping options they offer compared to the other hotels around there. We also loved that we could easily walk to Disneyland and many restaurant options.

Most important it's clean and not run down. Good parking and friendly staff. The Internet was not very stable but that was perhaps just incidental. I can really recommend this place for anyone who wants a decent place for a good price. Walking distance to Disney world and restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Carl L,  Thank you for your kind words. Sincerely appreciate your goodwill and confidence in us. We always strive to do our very best every single day. I would like to apologize for the issue you had with the internet. We are currently looking into this. Hope to see you soon on your next vacation.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights at the AIIS. Exactly what I had wanted. Enough space for 6 (2 bedrooms each containing 2 double beds), easy 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland-California Adventure and best price you'll find anywhere. Ok so the decor is a bit dated and the breakfast is very basic but the room is spotless and there's free car parking. I'd stay here again for sure!

Our stay at the Anaheim was most enjoyable beginning with our early arrival. The gentleman who checked us in was very friendly and kind to do so. Even though we were 3 hours early, he found us a ready room. The room was spotless. We especially appreciated the quiet night. Our friends who stayed across the street were awakened through the night by people coming and going, doors opening and closing. I can only guess that the walls are so well insulated at AIIS is what helped us feel like we were in a protected cocoon. Thank you for a very pleasant night.

The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel is very clean with free WiFi plus it is a quick walk to the Disney Parks as well as being close to a wide variety of restaurants we would not hesitate to stay here again.

The service was awesome. Friendly staff and clean spacious rooms. We had a big party. It was 14 people in total. The beds were really comfortable. After a long day in the disney parks it was great to arrive to the hotel and relax in the welcoming rooms. I will definitely stay here when I come back to future disneyland trips.

Summary Heading: Great room, spotlessly clean, great location for Disneyland. Fab choice
Summary: Stayed mid August for 4 nights, with my husband and daughter as part of a bigger trip, and chose this hotel for its location to Disney and previous traveller reviews. It turned out to be a fantastic choice and we had a great stay there. We had a top floor room with 2 double beds which was perfect for us although i understand it was one of the smaller rooms, you'd never guess, it was spacious, and very well equipped. The whole place was spotless and the room and bathroom especially so. All the staff we encountered were unbelieveably friendly and helpful. We used the pool during our stay too, as well as the laundry which after 3 days walking around the parks was much needed, and very convenient and reasonably priced. Location to Disney coudlnt be better - a 10 minute walk, passing

We stayed in a unit with 2 double beds in one room and another double in a separate room. Staff were very friendly and helpful in booking taxis. Air conditioning was great, refrigerator, microwave, free wifi, but no electric jug (would have been nice to be able to make a cup of tea). Breakfast consisted of doughnuts, muffins, apples, tea, coffee and juice. Very handy to Disney and a 7-Eleven (where you can buy healthier options for breakfast). Restaurants just down the road- The Cheesecake factory is worth visiting.

My daughter and I wanted to take a quick trip to Disneyland and California Adventure before she returned to school.  Since we were going to be spending our time at the park from sun up to sundown, I did not want to spurge for a high priced hotel.  The Islander Inn and Suites came recommended to me from a friend.  I was a bit skeptical, as I usually stay in hotels, vs motels.  I decided to go with my friend's recommendation and give the Islander a try.  I was so happy with this choice.  Not only was the room immaculate, it also had a mini frig and microwave.  The linens were above standard and the décor was updated.  There was a flat screen tv as well.  The location was key.  Just 2 long blocks from the park.  The rate was amazing at $130 or so, including parking and a lite

Summary Heading: Perfect place for family visit to Disneyland
Summary: I did a lot of research to find a place to stay near Disneyland for a family of 5. I was looking for a good value that was close enough to walk to but also had enough room for a family of 5. Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites fit the bill and I was disappointed at all with the stay.  The room had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The shower had good water pressure and the room was very clean. There was a mini frig and a microwave. We had enough room for all our bags and didn't feel cramped. The only issue was when the sofa bed was out it blocked some of the air conditioner, but the solution was to put the bed back in the sofa before we left for the day at the parks and the room was nice and cool when we returned for the afternoon nap.  There was a pool which we didn't use, but I saw

Summary Heading: Was ready to give 5 stars, until....
Summary: Our family couldn't have been more thrilled with out 2 bedroom unit on the 2nd floor when we arrived. It was very clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable and the fridge and micro were a great bonus. Parking was free and we could see the car out our room window. We checked in about 4 pm and headed off to Disneyland/California Adventure, which was easy walking distance to the main entrance. When we returned that evening, we noticed that many of the rooms had their doors open and people were outside. It should have been a clue to us, but we thought nothing of it. The next day is was a little disappointing to discover the breakfast consisted only of coffee, pre-packaged muffins & apples. There was an easy fix---a stop at the 24 hour CVS on the corner on the walk to Disney
Manager Response: Dear Mellot,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are currently looking into the above mentioned incident. We sincerely appologize for not making it a 5 star stay for you. We hope you would give us another try to make it up to you.

Summary: Our family of 4 ( 3 adults and 1 teen) stayed here for 5 nights and had an excellent experience. Just positive things to say: immaculately clean, excellent service and large rooms. We stayed in a 3 queen bed room. It had a private bedroom with a fridge plus freezer and microwave. It is quite spacious.  There is also a table plus chairs which is perfect for dining in. It is at walking distance to Disneyland, the Gardenwalk mall and many restaurants and convenient stores-cvs and subway are open 24/7. The service and wifi were excellent. The ART bus stops in front of this property frequently. The outdoor pool is perfect for an afternoon dip.  Easy in and out because of the outdoor corridors. Easy to bring in luggage as you can back up to your door. We all recommend this cozy motel.

We had a great time, the pool was nice and warm, loved having a clean room every day and parking.  The price was right and the proximity to Disneyland was perfect.  Would definitely stay again.  I liked that this little 60's style hotel was nestled in between the big guys, reminded me of how it used to be in that neighborhood, but glad it had all the remodeled comforts and newer upgrades.

We arrived at the inn and was greated by the staff who were very friendly and helpful.  The room was really good, even though it was busy at the inn it was not overly noisy. Most of the time we were at the pool until about 1030pm enjoying the quiet.  This is really close to all amenities around anaheim and although it may not be "luxury" you are made welcome and that is something that makes a stay special.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Your Disneyland Vacation
Summary: The Anaheim Islander is one of the best kept secrets for Disneyland visitors. Many hotels boast walking distance to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. This one actually has that. It is a block and a half walk to Disney and just under that to the convention center. We spent two nights here and found everything about the Islander to be top notch. The staff is amazing; Judy has her team ready and willing to ensure tourists are treated to the best experience possible. Several restaurants and convenience stores are within walking distance as well. Our party had four rooms reserved and arrived early. The staff had one of the rooms opened for us so we could unload our luggage and make our way to the park. Did I mention parking is free also? There is a shuttle available which

We've stayed at the Anaheim Islander several times before and have always enjoyed our stays there. Until our most recent visit that is. We booked a three bed. two room suite for four nights from July 14th thru July 17th. We booked three nights under one reservation, and then upon deciding to stay an extra night, booked the fourth night under a second reservation. I called the hotel several days before our arrival to ensure that we would be able to enjoy the same room for all four nights without any need to change rooms. They assured me that this would indeed be the case. So with this assurance, we arrived late afternoon on the 14th and were promptly assigned a FOUR bed suite. I thought this a bit odd, since we had booked a three bed suite, but assumed that they were kindly
Manager Response: Dear Dseguine,  First of all let me apologize for any inconvenience that you experienced during your stay with us. As a repeat customer you are well aware that we always strive to provide the very best of service to all. On this particular incident their may have been some misunderstandings and miscommunications on both our parts. To clarify your entire experience with us let me detail the incident as it appeared to us.   You had made two separate reservations for your stay. Both, for the suite with three queen beds. The first reservation was for one night. The second reservation was for three nights. When you initially checked in for your first reservation there was no mention on your part to us about your second reservation for three nights and so we were unaware of your second reservation when you initially checked in. Since you are a repeat guest we gave you a complimentary upgrade for the night as a courtesy.   On the day of checkout we were informed of your second reservation but were unable to provide you with a complimentary upgrade as the rooms were already reserved by another guest. Had we known about your second reservation in advance we would have not put you through the inconvenience of moving rooms. Sorry, our computer check-in system is not capable of notifying us of your second reservation when you checked in the first night. You also did inform us that you would be giving us a bad review when we mentioned that you had to move rooms. That was not very polite nor professional. We never want to inconvenience any of our guests as you are the most valued part in our humble business. So please do learn to extend the same courtesy to us and not post reviews based on your emotions but facts.  We did offer a small discount for your inconvenience which may not seem much to you but we believe that we were not in the wrong but out of loyalty and courtesy as your wife & rest of your family were extremely understanding and helpful in moving all belongings to the room type which was originally reserved by you. We still would sincerely like to apologize to you, your wife and the rest of the family.

Summary Heading: Will Stay Here for All Future Disney Trips!
Summary: This modest hotel sits roughly one and a half blocks from the front gates of Disneyland. The staff was kind and friendly during all of our interactions with them. The continental breakfast is a nice touch- it's very simple (fruit and pastries), but it was great to walk by the lobby and grab some muffins and apples before hitting the parks. We stayed here for six days and five nights. We were a large party of seven, so we stayed in a suite. The rooms were connected by a locking door and a shared bathroom. The bathroom was small but very clean. The front room had a minifridge, flatscreen tv, two queen beds, a desk with a mirror, a dresser, and a microwave. The second room had a table with two chairs, a flatscreen tv, a dresser, and two queen beds. The rooms were more than enough
Manager Response: Dear Kathleen M  Thank you very much for the overwhelming positive review from your stay. We are absolutely thrilled that we got things perfect with you. We really enjoyed having you here as our guests and look forward to serving soon on your next escape to Disney!

Summary Heading: Would give it 6 stars is it was an option.
Summary: This place could not have been better. Walking distance to Disneyland, Cheesecake Factory, and Bubba Gumps across the street, and a super friendly staff. If you are looking for a 5 star place, this is not for you. It is an older place, but the staff is great and the 2 room suites were perfect for us and our kids. Quiet at night and close to everything.
Manager Response: Dear Kirk M,  Thank you very much for your kind words! As much as you loved staying here we loved having you here as our guests. Thank you again for taking the time to write about us. We look forward to seeing you here on your next adventure!

Summary: We stayed here for a few nights while we visited Disneyland. The location is within walking distance to Disneyland and various restaurants which was great. The rooms are basic but clean. We could hear the people upstairs walking about but it wasn't too bad. The continental breakfast consisted of pastries, donuts, muffins, apples, juice and coffee. Not great but it was something. The staff are friendly and helpful. If you want luxury go somewhere else. If you want clean, basic well priced accommodation then stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Jula1  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We always strive to provide the very best of service to all our guests. Like you mentioned we are not a luxury establishment. We are a small basic clean place for families hoping to relax and get a good night sleep after a long day at the Anaheim resort.  May we also suggest requesting an upstairs room during your next visit? Thank you again for staying with us. We hope to see you here soon.

Summary: We stayed here three nights during our visit to Disneyland. The hotels has pay laundry on site, it is the first stop on the ART, and within walking distance to many great restaurants. The breakfast is just doughnuts and pastries but my son like it. I would defiantly return here to stay in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Chris D  Thank you for making the Islander your choice of stay. We like to think of our place as an affordable place for families hoping to get the best value during their vacation. Our humble breakfast consists of Danish pastries, donuts, muffins, fresh apples, orange juice & fresh coffee every morning.  Kids like your son usually love the breakfast. Yes, the ART stop is conveniently located right in front of our property with shuttle runs every 20 minutes for your convenience. We look forward to having you back as our guests in the near future. Thank you for your time.

Summary Heading: Convenient and good value for money
Summary: Spent 6 nights here for a family of 6 in both the 2 bedroom suite and kids room in May 2015. Very convenient with the ART shuttle buses stopping right out the front. Very affordable rates and great restaurants just across the road at the Anaheim Gardenwalk. Nothing super fancy but pretty clean and for the price you pay it's reasonable.  Only complaint would be the TV service (though we were too tired to watch any after Disney), breakfast choice (same food everyday) and the carpet needs a good steam clean. Keep your shoes/socks if you don't want black feet. Overall happy with what we paid for!  Note, construction is currently happening next door so you will hear the builders going at it during weekdays!

Stayed here for two nights in November while we visited Disneyland.  Easy walking distance to the restaurants along Harbor Blvd and the entrance to Disneyland. Room was large with 2 queens bed and a decent sized bathroom. Complimentary breakfast in the lobby is tea, coffee or juice, some donuts and apples. This was easy to grab something before heading to Disneyland. Staff were friendly and welcoming. You can also grab your Disneyland Tickets through them. This hotel would suit couples or families, rooms are only on ground or second floor (flight of stairs). Would definitely recommend for the great price and value received.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, simple and spacious - good family locaiton
Summary: The rooms were clean and nicely done.  The property looks very nice!  Well done!   I really appreciated the "adjoining room"; we really appreciated the additional room!  I wish I had known about this location earlier.  The floors could reallllly need a steam cleaning.  The price was acceptable for the area considering the space.  The continental breakfast is extremely simple and since a couple of us have dietary limitations, we were prepared and brought our own food.  Coffee was :( disappointing...and while traveling with kids, I really, really needed some good coffee.  But, for the price and space, it can't complain.  It was very well done outside on the property - looked great.  In all, I was pretty happy with the stay.  I gave the room "very good" because I would really

Summary Heading: Nice Looking In and Out, But That's Where It Stops.
Summary: Ok this hotel looked, nice inside and out. The location was great too, but thats where it stopped. We get there after calling the day ahead to arrange a late check in to find a very rude front desk clerk. Who apparently tried on charge our credit card, even though we weren't there yet. He informed my wife and it that he called our home number 3 times, even though it was known we were on the road.  Good thing his manager was there, she charged the 1st night and had us check in.  The room was nice, HOWEVER! Once you get in, there are a few problems.  For the $179 a night for the 2 bedroom sweet, I expect good WiFi, and Cable or Satellite TV that was advertised There was Wifi, However, poor signal and kept cutting in and out. I needed to complete some work remotely for a client.
Manager Response: Dear Mike N,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. Your feedback is extremely important to us. There seems to have been quite a few issues you have experienced during your stay. We would like to sincerely apologies to you in advance and our currently looking into this point by point. As a customer of our establishment we expect you to receive best of service at all times.

Summary: We visited here in April 2015, whilst the Star Wars Celebration was on. We stayed for a total of 2 weeks and I have to say enjoyed our time very much. The hotel though nothing fancy, was clean and functional. The beds were made every day and the towels were changed every day. The staff were friendly. The breakfast, though included in the cost was not very good; tea, coffee, orange juice and cakes and doughnuts, as a Brit cakes and doughnuts don't do it for me as breakfast. The drinks were fine. There is a small pool, we didn't really have time to make use of it, but it looked clean enough when we sat by it for a short time and other people had no problem using it. For those with cars, there is ample parking available onsite, again not something we took advantage of. This was

Summary Heading: Good location and great for larger families
Summary: We had a great stay in a 4 bed suite. We spent most of our time at Disneyland and really just needed a place to recharge in the evening. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable just what we needed. It was nice to have a document safe in room and a large fridge. Breakfast was as described muffins, danish, fruit which was a good start to the day. We knew this and bought some cereal and plastic spoons with us for our stay. CVS and ABC Market were very close to provide anything we needed and the Garden Walk directly across the street. Our room did not have a blowdryer however we did pack one and I believe had we needed one it would have been remedied. We had a later shuttle to catch and the front desk kindly assisted us in stowing our luggage in an unused room which was a

We stayed at the Islander Inn for 6 nights and were happy with our choice. It was clean, quiet, affordable and in a convenient location with friendly staff. The two queens and one sofa bed in the room were very handy for a family of four. The microwave and larger than average mini fridge were very useful. The continental breakfast was just that and nothing more (muffins, donuts, pastries, apples, coffee & juice) but that's a minor complaint. Adding some cereal and more fruit choices would go a long way but we stocked up at the local stores so it wasn't a big deal. All in all we were happy with the Islander Inn and would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Do you want to walk to Disneyland?
Summary: Located just a few minutes away from Disneyland..i came to Anaheim with my 2 adult children and i took a family room..they have two queen beds and another two double decker bed..wow..its really more than enough for us four & most importantly its value for money..there are eateries, walking distance..it is so convenient that has made my trip here a wonderful one..

This is a great place to stay with a large family. We had a 4-bed suite and it was enough room for everyone. Most of all we enjoyed being close to the front gates of Disneyland, it was only a 15 minute walk. The kids liked the pool here also, was warm enough to swim in. Breakfast is just doughnuts and danishes with coffee and juice, as described on the website. The room service is good, they clean up the rooms very nicely. Overall, no complaints and I will stay here again on my next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Good location, welcoming staff & good service
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed in one of the kids suites for 3 nights. As we were out at Disneyland and Knott's for Long days during our stay we really only needed the sleeping facilities and the grab and go breakfast, both of which were adequate for our needs. The rooms are of a good size and the staff at the front desk very friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance from Disneyland.

We stayed here for the third time at the beginning of April for 5 nights room 216. Room with two queens and a sofa bed. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff are friendly. There are two small negatives, although the carpets looked clean our socks and feet were dirty so maybe the carpets could do with a clean. The free breakfast wasn't to our liking, there were very sweet pastries and muffins. Cereal would have been a better option and it wouldn't have been difficult to provide either. We would stay there again on our next visit.

Summary Heading: Not what I expected at all
Summary: We are here for Celebration Anaheim , we tried to save some money on a hotel room by going outside the convention block but in the end we "paid" for it.   Outside area:  Decent .. The motel a few buildings down looks like a crack den from the outside. The pool is just nasty with a oil slick film on the surface , plus a sign that says the state of California recognize cancer causing agents in this area. Uh .. What?!?  The Room: The room is clean and plenty of room for 1-4 people. Mini fridge, coffee maker and microwave.  The TV .... The WORSE tv of any hotel/motel I've ever seen. They have a flatscreen with Antenna hookup!!! What year is this 1980?  The beds are ok , I like a soft bed....I'd say their about middle of the road in firmness. The pillow are HORRIBLE!  Ok so this is
Manager Response: Dear ericst1138  We appreciate you taking the time to review your stay. We sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay. These concerns are currently being looked into and corrective measures will be taken. We hope you would change your mind and give us another try so that we can make it up to you.

Summary: If you're looking for an affordable place to crash after a long day & night at Disneyland, this hotel would be just fine.  We visited during spring break this year, and booked a room with 2 queen beds.  The room had a bit of a funny smell, but dissipated after the A/C was turned on--maybe just leftover cleaning odors?  The room had a fridge, which was great, coffee maker & hair dryer in the bathroom.  The front desk staff were very friendly & efficient.  The "free breakfast" is nothing to speak of--a few stale pastries & mushy apples--we didn't bother.  We brought our own yogurt & fruit, so no big deal there.  There is a small swimming pool, closes at 10pm, so we never used it.  The only thing that was a negative was that there is major construction going on next door.  If you

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, quite and nicely located!!
Summary: This little gem is tucked in near Disneyland and The Anaheim Convention Center.  It is an excellent location, a nice facility and has the most gracious and efficient staff.  We will certainly stay here again!!  This was a well appointed room - not opulent - but nicely done and efficient. It has a fridge, microwave and full bath.  The continental breakfast was simple but sufficient.  It was really very quiet in a rather busy location.  We could see the fireworks of Disneyland from the walkway at our front door each evening.  We were walking distance from nice restaurants and the Anaheim Convention Center.  Economical and enjoyable.  The WiFi was free - just in case you wondered.  The swimming pool was small but very nice.  They have suites for families as well as smaller rooms.

Summary Heading: Great Family Value and Location for Disneyland
Summary: This 2-star motel-like property provides simple, family-friendly accommodations but excels at everything it does, giving it more of a 3-star hotel feel. The staff are excellent and much more helpful than typical properties in this category. The location is perfect for walking to the Disneyland main gate, about 15 minutes away by foot, and easily finding convenience stores, food, and shopping across the street. The hotel provides a simple continental breakfast with relatively early hours, but it's easy to pick up sandwiches, fruit, yogurt, juices, and other drinks at the CVS store on the way to the Disneyland gate.  Pros: --Nicely appointed, plain, small rooms and pleasant tropical landscaping --Clean --Small pool --Free, on-property parking --Suites available, as well as small
Manager Response: Dear AshlandJohn,  Thank you very much for taking the time to thoroughly review your stay. It always helps to give a clear picture to our potential future guests. Your recommendations and comments are extremely important to us and have been noted. We also encourage our guests to engage in dialog during their stay to help facilitate requests that can be accommodated. We really loved having you here and look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Okay, Figure You're Never in Room
Summary: Walkable distance to theme parks is main plus. Rooms are okay, nothing to brag about. Limited parking...small pool. Funky smell in our room. A place to lay your head and that's about it. Sounds exotic, nope think Motel 6 quality and you get the picture!
Manager Response: Dear Mark 107,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We sincerely apologize for your experience here at the islander. We always strive to make it the very best for all our customers. Sometimes we fall short. Your feedback reminds us that we need to keep excelling every day. We hope you decide to give us another try. Have a wonderful day!

Summary Heading: I was very pleased with this hotel and would stay again!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 1 week with my husband and 2 children. We reserved a 2 room (3 beds). Upon arrival was upgraded to the 2 room 4 beds. Very pleased with size of the room. Walking in there was 2 beds fridge/microwave in first room. 2nd room had 2 beds and little table/chairs. Both rooms equipped with tvs and own door into the bathroom. Pros- Very clean inside and out. Friendly staff willing to do what they can to help. Comfy beds Nice distance from restaurants,(1/2block) disneyland (1 1/2 blocks) convenient stores. Pool was great for swimming (not huge but 3 1/2 ft deep to 8 1/2) nice to take a swim in the afternoons. About the only con I would have is the breakfast. Mini muffins, pastry, orange juice, coffee, apples. Same everyday. Was ok a couple times but I wouldn't

Been meaning to write about this motel. Not a big fan. We stayed here during the holiday season. Our wall heater was very noisy which made sleeping really difficult. The room was cold so we had to run it and when it fired up it made clanking sounds but we were so tired we tried our best to sleep through it. Because I didn't address it with the manager until check out, all he said was I should have let him know early. No "I'm so sorry for your experience". Nothing. Let's just say he was not friendly. None of the staff was. Check in, the employee barely looked me in the eye or said anything for the most part. On a separate note, it's a long walk to Disneyland and we had little ones so we opted to cab it on the way home. The rooms are clean for the most part, nothing spectacular.
Manager Response: Dear Mari L, We sincerely apologize for your experience here at the Islander. Our goal is to always provide all our customers with the very best of service and value. We are currently reviewing your incident. Thank you for taking the time to let us know. We take all customer feedback very seriously. We hope you decide to give us another try so we can make it up to you. Thank you again. Have a wonderful day!

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Islander
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times and have not been disappointed.  The rooms are comfortable and always clean.  Office staff is friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is minimal but great for grabbing and going to the park.  We used to buy the resort trans tickets but tried without this time.  We save a lot of money by walking and our kids never once complained.  The walk is an easy 10-15 to the park entrance.  We've stayed at other hotels around Disneyland and always end up back at the Islander.

Summary Heading: Hospitality Plus at this Disneyland area hotel
Summary: I chose the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites for a two-night stay with my adult daughter, based on reviews on Trip Advisor.  We arrived on a Friday night, and were able to walk to Disney to have supper at Downtown Disney.  I asked for a room on the first floor, as there is no elevator, and my luggage was quite heavy.  Our room was spacious, immaculately clean, and had very comfortable beds. The bathroom had an accessible shower, and plenty of towels. I didn't mind that there wasn't a huge vanity, as the hotel had a lot of other positive aspects. Breakfast (muffins and pastries) was free, and there was a bus which is supposed to stop every 20 minutes right outside the hotel. If you are 65 or older, know that you should only pay $1 per ride, as some drivers don't mention this. We

Very convenient as well. Walking distance to both the convention hall and Disneyland.  The owners and staff are very polite and very accommodating.  It is a quaint old style motor court that has been completely tastefully renovated.  I can't emphasize how clean the rooms and grounds were. The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is their lack of a lobby and breakfast besides donuts.

We enjoyed a 3 night stay at this small independent hotel, chosen mainly from reviews on Tripadvisor. We are a family of 2 adults and 3 kids and had two rooms on the ground floor, 105 and 109. The location to Disney was great just a 10 minute walk. The rooms themselves were fine. 2 comfy king size beds in each. Decent bathroom. A safe in the wardrobe, fridge, coffee machine, large flat screen TV. Free wi fi. There is a small pool area. Plenty of free parking. There is also a free breakfast but it is very basic, just coffee orange juice and a selection of dougnuts and mini muffins. There is however a 7/11 within a 5 minute walk. You're also close to Anaheim garden walk which has lots of good restaurants. Soundproofing between floors not great and we did have noisy neighbors above

This was a great find for our family of 4 within easy walking distance to Disneyland.  The hotel was clean and quiet, with ample free parking.  We splurged for the 2 room suite for two nights because it was less than our one night in Los Angeles.  Loved having so much space for our luggage.  Only pastries for breakfast, but the huge CVS nearby had nearly a full grocery inside.  This was a great value for the price and we highly recommend Anaheim Islander Inn.
Manager Response: Dear Klvoelker,  Thank you very much for your kind and supportive words. We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to review us. Yes, our continental breakfast is rather modest consisting of Danish pastries, donuts, muffins, apples, orange juice and fresh brewed coffee. The suites are very popular amongst our patrons and offers great value for large families’ as it includes LCD TV’s in two rooms and a Refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. There are many convenient stores like the new 24 hour CVS and 7 eleven within a 3 minute walk. Many thanks again for electing to recommend our business.

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, great service & clean room
Summary: Our 2 bedroom family suite was quite large, very clean and comfortable. We walked across the street to City Walk for dinner, had a good night's sleep and enjoyed the breakfast before heading to Disneyland. The desk clerk was really helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. When I booked it, I was a bit anxious because of the low price, but all my worries disappeared as we checked in. We definitely recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Great Value hotel Clean and perfect location
Summary: We arrived to the hotel and had a friendly and speedy check in. This is a small hotel (which I like) we stayed in room 216 it was a larger room with 2 beds and a sofa bed. The bathroom is small but the rest of the room is pretty large. Everything was very clean. The desk has a mirror that worked perfect for a vanity.The pool is a basic hotel pool but was very clean. Beds were very comfortable. The only thing I recommend is they add a floor lamp in the room close to the sofa bed as it gets somewhat dark over there. We will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great value for what it offers
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights during a trip to Disneyland. The distance is about a 10-15 mins walk, and there is also a CVS pharmacy and 7-11 about 5 mins away.
