The rooms are basic but  well maintained and quite large in size. The beds are comfortable especially after a long day at Disneyland. The breakfast is very very basic- orange juice, coffee, doughnuts, small muffins, apples, and that's about it. Wifi signal was strong. We requested a room towards the back and away from the road, and it was very quiet. The front staff is attentive and helpful- we stored our luggage at the front desk for the day before an evening night. I would stay at this hotel again if I was in the area.

We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  The location was great and the room was very nice and very quiet.  We received excellent service from the front desk.  I would definitely stay here again and would recommend for a family or for a business trip.

Our family of 4 (2 children ages 6 and 10) stayed here in January 2015 in a 2 room suite. Rooms were very clean and beds were comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly - they even let us keep our luggage in the room for the day we checked out as we had a night time flight! Location is fantastic across the road from various places to eat and an easy walk to Disneyland. There was free parking and the staff were helpful in booking tours and taxis etc. For the price and location you wont find better!

Just what we were looking for a place to sleep, clean room, 10min walk to the park We will stay here again.  Muy buen lugar para descansar, cuartos limpios , a 10 minutos caminando al parque lo recomindo.

I booked this place based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and I was not dissappointed. We stayed in a room on the second floor and it was perfect. It was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom looked like it had been recently remodeled. The hotel doesn't really have a check-in time so when we arrived at 9am they had our room already ready for us. The workers are very friendly and helpful if you have any questions. It's about a 10-12min walk to Disneyland from this hotel and its also right across the street from Bubba Gumps and some other restaurants.  I would definitely stay here again when I come to Disneyland. If you're looking for a reasonably priced and simple place to stay when taking a trip to Disneyland this is the perfect place to stay.

Summary Heading: Very good for low cost traveler convenient clean
Summary: This is an older  slightly old fashioned motel  Clean and with the 2 room suites a great deal for families while it is old it is well maintained  a close walk to Disney and easy parking only negative is it states breakfasts  include but what is provided is cereal  some Danishes  and very average orange juice and coffee with no milk b in the office which you can take back to your room room does have fridge microwave and coffee maker I would stay again  Also has a self use laundy

Summary Heading: nice and cozy place; better than holiday inn
Summary: So I stayed at this place around a month ago before Christmas and I have to say that this place is better than the holiday Inn next door. We had a convention at the other hotel and needed a check in around midnight. So if we can get a place to put our stuff and get the room ready that would be nice. Holiday Inn wouldn't let us do that ( check in and then get in after midnight since our convention ends around then). Here, the guy at the check in allowed us to do that, put our bags in the room, and go to our convention. Props to AJ for helping us with the extra convenience on our trip and to understand the importance of our priorities ( customer first).  Overall, the place is neat and clean. I didn't expect like a five star hotel but it had everything that we needed. There was a

Summary Heading: Just what we needed - wonderful stay!!
Summary: I was so impressed by this hotel!  My family of 5 came to Anaheim for a weekend at Disneyland.  We got the 2 room suite with 2 queen beds in each room which was just perfect.  It was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, which is faster than parking your car at Disneyland and taking the tram.  Here are my pros & cons...  Pros: Clean and spacious rooms Comfortable beds Great water pressure in the shower Several USB outlets, perfect to charge cell phones (my kids loved that!) Free parking Easy walk to Disneyland Amazing staff  Cons: Wi-Fi was spotty to non-existent Small bathroom Limited TV channels "Breakfast" is more like a mini snack - apples & mini muffins  Overall, we had a wonderful stay.  Considering we were there for the Disneyland trip, it served our needs.  The staff is
Manager Response: Dear Kelly S,  Thank you for being one of the first to review us in 2015. These reviews customers make informed decisions & we learn about our strengths & weaknesses which helps us tremendously in making improvements. We are currently in the process of improving our TV channel line up & also increasing our Wi-Fi bandwidth and strength. Being a small establishment we try to do a very best within a given budget. Hope to see you again soon. Have a wonderful 2015!

Summary: After a horrible, frustrating day of delayed travel and lost luggage we arrived at the islander inn in hopes that at the very least our luck hadn't completly run out and we still had our reservation! A reservation we indeed had, and the staff made our horrible day a little better with check in going smooth and quickly (with an added bonus that we had been given a bigger room for no extra charge).  The rooms at this hotel are spacious and very clean, and have everything one would need. Fridge, microwave, safe are just added bonuses!  I had booked our stay via Expedia and had received a very reasonable rate, exactly what I was hoping for, for a quick trip to Disneyland before the holidays! The hotel is about a 10-15 walk from the park, but there are buses available that stop

Been so many hotels at disneyland. From big hotels to small hotels and for the first time I am very pleased with everything:  cleanliness, the amenities, free parking, free wifi, very courtesy front desk person give us a suit room good for family of 6, comfortable bed, very convenient cuz its walking distance from everything and was a quite hotel and very reasonable price compare to big hotels. we will definitely come back here and will recommend.

Had 1 day park hopper tickets for the Happiest Place on Earth with the family and looked for a decent bargain place that would allow us to spend more $$ in the park and not on a bed just because it was close to the park. We were pleasantly surprised. Clean rooms, wonderful distance from Disneyland, FREE parking, WiFi, decent continental breakfast, VERY friendly desk people and willing t ensure you had a pleasant stay. We will definitely be back soon!

We just loved everything about this hotel. We arrived off an early morning flight from Australia and at 10.00am Dilip told us our room was ready even though we knew we weren't able to check in till 2.00pm. He told us that we could have a room and if we didn't like the room we could change it later in the day. How impressed we were! We were given a very comfortable room and we appreciated being able to be there so early without any extra charge. We didn't have to change our room - it was just great! So very close to Disneyland, CVS, restaurants and anything else you may need while staying in Anaheim. To top it all off, we were catching a bus to Las Vegas on our third day. We were unsure where we had to go to catch the bus so Dilip told us that Judy (his wife) would happily drive

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. My daughter arrived a day early due to weather I was not able to join her until the next day. The staff went out of there way to let her stay in the room until I got there that night without paying for the room. No other place would do this. The rooms were exceptionally clean and well  decorated. The walk to Disney was about 10 minutes. I can't say enough for this small motel. We will definitely stay here again. The only down fall is the tv channels are very limited. Other than that it was exceptional.  the staff and, housekeeping went out of there way to make sure our stay with them was a great experience. Thank you Islander for a wonderful stay. The Soria/Huerta Family .

we stayed at this inn and suites and loved it. very close to disney, the room was clean and nice, and the service was great! close by there we found a restaurant, and some shops, so we walk there from the hotel. its the best place to stay and the price was good, and we will come back to the islander!!

Summary Heading: Very Nice hotel near Disneyland/Convention Center
Summary: Thanks for your hospitality. We stayed in a double room because there were four of us. It was very nice and worked out very well for our purposes because it had four queen beds. The room was clean and quiet. It was very convenient to the Convention Center where we were attending an event. Nothing grand, mind you, but perfectly fine for our needs. All-in-all a great experience and one I would repeat again.

Summary Heading: Good but will probably not stay here again
Summary: We  have annual passes to Disneyland and came for 9 days.  I was reluctant when my told me she booked this place but I was very happily surprised.  The downside for me was the air conditioning as it was hit and miss if it would be cool and usually wasn't.  It was cooler outside than our room would get.  The cable channels were another let down, they had a lot of Asian and Spanish and very little for English channels.  My other complaint which isn't the motels fault but I have to mention it is the ART shuttle.  Save your money and walk.  They say every 20 minutes but a manger told me that's not written in stonw when I complained that it was more like 25 or 30 minutes and never on time, We threw our tickets in the trash and drove.  There are plenty of restaurants (Cheesecake
Manager Response: Dear John K,  Thank you very much for taking the time to give us your feedback. We sincerely apologize for the difficulties you had during your stay. For future reference please do let us know whenever you have any issues so we could attend to them immediately by fixing or replacing the air conditioner unit or moving you to another room.  Sorry about the cable channel lineup. We are currently in the process of installing a new cable channel system throughout our establishment.  We hope you decide to give us another chance. As a Disney annual pass holder you are entitled to a special discount when you book directly on our website. Have a wonderful new year!

Summary: This little guy is about a 10/15 minute walk from Disneyland and CA Adventure Park. We chose it as we are a large family of seven, and got two rooms together (as requested) at a very reasonable price over Thanksgiving weekend. We had two very spacious and clean rooms. It is very simple and basic, but that is exactly what we wanted. Housekeeping was thorough, and everything seemed in good repair. Our rooms had small refrigerators, bigger than mini-bar size, but we ended up unplugging ours due to the loud hum. If you need perfect quiet, this is not the place for you. We weren't awakened from our sleep, but families come in late from parks/travel and leave early for the same, so noise can be a factor. Not overly loud, but present. Be advised that breakfast in the lobby is VERY

Pros: Great location around 15 minute easy stroll to Disneyland and restaurants around 5 minutes walk across the street. Room was very clean with 2 comfortable beds,small fridge,microwave and table with 2 chairs. Bathroom shower over bath and very clean.Safe in room with decent size area to hang clothes. The guest's laundry was fantastic both washer and dryer worked well. Cons: We were on the ground floor where you hear every movement guests make upstairs so I would suggest you ask for rooms starting with a 2 on the first floor. Towels in bathroom are tiny more like a shower mat so if you are a bigger person this could be an issue. Whilst beds are comfortable the pillows could do with an upgrade all pillows in our room were lumpy  Overall a pleasant stay in a budget hotel.

Just returned from a stay at the Anaheim Islander hotel.  After reading the reviews - and checking the prices - I booked.  The room was spacious - 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa, so it could easily sleep 6. I liked the hardwood style floors instead of rugs . It had a microwave & large refrigerator.  Bathroom was fine - very clean and updated.  Could probably use another shelf below the sink to store some things. - Hairdryer was very powerful - Had a large safe - big enough for a laptop!  I was on the first floor - near the office - had no problems with noise. Nice little continental breakfast with danishes, juice & coffee. It was a short walk to Disneyland - had loads of restaurants down the street on Katella - had no problem booking a Super Shuttle from there to the airport.

Summary Heading: Clean new n friendly well located esp fr non car drivers
Summary: Stayed frm 31oct - 8nov .. First entered room gave us a warm cosy feeling.Room smells good n very clean. Love the window blind concept. Fully furnished wz micro fridge n lcd tv. Pankaj n AJ were very helpful , understanding n informative. Will def recommend this property. Well done Anaheim Islander Inn.

Summary Heading: Cheaper alternative for a Disneyland holiday
Summary: The location is within walking distance to Disneyland and various restaurants along Katella. The rooms were spacious, clean and value for money. Service was great and went out of their way to accommodate us. However I would recommend asking for a room on the upper level as the noise from above can be rather intrusive. We seemed to have a herd of elephants in the room above us.

Our family , consisting of our special needs adult daughter , our son, daughter-in-law , grandchildren aged 4 and 8, my husband and myself stayed for 2 nights at the islander , November 11 and 12 2014.   We found it to be very clean, the staff very accommodating and the distance from the Disney gates worked for us. Quiet for sleeping.  Fridge, microwave good.  Good for group. Bathroom very small- but clean and lots of clean towels.  We were allowed to keep our car parked there on our check out day until 5--- bonus. Across the street from garden walk-- lots of great restaurants. I would definitely recommend the islander and stay there again. Very enjoyable stY

After months of searching for a affordable and clean hotel we decided to book with this hotel. I browsed the Internet for about two months trying to find something that met my families needs/expectations. It was extremely clean and about a 10 min walk to disneyland. I am a very light sleeper and I was able to go to sleep with no problem. I had asked ahead of time for a room on the top floor so I wouldn't have to hear people walking above and they were able to do that for us. Overall we had a great stay and we will be returning!

My husband and I stayed here for an affordable trip to Disneyland. We were looking for somewhere that was affordable, withing walking distance to Disneyland, and clean. This motel met all these expectations (positive!)  Some notes (slightly negative): The "breakfast" included is actually a few danishes, apples, and oranges. NOT a full breakfast by any means, and not great if you're looking to fill up on something before you head to a busy day at Disneyland where we all know the food is pricey. We took advantage of the minifridge and nearby convenience store and got stuff to make some PB&J's and have Greek Yogurt for breakfast instead. Somewhat disappointing since we had hoped to get something filling to start a busy day with a lot of walking.  When we arrived, there was a woman

I have been staying at this hotel since the 80's With no problems!!!! its a great location,Friendly office staff. rooms are nice and big for family's of all sizes.However I think they may have A problem with one of there room maids! We check in and immediately went to Disneyland. That evening we found my room had left over personal toiletries from prior guest in room, Rubber bands on floor, Carpet made our feet Black (dirty)!  two of our bath towels were dirty from prior guest! One of our Beds the sheets were not change from Prior Guest also. I did not complain to front desk but did speak with the maid the next morning. Next time I will check room towels, sheets, etc prior to taking off to Disneyland!!!
Manager Response: Dear Brenda K,  We appreciate you taking the time to review your stay. We sincerely apologize for the above mentioned incident. This matter is currently being investigated. Our goal is to always provide the best possible service to all our customers. We hope you would give us a second chance so that we could make it up to you.

Summary: This is a great hotel for families or couples visiting Disney. Only a 10 min walk away so no need for shuttle buses. Close to resteraunts and a CVS which was handy for take away sandwiches, snacks etc. Rooms were big and clean and staff were extremely helpful.  Could have been more storage space for toiletries in bathroom especially when four people in one room but everything else ideal. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed as we were visiting disneyland, the hotel is in a fantastic location very close to Disneyland, only a short walk away. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. The staff were helpful and friendly. Would've liked more variety at breakfast, other than that it was perfect.

Yes, clean rooms, comfy beds and AJ was great to deal with. However, it's NOISY.  The walls are thin (unfortunately we were located next door to a man who sounded like he was coughing up a fur ball at 6.30am every morning!!!)  The bathroom was SMALL (and noisy) and it was impossible to watch the TV in your room at night when you felt like blobbing with the air con on because…..it's too noisy!!!!  Shame, it's in a good location but we wouldn't stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Diane,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We sincerely apologies for the less than perfect stay you had at our establishment.  We really hope that you would change your mind and give us another try so we could make it up to you. Our constant goal is to make sure that all our customers get the very best of service and experience always.

Summary: We found the Islander Inn & Suites to be an excellent value.  The room was clean, comfortable, and a convenient walking distance to Disneyland and many restaurants.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We skipped the sugary breakfast treats and opted for a healthier fare at nearby restaurants.  Not the fault of the hotel but the local bus system was not terribly punctual, as we found that we could have walked to Disneyland in half the time that it took the bus.  A bit more counter space in the bathroom would have been nice.  We would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great Family hotel if you're off to Disneyland
Summary: If you are looking for a budget hotel with large spacious room that's within walking distance of Disneyland, I'd recommend the Islander Inn. The rooms are massive.  We had a family of 5 and we fitted in no problems.  Rooms have two queen beds and a large fold down couch bed.  There was enough floor space for us to also lay a down single airbed down at nights. The location is really handy.  You can park your car for free and walk the 10 - 12 minutes to Disneyland (a big saving on parking at Disneyland).  A CVS and a 7-Eleven are located 1 - 2 mins walk away.  There's heaps of eating places (like The Cheesecake Factory) really close by.  Access to the I-5 is only 2 -3 mins down the road. If you're booking, ask for a room with a newer conditioning unit.  The air con in the first

This was at least our third time staying here over the past few years.  The rooms are always clean and the staff very friendly.  If any issues arise they deal with it right away.  They even let us check in early when we arrived ahead of schedule.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: I chose to book a room at the Islander Inn because of all of the positive reviews.  I was not disappointed.  We had booked a room with 2 beds and a sofabed.  The room was spacious and clean.  The bathroom had plenty of towels for the 5 of us.  I hate when you book a hotel room, especially one with this many beds, and they only give you 2 or 3 towels.  Not a problem here.  Parking is tight, only 1 space per room, but fortunately people parked between the lines (another pet peeve of mine is when they park over the line and essentially make one space unusable). The staff was very friendly and helpful.  There is a small breakfast of pastries, juice, coffee and tea.  We had some of the juice and coffee but brought our own breakfast food, as my husband and son have a gluten allergy.

We recently stayed here for 10 days and 9 nights with my husband and 2 teenage boys.  The rooms were really clean and the people at the front desk were so incredibly helpful.  This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in.  It is a 10 minute walk from Disneyland which was really good as you weren't caught up in the hustle and bustle of people at the end of the day coming out of Disneyland and trying to cross the road.  This hotel is close to a lot of restaurants across the road and a 1 minute walk to seven 11 and CVS pharmacy.  It had a nice swimming pool for the kids and also a laundry.  Breakfast included every day.  I would not hesitate to book this again it really was a fantastic budget, clean and extremely friendly Inn.

We stayed three nights here in a 2 bedroom suite with 2 Queen beds in each room. The rooms are really big and there is a Jack and Jill bathroom, which is quite small. We were on the upper floor, on the opposite side from the next door hotel construction and it was quiet and sunny. The property is well cared for with palm trees and climbing plants along the balconies. Unfortunately when we checked in we discovered the main room had an unpleasant smell. The amazing AJ on the front desk immediately carried in a replacement fridge in case that was the cause of the problem. However we then established that the carpet was wet and it appeared that the fridge had been switched off and had defrosted and overflowed. AJ offered to move us to another suite and was happy to show it to us but

Having done some research prior to booking, I settled on the Islander Inn and Suites as it seemed to be in a good location and comfortable enough to suit our needs-and I was right. I can wholeheartedly recommend the Islander- it is small enough to offer a personal, friendly service; but still manages to offer spacious comfortable rooms. The staff are excellent, friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable and modern; and the location is ideal- so close to places to eat, shop and of course to Disney. There is a shuttle stop right outside the hotel to Disney, where you can then access other shuttles to go further afield if you want to. The pool is clean and well maintained. Overall, we had no complaints and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Islander to anyone, and would

We stayed three nights at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites for our first visit to Disneyland.  I had made our reservations months in advance and confirmed several days before our travel.  The property was exactly what we expected after research; small with outside entrances, and a short walk to Disneyland.  The front desk staff was pleasant and assisted us with our shuttle return to the airport as well as very kindly printing out our boarding passes for our flight home.  My main criteria for a hotel is cleanliness ~ the housekeeping staff did an excellent job of keeping our room clean and neat; with special focus on the bathroom which is of utmost importance to us ~ even the faucets were sparkling!  As another reviewer noted, the carpets could use a good cleaning; we just

Summary Heading: 10 people and not plenty of privacy.
Summary: We had a wonderful time thanks to the comfort of your suite. 10 people and we still had plenty of room. The separate living room area was a plus. When some wanted to rest and others were still full of energy all you had to do was shut the door and ahhhh... Peace and quiet. Lol. The only thing that would have made it any better would have been a fan in the living room area. When you closed the door it did get quite warm. Thank you for the great stay and we will be back. That was out second stay with you and have been more than pleased.

First, I want to say, I would stay here again.  The rooms are very clean and the housekeeping staff are wonderful people to deal with.  The location and proximity to Disneyland is adequate - a good 15 minute walk.   The parking spaces are nice and wide which made finding a place to park sometimes difficult as there are fewer available spaces.  I am okay with this trade-off.  My only issue was at check-in. We had 5 adults and had made a reservation for two rooms months before. Since I talked to them personally, and had restated my reservation requirements before booking, I took the reservation numbers over the phone and wrote them and the prices down.  I had reserved a standard room (for my wife and myself) and a two bedroom suite (for our 3 companions). Upon arrival, I was
Manager Response: Dear Tomahawk06,  Thank you for taking the time to write to us. We sincerely do apologize for the misunderstanding and are currently looking in to it. We always try to provide the best service possible by providing the room type reserved or an upgrade whenever possible. We thank you again for staying with us and hope to see you here soon.

Summary: We have stayed here three times and we love the 2 room suite. There is so much room. Its a nice and quite place. Great pool and nice choice of donuts in the morning. The beds are comfortable. Also the ART picks up right in front but its also an easy walk to Disneyland. A.J who works there is super nice as well as the rest of the Staff. We will back in December! We can't wait to stay here again. The only thing I have to complain about is the carpet in room it turns our feet black but thats it! Thank you Islander inn! See ya soon.

Stayed here for 6 nights in this Aug to visit to Disneyland. It took us less than an hour by super shuttle from LAX to get here.  It took us (44 & 17) good 15 minutes to/from Disneyland - to was easy but from was rather daunting after spending 12 hours playing hard in Disneyland under the Californian sun. There always were a few taxis by the entrance so if you find it hard to walk back to the inn, you can hop in one.  There were many restaurants and a couple of grocery shops along the way to/from the inn and many people were walking back to their hotels nearby so even around midnight we 2 females didn't find it unsafe to walk back to our hotel. (However, there were some people who made benches into their beds at a couple of bus stops near the inn but they were harmless.) As a

Summary Heading: Great location at the right price!
Summary: Great rate  with an excellent location (10-15 walk to Disney) and a very clean room!  The inn also has a  ART bus stop right out front if  you don't feel like walking.  My wife and I will definitely be staying here again and will be recommending this hotel to friends and family.  P.S. they also offer coffee and  pastries in the main office!

Summary Heading: Great family stay close to disneyland
Summary: We visited this hotel Aug 7,2014 and found it to be a great place for a family stay. the staff was real friendly and had advise for our stay. there was 4 adults and a 2 year old and we stayed in a two bedroom suite. The beds were comfy and there was lots of room. the pool was small but warm and had loungers and was very clean. There was a free continental breakfast which had danish muffins cookies, apples ,juice and coffee. This was the way we started every morning. the hotel is easy to find and is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland gates. There are lots of restaurants close by like Cheesecake Factory (5 minute walk) and Bubba Gumps across the street.Also there was a 7-11 just a short walk away.The rooms were clean and the maids did an excellent job with supplying towels and

Summary Heading: No-frills but clean and great location
Summary: This is definitely a no-frills hotel as basic amenities you get at most other hotels such as rooms having cable TV (no ESPN!) and an alarm clock are not included. But the rooms are good sized and are very clean. The beds are comfortable and the A/C works well. The location is fantastic as it's only a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland and there are several restaurants to choose from within a 5 minute walk. The continental breakfast is very basic (some muffins, danishes, donuts, and apples). The front desk was very friendly and helpful. There is no shared computer or printer available for guest use, but the gentleman behind the front desk kindly printed out several documents that I needed. If you just need a hotel to sleep in and plan to spend the rest of your time out and about,

I enjoyed it with the kids, the bus to Disney right in front the Inn. The Management is really helpfull. Had to wash clothes and everything was there, even soap I could buy. Stay this way, Islander Inn.

My daughter(18), her best friend and I stayed here August 6-10. I had booked hotel due to rate, previous reviews and location. We stayed in a two queen room, which was perfect for us three girls. The room was clean and quiet, bed was comfy, air conditioner worked great( we froze the first night) and it was nice to have a refrigerator as well. It was perfect to be directly across the street from The Garden walk, as there are many good restaurant choices. It is a very easy 15 minute(1 mile) walk to the front gate of the parks. In the evening, being that we were tired and it was dark, we took a cab right from the front of Disneyland back to the hotel and it was only $6.  Well worth the safety and convenience! I am pretty particular, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is

One night stay with my girlfriend for a day at disneyland. The great appeal of this hotel is its excellent location. It is a mere 15minute walk from disney at half the price of most of the neighbouring hotels. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were attentive and informative. They were kind enough to allow us to park at the hotel even after we had checked out. No complaints. Would recommend to anyone on a budget.

We went to Disneyland during spring break vacation in March.  Staff was very attentive! We had originally booked a room with bunk beds (2 young boys) and when we arrived, the very kind man at the front desk (I forgot his name!) offered us an upgrade to a suite at no extra charge! Room was very clean and the kids enjoyed the swimming pool. There are plenty of places within walking distance to grab a bite to eat.  We walked to Disneyland and did pretty well (kids were excited and did not complain about the distance, which is not far to begin with). We just HAD to ride the shuttle back from Disneyland due to being exhausted. One of the shuttle drop offs was right in front of the hotel! I highly recommend this hotel. We are DEFINITELY going to stay here again should we go to

Summary Heading: Great Stay!  Clean Rooms! Close to Disneyland!
Summary: We took our family here(8 people) and this hotel was great!  The rooms were very clean and property was kept up very nice.  It was close to Disneyland so we all could walked over.  There is a mall strip close enough to walk for more restaurant choices.  Starbucks is close.   This was our first trip to Disneyland with our grand-daughter.  The hotel room being large, was key.  She was able to play in the pool, and walk to Disneyland.  Definitely budget friendly!  We are already planning our next stay here.   Thank you again!!
Manager Response: Dear Zrugrats4.  Thank you for making the Islander your hub for a budget friendly stay. We have a variety of different room types listed on our website with pictures and detail to appeal to all types of travelers. We really enjoyed having you and your grand-daughter this summer and hope to see you all here soon on your next Disney excursion.

Summary Heading: Great value, friendly staff/owners, very close to Disneyland
Summary: We've been staying at this location for the last 4 years, we go to Anaheim at least 2-3 times a year. When you arrive at a location and they greet you by your first name, you know you're in the right place. The rooms we book vary on the trip we're making to say the least we tried all 3 types including the 2 room suite (my favorite), It's a owner operated location and he's there every day, so he gives a lot of attention and listens to when someone has advise for improvements, therefore yes there has been really great improvements at the location, rooms are clean, well maintained, they're family oriented rooms, however I do agree with one of the reviews a room or location with a computer/printer for business travelers or other uses would be fantastic. In all it has great
Manager Response: Dear Sirdjandmore,  We really value your continued loyalty and friendship. Your advise and insight is always loved and welcomed here. Thank you again for referring us to your friends.  We always like to go the extra mile to make all our guests stay a memorable one.

Summary: Family of 4 just finished our 7 night stay at the Islander. We have stayed at other Disneyland good neighbour hotels over the years. This trip we wanted a bit more space for our teenagers but keeping the budget in mind. After using trip advisor for hotel reviews we came upon this wonderful choice. We got the 3 bed suite with private door. Rooms were spacious, clean and quiet. Beds were very comfy. Front desk service was great and attentive helping with tours and shuttle service. There is pastries and a bit of fruit. We picked up some additional breakfast items and ate in our room. Made use of fridge.  Pool is not huge but clean and refreshing after a long day at the resort. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to DIsneyland.  We used the ART transit a few times to and from the park.
Manager Response: Dear Sunwanabe007  We are thrilled that you enjoyed a weeks stay here at the Islander. Thank you very much for taking the time to write about your stay. We love it when our customers let us know how we are doing. Our friendly staff is always more than happy to help all our guests with booking tours, transportation or just plain simple planning advice. We sincerely look forward to having you back here on your next Disney adventure!

Summary: We stayed here because of the location. It is a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland/California Adventure. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. Maid service was excellent. There are several good restaurants nearby. Even though there was construction going on next door, we were not bothered by it. Overall, it is an inexpensive place to stay.  My only complaint is that they do not have a computer devoted to printing border passes. Luckily the Red Lion, down the street let us print them there.
Manager Response: Dear grccamanisland,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are really appreciate your descriptive review. this really helps future potential customers making informed decisions. However on the subject of printing your bording pass. We provide access to all our guests requiring to print material or check emails or send faxes at our onsite business center. We sincerely apologize that you were not made aware of this. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: We stayed here because of all the good reviews.  We booked the family suite and my teenagers like it because the bunk beds were regular size unlike the hotel we stayed at last year.  The staff at the desk was nice and the price was good.  We stayed two nights.  We had some issues with housekeeping. Our first night we walked in to the room and there was a dirty sock on the floor.  As we were walking through the room we found an empty bottle and plastic cups on the floor, half under the bed.  The second night my husband noticed that even though we had just taken showers, our feet were dirty (almost black) from walking on the carpet barefoot.  Also after spending over 13 hours at Disneyland in temps in the 90's we returned to our room and the air conditioning had been shut off, we
Manager Response: Dear Sir,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. One of our main goals is to provide excellent customer service throughout your stay. I sincerely apologize that we fell short in this area during your stay. We are currently looking into this incident. We hope that you decide to stay with us again so we could make it up to you. Thank you again for letting us know.

Summary: Very clean, very nice.  Close to Disney (close walk), staff very friendly and helpful.  Pool is a little small, no pool towels, but very clean.  Mattresses could be a little firmer.  Reasonable restaurants close by, all walkable.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and friendly staff.
Summary: My family and I just stayed at the hotel.  Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were a good size for a family of 4. Rooms were very clean and nice. Maids did a great job every day with cleaning up the rooms. Hotel is very close to Disneyland. I feel a easy walk to both parks. Lots of great places close by the hotel to eat. We went swimming every night in the hotel pool. It was nice and clean. great hotel for the price..... will return............

We recently spent two nights at the Anaheim Islander during a trip to Disneyland. We had not booked a hotel prior to our arrival in Anaheim. We had stayed at the Islander before and had a very positive experience, so I inquired at the front desk as to whether they had any last minute vacancies. The young gentleman at the front desk was exceptionally welcoming and offered us a special walk in rate that was far below what we would have paid had we attempted to book the room online. Check-in was very quick and efficient, and we were on our way to our room in no time. We had some difficulty with our room's key card, so I returned to the office to report this. The front desk clerk checked the keys, said that they appeared to be in good working order, and then was kind enough to

Our last minute find as we were traveling across country was only made possible by the efforts of Joshua (shift manager) and his night crew.  A few minor hotel rules were waived for us just so my special needs family could have a place to stay and at the same time be comfortable as we made our long move from Washington State to Texas.  The hotel itself couldn't have been better to our liking and would be my choice if we were to ever return to the LA area. Thank You

We have stayed at the Anaheim Islander several times and keep coming back because the rooms are spacious and clean and the staff are courteous. We normally book the option with two connecting rooms.  Each room has two queen beds.  This works out great as when we have booked two rooms at most other hotels, getting adjoining rooms or rooms anywhere near each other is difficult.  This visit, we booked the option with a sofa bed and two queen beds.  The sofa bed was well maintained and east to pull out.  Our kids (7 and 9) shared it and had no complaints.  The walk to Disneyland is reasonable but if you aren't a walker, the local shuttle is available for a fee.  Juice, coffee, apples, and pastries/muffins are offered for the complimentary breakfast.  Highly recommend this place!  :)

The suite was huge!  Our kids could stay and do their thing in the room with two beds while my husband and I could shut the door and enjoy a large room to ourselves.  The hotel was quiet and at a great location.  A good value for the money.  Complimentary breakfast was a small selection of sweets (donuts, muffins, pastries) and very, very small cups of coffee and juice.

I have stayed here four times now and each time I have left somewhat depressed. The location is prime as its opposite a 7/11, pizza parlour, subway, chinese takeaway, cheesecake factory to name a few. There is also a Target supermarket round the corner (about 4 blocks) along with a few fast food places such as Carls Jr and Jack. The biggest neighbour is Disneyland which is only a 20 minutes leisurely stroll (you can see the tower of terror from the hotel and even hear the screams).  The rooms are clean and tidy and well equipped although they're  not the most modern but how much of the time do you intend on staying in your room with the whole of California to explore?  The unattended pool is clean and big enough for the size of the hotel. There were a few flies and bugs in the

Loved this hotel! Rooms were huge, very spacious and clean. The location was perfect, a block away from the entrance to Disneyland. We stayed for 5 days and was centrally located to all that we wanted to do. From Disneyland to Legoland to Universal Studios, perfect. I would definitely recommend the Anaheim Island Inn & Suites to friends and family.

This hotel is right near Disneyland--walking distance if you want. The hotel is quiet and comfortable. Clean, friendly staff. I have stayed here before and will always stay here. I really think the prices are great. You even get a continental breakfast. Great for families too. Nice spacious rooms. Swimming pool, free parking for guests. What more could you ask for!!!
Manager Response: Dear Kathy C,  Thank you for all the kind words. We really enjoyed having you folks here as our guest. It’s great to hear form our customers that we are doing a wonderful job. It’s a fantastic motivator to all our staff. We hope to see you here soon on your next adventure! Best Regards to you from all of us here at the Islander.

Summary: I did my share of research for this trip, a birthday celebration.  I selected this property for a number of reasons.  Close to the Disney parks, excellent Tripadvisor reviews and several affordable eateries nearby.  Staff was courteous and professional, property clean and well maintained.  Our room was ready and perfect for our needs.  I look forward to my next visit and highly recommend The Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites!

Summary Heading: A really good bargain in an expensive area
Summary: For years we had always wanted to spend a few days at the Disneyland Hotel and theme park and so when the grandkids reached a suitable age we thought the six of us could finally realize this dream. However, after being quoted about $4500 for the three days we decided to look somewhere else and we found the Anaheim Islander to be a real bargain on TripAdvisor. The Islander is located just southeast of Disneyland. The hotel is a classic two-story u-shaped building with rooms opening to the outside. It has a modest sized pool area and the clean rooms have a mini-refrigerator, a microwave, flat panel TVs, an iron, and a web connection we did not use. We stayed on the second floor to ensure a little more quiet, but currently there is a big ongoing construction project just adjacent

We had a great experience at the Islander Inn. It was clean, big and very nice. The front desk was very nice and helpful. Parking was a little tight but manageable and the price was reasonable. Close to everything, our family from Hawaii and I enjoyed it.

As a group of mates travelling from Australia we stayed in a 3 bed room. The check in process was a breeze and the room was clean.   It's in a good location and is a short walk to everything. It took about 10mins to walk to Disneyland. There is also plenty of places to eat and shop in the area.   Definitely recommend staying here!

Arrived early not expecting our room to be ready after a long flight from Australia with  my mother & daughter. Staff could not be more helpful and we were taken straight to a great room. We had a 2 bedroom hotel room with 3 queen size beds , 2 TVs and good bathroom. Very clean and a I loved having a laundry. Breakfast was donuts, pastries, coffee & tea served in reception. Opposite is Bubba Gummps and the cheese cake factory and the Ihop is not far up the room. we would stay there again in a heart beat.

Stayed two nights with my wife and nephew May 31/Jun 01, in one of the 'Kids' rooms which included 2 queen beds and a bunk bed for kids.  Amenities included a small refrigerator and microwave which was very handy.  The room itself was clean and well maintained.  Parking is a little tight if you have anything larger than a midsize car/suv.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Maybe a little less than a mile from the Disney main entrance.  Very walkable in the morning when the excitement and your body is still fresh.  The #8 ART bus stops right outside the hotel, so for a $5 all day pass, it's well worth the money.  As another reviewer mentioned, it's also very close to the Anaheim GardenWalk which has numerous restaurants and shops.  We have stayed at numerous hotels (Carousel,

More a motel, close to Disneyland. Easy parking and check in, room on 2nd (top) floor, two double beds, tv, fridge, microwave. There is a swimming pool. Breakfast grab and go pastry and apples. Disneyland 15 minute walk away. Fine to stay here for the parks, close to Angels baseball stadium, a cheesecake factory over the road with a few more restaurants

We enjoyed staying at Anaheim Islander Inn & Suites we wished we could have stayed longer. Very affordable, clean and comfortable rooms, excellent location within walking distance to Disney across the road from Bubba Gump eatery & garden walk mall and shops.great service they helped us by getting us a private shuttle with one or there networks who just saved us the stress, for a reasonable cost.had a great conversation with one of the workers at front of desk who was familiar with our country therefore made us feel at home. The pool was a treat after a rather hot day. Highly recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel within walking distance to Disney!
Summary: From the Very friendly staff to the comfortable rooms this hotel is a perfect stay for Disney and surrounding beaches !  The only complaint I had was the carpet in our room needed a good steam cleaning. As our feet and or socks were dirty after walking around in our room. Otherwise the room was perfect.   Nice shutters on the windows to keep noise & light at bay. Beds were super comfy. Staff was awesome. Sufficient breakfast. Although Could use a lil milk for the kiddos? OJ doesn't really go with Danishes, donuts & muffins. Apples were a good choice they did offer.  Would DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN!  Oh and we could c most of the DL fireworks from rt outside our room!!! Bonus!! Tip- ask 4 rooms on. 2nd floor away from the construction next door.

The place is clean. Pretty close to Bubba Gumps and a few other restaurants. Not to far from the park and easy to get there if you take the shuttle. I think it's $5 all day round trip. Don't quote me on that though. Pool is small. I felt like the owners were staring waiting for you to make a mistake.

We have stayed here on several occasions. Room is always available when we check in, rooms are neat, clean and tidy as well as spacious. Price is excellent and if you are visiting disney, location is great as well.  We stayed for 3 nights in May 2014.

Our first time staying here was a good one. First of all, we had a Kid's SUITE for $99/night. In our room were 2 queen beds, bunkbeds (twin over full!) AND a sofa sleeper. lf you did the math right, you'll be able to fit NINE people in a room @ $99/night! AND still have room for all the bags and such. AWESOME! Total budge saver. Bummer thing is the parking. It definitely is ONE car per room so y'all better be carpooling! lol. The pool is pretty small and it goes from 3ft, to 5ft, to 8ft all within a matter of say. . .a 15ft pool? The room was a bit dark but can't complain because after a long day at the park, you'll be too pooped to worry about the color of the room and such. Which, by the way is kind of chocolate-ish brown. Anyway, all in all, our family enjoyed our stay and

A lot of the time you need to look at what you get for the price. This is a great example. The Islander is a great value place to stay, which is also clean, tidy, has friendly staff and is cheap.   Pool was nice in an abnormally hot spring time and the location is close enough to walk to Disneyland or in our case, Angel Stadium. Also close to Denny's, IHOP and The Cheesecake Factory for quick meals.

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The price is the only attractive thing here. The room was really old, the carpet hasn't probably been fully cleaned in months, the bathroom was kind of dirty, and the sink drain was very smelly. The breakfast was just a stand with pastries and orange juice. Spend 20 more bucks and get yourself a better place to spend the night.
Manager Response: Dear Julian O,  We at the Islander take all our customer feed back very seriously. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We very recently completed renovations and upgrades throughout the hotel. All carpeting was replaced about a year ago and we steam clean all our rooms quite frequently. So naturally we are concerned about your review and our looking into it very thoroughly. Our breakfast is quite modest consisting of Coffee, Orange juice, Apples, Danish, Donuts & Muffins. We hope to make more improvements in the near future as our budget allows. Thank you again for your time.

Summary Heading: BEST place on a budget for groups or large families
Summary: We were so happy with our stay at the Islander. We got in early and they upgraded us to a different room so they could accommodate our early arrival and with out charging us more. The rooms were nice and clean and very spacious. Great for larger families or groups. It is in walking distance of Disneyland (.75 miles) Great restaurants located in walking distance and also car rental. (Avas) is the best price I checked all three.

Summary Heading: Great value so close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was  well appointed, clean, staff friendly and pool greatly appreciated in an LA heat wave.  We were able to walk to and from Disneyland with plenty of good dining options nearby.  A very good value choice for our LA visit.

Summary Heading: Islander Inn and Suites = Great Stay & Great Value!
Summary: My husband, son, and I recently stayed at this hotel for 9 nights.  We stayed in one of their two bedroom (the second room has an actual door that closes and locks), three queen-bed suites.  We were on the top floor situated on the west side of the hotel.  We were able to check into the hotel early (around 1:30 pm) as we had an early flight that day.  I called the hotel prior to arriving and they said the room was ready for us to check in, which was great.    This is not the hotel's fault, but our shuttle (Disneyland Resort Express) would not drop us off in front of the hotel, but rather a block and a half away at a bus stop on Harbour Blvd (in front of the Subway restaurant there).  Keep that in mind if you are wanting to use DRE and are staying at this hotel.  The DRE was also

Our 2 day stay was very relaxing and the staff and workers were great and our rooms were very clean. This is where we stay all the time we visit Anaheim. And also a very short walk to IHOP and to Disneyland.

Recently stayed 10 nights at this hotel, family of 5, children aged 12, 10 and 8. We had a family room comprising one room with two queen beds, second room with one queen bed and bathroom accessible from both rooms. TV's in each room and fridge/microwave. Exchanged coffee machine for kettle (Love our tea). My sister and her two boys also stayed at this time and their room had two queen beds and single over double bunk. The sofa also converted to a bed. This room was a nice size. This is a charming, small, personal hotel. It is so nice being able to drive in and park close to your room (for free). U shaped hotel with ground and first floors only. Nice sized pool. Guest laundry only has one washer and dryer but was always available when we wanted to use it. We didn't have an issue

So we chose this hotel after seeing it had decent reviews and after finding that our usual low end motel (The Quality Inn) wanted $130+ a night during our stay.    Rooms:  The room was really quite large which made us happy.  There was plenty of room for our portable crib, which is always lovely.   The beds were decently comfy as were the pillows which is a nice find.  The air conditioning kind of had a hard time in our room.  It took about 6 hours before the whole room was cooled.  One side was cold and the other was hot.  Just poor circulation.  Bathroom:  This was the worst part of the room.  The fan was super loud and did not move any air or steam from the bathroom.  The shower had hardly any pressure and required cupping our hands and splashing it on ourselves.   Breakfast:
Manager Response: Dear Fernker,  Thank you for choosing the Islander for your vacation stay. We really appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback. Your concerns have been noted and will be addressed immediately. This helps us improve ourselves and give you the very best of service that you deserve. Thank you again & we hope to see you here soon once more.

Summary: My husband and I were able to take a quick last minute trip to Disneyland and needed a budget hotel. The Anaheim Islander got good reviews so we gave it a try and we are both so glad we did. The room was spacious and clean and the beds were very comfortable. We just stayed for one night but it was a really good night sleep. The location was easily walkable to the parks but by the end of the day we had very sore feet so we opted to get tickets for the ART bus which had a stop directly in front of the hotel which was great, it was also the first stop on the way back from the park which was lovely! The gentleman who checked us in and out was very friendly. We arrived early in the morning so our room was not ready, which I expected, but he apologized for it. Also we had some

wasn't sure about this place but stayed because of the wonderful reviews which were correct, the motel was very clean and yes I saw them take the bed spreads to be washed, always a good sign. The people that manage the motel were very helpful, friendly. The beds were very comfortable and yes we would stay here again. Really enjoyed the private bedroom away from the other two beds with a personal private entrance into the shared bathroom thank you for a great stay!

Summary Heading: Ok for the price and location.
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights April 9 and April 10. When we went into the room we noticed it was a little dated. The beds were comfy and there was a fridge and safe. The bathroom was small but the bedroom was large. Overall, I would return due it's location.

Summary Heading: great place to stay for the price
Summary: We spent April 4th 5th and 6th, 2014 at the Islander in and suites. Our stay was perfect. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly owners and staff. We were able to check in early which was so nice. They switched our room to accommodate us and wee actually ended up with a larger room. We dropped off our suitcases and headed to Disneyland. It was easy to catch a bus right outside the property. It was a 10 minute ride to the park gates. The walk if you choose to take it is only about 15 minutes but after walking around Disneyland the return bus pass for 5 bucks is real nice. (LOL) Our beds were very comfy and the room accommodated us just fine. There were two 17 year old girls and an 18 year old girl plus myself in the group (I'm the Mom) There was a nice continental breakfast the

My husband and I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland and various restaurants.  The rooms were clean and comfortable, and were certainly a good deal for the price we paid.  While there are other high-rated hotels even closer to the Disneyland entrance, I will choose to stay at the Islander Inn and Suites again and again, as long as they continue to have such welcoming and accommodating staff working there.  The workers in the main office always greeted us with a smile and were enjoyable to talk to.  Check-out time was at 11 (if I remember correctly), however our shuttle was not scheduled to pick us up until 1:30.  The staff were very understanding and allowed us to stay the extra two and a half hours for no extra charge or hassle.

Wonderful hospitality.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  We showed up very early not expecting to get into our room at that time but had hoped to park in the parking lot until check-in however the staff were nice enough to let us into our room when we arrived.  The room was nice and clean and extremely inviting.  The staff was helpful and accommodating.  We enjoyed our stay and will continue to book with Anaheim Islander Inn & Suites for all future visits.  We will also recommend this hotel to our friends and family.  Thank you Anaheim Islander Inn & Suites for treating us so well on our visit.

Only 10 mins walk to disneyland. Close by to garden walk offering shops & restaurants. We had 2 rooms with 3 double beds. Only had 1 bathroom with interconnecting doors.  Great value for money although would have been nice to have something savory for breakfast. Only on offer was doughnuts, muffins and pastries! Which the kids loved!! Coffee & orange juice was also available. Husband used the pool which was warm and clean. Staff very helpful in organsining tickets and giving local information.  Would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Mickey doesn't have anything on this place...
Summary: Me and my family, and 3 of my daughters teen age friends stayed here over spring break.  This place was perfect for us.  We had the large suite.  It slept us all comfortably!  They let us check in early, so we could enjoy our time at Disneyland right away, and they let us park our extra car for the day! (For a tiny fee...Way better than Mickey's parking rate! The breakfast in the morning was perfect for a bunch of teenagers!  They could eat and go!  The owners are very nice people, and we will be staying here from now on when we have our Disneyland weekends.  They have a great AAA discount!

We always return to this Motel for our trips to Disneyland. Great value and location. The staff are super nice and have always gone out of the way to make us welcome. I recommend this motel to anyone going to Anaheim. You don't get this kind of hospitality in Southern California very often. We would not think of staying anywhere else. Plus the kids love the place as well. Very good sized rooms as well for the family. Pool gets good sun, and is always heated when we go down in March

Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for
Summary: Smallish, clean, basic hotel with very friendly, accommodating staff.  Easy walk to Disneyland and California adventure.  Plenty of restaurants nearby, in all price ranges.  Fridge and microwave in each room, and free parking.  Not much of a breakfast -- just an assortment of soso donuts and a bowl of apples.  There's nothing stand out here, but if you're looking for a clean, comfortable, affordable bed spitting distance from Disneyland, you won't go wrong here.

We stayed there with all of our family  all 16.of  us  we had booked 4 rooms in total .What a wonderful place to stay at for families close enough  to Disneyland to walk to  even with young children  and the fact  the hotel had interconnecting rooms for families  was why we would stay there again

Wow this was a great find!  We had a group of 5 adults and wanted to be within walking distance to Disneyland without having to pay a fortune.  I couldn't believe that I was able to find a hotel within walking distance that had 3 queen beds so that we could all stay in one room! With taxes we paid around $155 a night which is an unbelievable value.  There was only one bathroom but aside from that we basically had two rooms for that price.  The fridge, microwave and free parking made this deal even better. This isn't a perfect place but you get what you pay for and we were beyond pleased with what we got for our money.  This will without a doubt be the first place that we look to stay on our next trip to Disneyland.

Lots of good with this hotel including easy walk to Disneyland, small complex, friendly staff, clean premises and rooms, restaurants close by, free parking outside room, large rooms, nice bathroom, laundry and a pool, for the price it was more than expected. The only negative for me was the air conditioner was loud when operating which wasn't a big issue as I tend to sleep with earplugs due to being a light sleeper. The staff were so accommodating with any request we had. On arrival we said we were going to Disney straight away and we were told we could have a bigger room on our return from Disney in the evening as one had become available, no extra fee was even discussed. We had to borrow a universal electrical charger and we didn't even had to sign for it, it was just trusted

Summary Heading: our new favorite place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: What a difference it makes when you stay in a nice, welcoming family owned quaint property  : ) Having stayed in a few other places in Anaheim that never really pleased us all that well this is nice & refreshing. There is obvious pride in ownership here, as well as friendly and accommodating service at this conveniently located Inn close to Disney & Anaheim Convention Center.  I loved the pool and the ease of parking as well as the ability to open your window in your room, do some yoga to rejuvenate yourself, relax after a long day, take in some nice SoCal fresh air or enjoy a nice game of backgammon or yahtzee : )) The breakfast is a kind gesture to grab something quick on your way out the door, piece of fruit or pastry and we really appreciated the cleanliness not only in our

This hotel is in a great location-walking distance  to everything-Disneyland parks, fine dining, family dining, fast food, etc. Our room was larger than expected and very clean. It was cleaned very well every day. There was parking. The continental breakfast had a nice variety of muffins and pastries, coffee and juice. Even trays to take the food back to your room. The staff was always available and very friendly and helpful. We didn't use the pool because it was raining, but the pool and surrounding area were clean. I can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel. A great value for the money. I will be staying here again.

I can not say enough good about this hotel.  After spending a full week with my family (12 total) here we could not have had a better experience.  The staff went above and beyond too make our stay perfect! The facility was neat and clean from the rooms to the pool to the laundry. The price was excellent for what we needed and the bunk beds made the trip for my kids. Breakfast is included and served daily. Within a short walk to Disneyland and California Adventure plus many restaurants and shopping venues.  Public transportation pickup/drop off locations are on site, and the staff will make sure all your needs are taken care of.

We had a great stay!!! Excellent location to Disneyland, perfect for walking to restaurants and shops. The rooms were large, clean and the price was very very affordable. I would highly recommend!!!!!

Summary Heading: Best value and Customer Service we've experienced in 5 years.
Summary: This past week, we've stayed here and truly appreciate the kindness and friendliness from the hotel staff. The rooms were very clean, very close to PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory and multiple other eateries. Quick shuttle ride or .5 mike walk to Disney. Best value....the past five years we've been coming to Disney and staying other places, but we'll come back to the Islander for sure. You will enjoy it too.

Stayed for one night in a two bedroom suite. It was nice to have a suite so my family of 5 could stay in 1 room - 2 TVs and 4 queen beds was nice. Bathroom was a little small for 5 of us. Breakfast was not impressive - some pastries and donuts that didn't look good. The biggest plus was the free parking and that they let us park in the lot before and after check out. It was about a 10 min walk to disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear jenba97,  Thank you for staying with us on your trip to Disney. The four queen bed suite is quite a spacious room for big families on a budget. May we also suggest getting two smaller deluxe rooms adjacent to each other so you could have two separate bathrooms. Our breakfast is very modest as we are a very small establishment. We always to try to help our customers by offering free parking before and after checkout based on our availability. Thank you again. We hope to see you back soon on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: It's nice to try new places!
Summary: We just got back from our Family Disneyland trip. We were trying to do this trip on more of a budget so I chose the Islander. It isn't far from the park at all, but its not right on the Harbor strip. I think it is about a half mile walk. No problem! I am very happy with this hotel. I have been going with my family for years and we always stayed at the Candy Cane.. I am now bringing my husband and kids and on a budget, couldn't do the Candy Cane. This hotel is very worth it. The rooms were clean. The first day it had an odd smell, I think the cleaning supplies that were used.. But it went away. The rooms are a decent size, and seem to be pretty new. We chose upstairs, since our last hotel experience was so noisy downstairs.. Noise was pretty good.. There was some guy yelling in

I knew when I was choosing to stay here it wasn't going to be anything special, I really just wanted somewhere close to Disneyland. However when you've been walking all day, this place feels like it is miles away from the park. I made the reservation and put in the notes we would be celebrating our three year anniversary. Usually hotels do something special, however we weren't even really acknowledged. The breakfast Buffett was not breakfast, and the tv had the worst reception and most channels didn't even work. This was all fine, as I said we really just wanted the hotel to sleep. But then today as we were sleeping in before our eight hour drive home, I recoeved a call from the front desk asking if we could check out before 11am because they had a mixup. The worst part was they
Manager Response: Dear emilymillward,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We are currently reviewing this matter. Our goal is to provide excellent service to all our guests.  We sincerely apologies in advance for your treatment.

Summary: I and a colleague were attending a convention and shared a 2BR unit.   Positives:  5 min walk to Convention Center or Disney, friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds (maybe a little on the firm side for me, but fine), free apples, value was excellent, especially compared with the bigger hotels nearby. Minor issues:  Only pastries on offer for breakfast, so didn't bother - would be nice if there were a couple of healthy cereals, yogurt, more fruit options, etc.  Weatherstripping around door was coming off - no real problem, but it's probably harder on the AC than it needs to be.

After reading tons of hotel reviews, we decided to try out the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites. It was a wonderful choice. We stayed for three nights (Sunday to Wednesday) and checked in late on Sunday. We drove down from Washington with two young children in the car. Seeing that my boys were needing some extra space to stretch their legs, the gentleman at the front desk (I forgot his name unfortunately) upgraded us to a room with a bunk bed for our boys and put us in a room over a carport so that they would not bother anyone below them with their running around. The hotel was rather vacant during our stay due to visiting Disneyland the slow time of the year, but all the workers were very kind and helpful. There is a small complementary breakfast of fruit, coffee, and pastries.

The location is this hotel is great; an easy walk to Disney. We didn't bother with the ART bus. It's also nice to go back to a small scale hotel after spending the day in a massive theme park. Right near bus stops for those catching public transport as we did. If you take the Amtrak train to Fullerton station then catch the 43 or 543 bus it'll take you to the Harbor/Katella intersection, and it was fine to take luggage. $2 each way- pay on board. The room had a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Being tea drinkers, we used the coffee maker (without filter)to boil water. The 7/11 on the intersection was great for basics. We bought milk, oats, snacks, plastic bowls and cutlery and food for Disney. We made our own breakfast (oats) as not too keen on donuts to start the day.
Manager Response: Dear Louise O  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. We very much appreciate your feed back. We hope to see you soon on your next vacation. Hope you have a wonderful summer in Australia!

Summary: Great location with spacious rooms but very small bathroom. Location was great; across from The Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. 10mins walk to Disneyland. Small pool but we were there in winter so made little use of it. Housekeeping only work certain hours. Free parking!!!Great!

This place is in a good location (only a 10 - 15 min stroll to Disney) and near restaurants, shops and easy for transit and shuttles. The rooms were large, clean and very adequate and the front desk staff helpful. A very small pool, ok for kids, and pastries for breakfast were included each morning. For a more full breakfast, there's an IHOP just up the street.  If walking up a few stairs doesn't bother you, I would try to get on the top floor. If you are on the bottom people walking along the outdoor "hallway" can sound very loud but really only an issue during the day.  We chose this motel for the convenience of it's location to doing "Run Disney" events. It kept our cost down, while offering everything we needed.

We had a 2 bedroom/1 bath for 4 adults.  We never felt squished and each room was roomy!!!  It's a fairly quick walk to the parks about 10 minutes, seemed like forever at midnight walking back, but we were tired.  Staff was great, VERY helpful.  Continental breakfast was simple, but the best powdered donuts we had ever had!!!  Even the coffee was good!!!  The beds were very comfortable, it also could have been exhaustion.

Great little motel about a 10 minute walk from Disneyland. We booked through expedia however there was an error with the booking so when we arrived at the motel they did not have our reservation in the system. The trusty check in clerk managed to find us a room on a weekend in peak season (middle of August) so we were very impressed! Comfortable stay, good selection of breakfast foods and nice little pool/sun-trap to relax at after a long day at Disneyland. Highly recommended, would return.

We always stay at the Anaheim Islander when we have conventions at the Anaheim Convention centre.  Fantastic value, especially if you're travelling with 3+ people like we were.  The front desk staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean and quiet.  I'll definitely be staying here again.

Summary Heading: Simple, modest and clean little hotel
Summary: We arrived on Dec 27, 2013 before check in time. We were able to get our room without problems. Personnel was very nice and helpful. Room/bathroom had no funny smells, or visible signs of deterioration. Room included coffee maker, a minibar, a microwave and sofabed. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. We stayed there two nights and had no issues. We didn't have breakfast there, since hotel does not have a restaurant and even when we could grab some fruit or bread, we preferred to go somewhere else.

We stayed in the two-bedroom, 4-bed, suite.  Good condition and very roomy, though the one small bathroom was probably not enough for our group!  Staff was excellent, very accommodating when we arrived early.  They allowed us to do some "freshening up" in another room since we couldn't check in to ours yet.  Continental breakfast isn't much, but the room is such a good value that it didn't really matter to us.  Quick walk to Disney.  Great place!

Went as a family group of 18 to Disneyland and they accommodated us with 5 rooms when other places were sold out. They could have raised prices significantly, but they were still reasonable. They allowed us an early check in as the rooms became available and  were very helpful and friendly.

We purchased a 2 bedroom suite to share with my brother and his wife. We were very happy with the room and how friendly the staff were. Purchased our tickets to Disneyland at the front counter. They happily scheduled a car to pick us up for Medieval Times and deliver us back to Disneyland afterwards. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Just the ticket for an affordable stay at Disneyland!  We stayed in a suite that slept 8 for a 3-day trip to Disneyland.  It was such a bargain!  The rooms are clean, the location is excellent and staff is friendly and helpful.  Although the hotel is within walking distance, we took that ART shuttle to and from Disneyland.  After a full day on your feet, the number 8 bus will take you right to your hotel.

Summary Heading: A Honest Review For Future Disney Travelers
Summary: Pros- This is the cleanest and friendliest place you can stay Yes there is no breakfast as others had mentioned, but there is a food for less a mile down the street. There is a refrigerator in every room so buy cereal and some oatmeal and you are set. If you sit at a hotel to eat breakfast and get to the park past 9 am you will not get a fast pass for the popular Cars racer ride. The beds are comfy and the room we had was called a kids room. This room has 2 queen beds and a bunk bed (top and bottom for the kids so you have your space after a long day) The hotel is too far to walk with little ones, BUT the ART bus picks you up and drops you off and this hotel is the first stop so that makes it easy. For 3 people it cost around 10 dollars and believe me you don't want to fight
Manager Response: Dear Techskills02  Thank you for taking the time to write a descriptive review. This really helps many potential future travelers to make informed choices. I would sincerely like to apologize for the less than perfect stay caused by the construction noise. We would like to wish you and your entire family a Merry Christmas & a fantastic New Year! We hope to see you all here next year on your Disney Adventure.

Summary Heading: 3 night stay with wife, 1 and 2 year old
Summary: Great location and best deal I could find.  Drove up from San Diego and checked in at 2pm.  Received a discount from their website because I have a SoCal Annual Passport.  I went with the room with the microwave and fridge, 2 queens and sofa bed.  I ended up moving the sofa against one side of the bed as I co-sleep with my 1yo.  Fridge was perfect for ice packs, water bottles, and formula for the baby.  I planned ahead and brought my own mug to microwave water at night to heat the formula, never asked the Inn if they had any, but brought it just in case.  A note about the fridge: be sure to set it to "Max" or some level.  I didn't set it when we first checked in and came back to a room temp fridge and carton of milk when we returned later that night, my bad.  The safe in the

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed at Anaheim Islander Inn, for three nights on Nov. 15Th. The staff is excellent and very helpful; the room was updated and clean. Everything you need is within walking distance great stay highly recommended property.

Our stay at the Anaheim Islander Inn was a truly enjoyable experience. The staff were always friendly and very helpful, particularly when it came to printing theme part tickets that we had purchased on line.     The room was very large, so even with two extremely comfortable queen beds in the room, there was plenty of room left over for bags and the paraphernalia that seems to be a necessary part of travelling. The en suite was also very roomy and well appointed. Both the room and the en suite were spotlessly clean.     Disneyland is only a very short walk away, as are a number of very good resturants and take away establishments. The continental breakfast was limited (as stated when we booked and also when we checked in) so we provided our on breakfast. But having said that,

We were looking for a room that would comfortably fit our family of 5 and not too expensive. Now that my older children are teens/pre-teens, they aren't so crazy about sleeping on the floor anymore. We got a family suite and it was perfect (we could have even fit a few more kids in). Two queen beds, a bunk bed with a full and twin size bed, a fridge, and microwave AND room to walk around the room.

Would like to say I have stayed at this hotel before and that's why I came back for another 3 night stay, I visit disneyland a lot:) I have to say my stay this time wasn't so great, came back to the room for a change into warmer clothes and discovered my levi jeans were missing from my suitcase I called the lobby right away, he said he would look into it and get back with me not much later he came to room telling me all I could do is file a police report said their maids have been there for years and nothing like this has ever happened I simply wanted them to give me $20.00 for the pants that mysteriously disappeared they wouldn't do it kept telling me to file a police report I really don't believe the police would put to much into it, they have more important issues to deal
Manager Response: Dear Disney me72  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay and being a repeat customer. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and are currently looking into this matter.

Summary: Nice room with all you need. Fridge, microwave, coffeemaker and a safe. Air conditioner was very loud though.   Free parking and walking distance to Disneyland. Took me about 15 minutes.  Skip the complimentary breakfast. There's almost nothing there. IHOP just around the corner and lots of restaurants in the area.

We basically stayed there to use as a place to sleep and store our suitcases and clothes as we adventured California. It was worth the price. The rooms were decent (not good not bad). The service of the maids and reception was approvable and good. We did enjoy our stay and it was quite convenient for its purpose.

Summary Heading: Best economy lodging close to Disneyland
Summary: I am always looking for affordable but nice lodging near Disneyland and the Ananheim Islander met all my expectations and more. The rooms were clean (the most important aspect of any stay), they were large, the beds were comforatable, the refridgerator was a good size, and the hotel was quiet. While we did not get to try the pool, it look inviting and was heated. While the property is old, it has been remodeled and is very inviting. The staff were also very friendly. We stayed in the larger 2 room suite and it was perfect for our kids, grandkids and us. We had privacy but were able to share a suite at a great price. If you are looking for a large buffect breakfast or upscale lobby, this is not for you. But as compared against other hotels in this price range, it outshines every
