Manager Response: Dear Tammy G,  We really appreciate you taking the time to review your stay. This helps all our potential future customers make an informed decision. The pool is heated & the breakfast very simple due to limited space. For most people fresh brewed coffee, orange juice, danish, muffins, donuts & apples provide a decent start for the day. Thank you for your loyalty, we really enjoyed having you guys as our guests.

Summary: We loved this hotel.  We walked to disneyland's enterance, it was so close.   Plenty of places to eat in walking distance.   The hotel is very very clean, great housekeeping service, and refrig and micro plus big screen tv.   Awesome value for a great hotel.  I recommend it to all my family and friends, stay here if you are in Anaheim.   I will definately stay here again my next trip.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for money/Very Close to everything Disneyland
Summary: 1. Good value for money 2. Location is convenient very close to many food places, restaurants and Anaheim Garden Walk which normally closes around 9ish - 10ish pm.  We felt safe as many tourist were around.   3.Very close to Disneyland, 5-10 minute walk. 4. Property very clean and tidy.  Swimming pool area very tidy but double check pool my sister and I didn't swim as pool water looked a little bit dirty you had to look very closely tho from a far looks clean. 5. We stay in a queen room, 3 adults, 2 Queen beds, Bed was comfortable, Room had little moving space. Bathroom small but in saying this most of the time we spent outdoors it was basically just a place for us to sleep.  Room was very tidy and clean, cleaners were friendly and we noticed they were out everyday cleaning.

My two daughters,two grandsons and I met my son and daughter in law in June of 2013 for a mini vacation to Universal Studios and Disneyland.  We stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites and were very pleased with the location and the rooms.  I thought the rooms were very roomy (my daughters, grandsons and I had a two room suite with 1 bathroom) and clean.  We made use of the pool and also the continental breakfast every morning.  We did find the beds a bit firm for our taste, but that is a matter of preference.  The location was great; It was an easy walk to Disney and directly across the street from the Garden Walk district. Overall we had a pleasant stay and would stay again if we are ever in that area. .

We stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites in July, 2013.  It is a wonderful little “hidden treasure” in Anaheim.  Our whole family would highly recommend this quaint motel to anyone travelling to Disneyland for a holiday.  Our family of 6 stayed in one of the larger family suites and there was plenty of room.  The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly and accommodating.  It is a short walk to Disneyland.  It’s not a swanky high priced hotel, but a very warm, welcoming, comfortable motel.  When we travel to Anaheim again we will definitely be staying at the Anaheim Islander again and would recommend anyone travelling to do the same. Tracy R Calgary, Alberta Canada

Summary Heading: Stayed Here In September Of 2013 And Had A Good Experience
Summary: Introduction: Two adults & I stayed at this motel in September of 2013 for a Disneyland vacation.This motel is great for a Disneyland based vacation because, its close to various foods, shopping & a main Disney parking lot on Harbor Blvd. Be prepared to spend $16+ dollars to park in the Disney lot & then be bussed over to the Disney parks.  Description: We were pleased with our over all experience with this cute, small, two storied motel. Its nothing fancy but, its clean (inside & out), friendly, comfortable, economical, low on the noise factor & spacious.They have different sized rooms to accommodate singles to families. The rooms come with ironing equipment, refrigerators,microwaves, small coffee makers, decent TV's, hair dryers, desks & comfortable beds.There's a pool (not

Easy walking distance to Disney.  Several restaurants near by.  Great location and excellent value compared to near by properties.  Large rooms comfortable rooms - we had 2 bedroom suites.  Easy parking in this motel style inn.  Breakfast rather basic and very sugary.

We booked this hotel two days before our trip so we did not expect much but we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. We had a two bedroom suite which was big enough for four adults and a toddler. One room had a small refrigerator and a microwave plus a queen size bed. The other room had two queen size beds and a small table.  The air conditioning units worked well, the blinds kept the room dark, and it was not noisy at all. Continental breakfast consisting of juice, muffins, danishes, and coffee was available from 7 am to 9 am. The service was excellent and very helpful. There was ample parking and, if needed, you can leave your car and take local transportation to Disneyland. All in all it was a nice place to stay and we enjoyed it very much.

We booked the room online some days before and the room was ready when we arrived.  It is a nice small Hotel with all facilities you need. The rooms are Clean and the staff was very helpful. We will stay there next year too.

We booked the place on line from Malaysia. We arrive and the room was ready for us. The boss, was very welcoming and gave us our keys and send us to bed.  We spend 20 hours on the flight from Malaysia and 4-5 more hours travelling to and from the airport to get to the hotel was certainly a welcoming sight.  We booked for a standard room but he upgraded us to a bigger room so we can have abetter sleep. Thank you. All in all it was good.  The only one thing about the carpets were it is not too clean. We took our shoes off and walk around teh room only to find our feet black. We need to wash our feet before getting to beds but pls remember to bring your shoes to the bathroom or otherwsie you need to wash it again

Booked this place online months in advance as it looked great for our party needs. When we got there our room wasn't available until the next day. We got a beautiful room with 2 queen beds and bunk beds for only 1 night and then moved into our booked room of 4 queen beds in 2 rooms the next day. Room was just as nice, lovely and clean, loads of towels, room safe and fridge. I have to say the staff here are really nice, you always got a hi every time you saw them. Small family ran place which I will use again next time we visit Disneyland..

Summary Heading: Fine place for local activities...its better then average
Summary: Very Large room -2 Queen and bunk beds, refrigerator, microwave. Convenient location.  Only issue was when making a reservation, an addition resort fee was added (days after agreement of price).  Resort fee??  small pool, we did not swim in - they claimed all the hotels have resort fees- therefore they do! The breakfast is coffee, OJ, danish & donuts :) The bed, pillows were comfortable, well equipped, very clean room. Approx 1.5 miles down the road from Anaheim Stadium.

Summary Heading: A great price for a great location
Summary: This friendly  family hotel is great value for money. Only a 15 minutes walk and located in a quiet area.clean sheets and plenty of clean towns and friendly helpful staff. An old fashioned friendly hotel. We enjoyed our stay there and return again next time we visit disneyland.

We were there for 4 nights. Great place if you are looking for a no-fancy, reasonably priced place to serve as a base for the Disney parks. Clean, spacious rooms and bathrooms - decent housekeeping service. Fridge and Microwave very helpful. Also has a coffee maker and hair dryer. Plenty of towels, soap and shampoo in the bathroom. Onsite laundry. It was a couple of blocks to Disneyland - a very easy 15 min walk. But it can seem a bit much if you're tired after a day at the park. The ART bus-stop is right at the gate of the inn - you can pickup day passes at the reception, or pay for one-way trips on the bus itself. Breakfast was the only -ve - danishes and muffins do not a breakfast make. Apples, orange juice and coffee were good. We were warned by the reviews here, so armed

We had the family 2 bedroom suite, and it was perfect as our base for our Disneyland excursions.  A little road noise, but it died out in the evening, the air con worked really well (very important in summer!) and the front desk were helpful.  Main benefit is that you're only  a 15 minute walk from the Disneyland front gate; there are lots of shuttle buses running in the area if your kids cant face another walk, but after a day of crowds, it was nice to be able to get some space on the way back to the motel.

Had the family room 2 bdrm Was great ,clean ,had a smell for a few days but went away.close to disneyland and shops .Price was right ,mainly slept there as we where doing the theme parks and tours of LA. Beds where comfy,no probs coming back

Very pleasantly surprised by this nice hotel. I called at 8:30am to see if we could get na early check in, thinking maybe it would be 1 or 2 pm...... the extremely nice gentleman at the front desk said, "you can come over right now if you would like, your room is almost ready". That made a huge & wonderful difference in our day. We were able to get situated into the room before heading over to Disneyland. Made it so nice when we were able to go back there around 1 pm for our 22mo old granddaughter to take a nap. Close to both Disneyland & Angels stadium. The ART bus stop is right in front of this hotel so that is very nice. You can leave your car at the hotel and catch the bus that takes you directly to Disneyland. It also runs on the weekends to Angels stadium. We had a 2

Summary Heading: Just what is needed on a budget! Great location, clean, friendly & a pool!
Summary: Stayed here based on reviews from this site for our trip to see the Angel's play at Anaheim Stadium and to go to Downtown Disney and see some Disney Fireworks outside of the park with our 7yr old son. The Anaheim Islander was easy to get to and check in, very friendly front desk clerk. The Islander Inn is small but adequate with a pool that we really enjoyed! No it is not heated. The rooms are normal and have your needed microwave, coffee maker, mini fridge/freezer, blow dryer and TV and table with 2 chairs. I do wish they would install more electrical sockets in each room, badly needed with today's smartphones, tablets & laptops! The beds & pillows were fine for us, no complaints at all really with the Islander! The breakfast is in the main front desk area and is simple with a

Great place to stay! We were in Anaheim to see two Cubs games and visit Mickey's place. The location is perfect, right across the street from the Garden Walk which was great for restaurants but so little shopping - five minutes from DLR and eight minutes from Angels Stadium. The beds were heavenly, the WiFi was super fast, clean and quiet. Bathroom was on the small side but we didn't spend a lot of time in it. Staff at the front desk was very professional and nice, housekeeping was great. We ate in Downtown Disney or the parks for breakfast so didn't need the free stuff. Good value - this will be our go-to place in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Very convenient hotel, 15 mn walk to Disney, Clean and Free parking
Summary: What can I say - we were pleased with our stay. We spent 2 nights - the night prior to a one day visit at Disneyland and then a good night sleep after walking all day there.  It's only 15 mn walk to the entrance - we had our 4 yr old in the umbrella stroller and our 8 yr old walked with us.  It's across the Aneihem Garden Walk - great place to go with the kids the night before to burn down energy before going to sleep.  Room was clean - we had 2 double beds and a couch. I'd recommend to get better pillows!!! They were a little too 'fluffy'. But hey the beds were great, we slept good. Wifi worked better if I moved closer to the window.   The one thing I would say the fridge smelled when we got there, bc it was unplugged so the ice melted... but once it was back up, it was good.

This was a nice clean hotel/motel.  It was about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland which was nice.  We had a nice size room (Queen Deluxe) for 5 of us.  They advertised a breakfast, but it was just orange juice, coffee, apples and sweet, sugary pastries which I couldn't stomach first thing in the morning.  I only drank the coffee and we ended up eating breakfast elsewhere.  Aside from that, the property was well maintained.  They had a small pool, although we never had the time to use it and it was conveniently located around many restaurants and had free parking which was great.

The rooms are average for what we paid for at $89 a night with free parking. Walking distance was about a 10 minute walk with nearby stores to stock up on snacks and drinks. We brought our own food in for the day and dined in the park for dinner. The carpet was dirty and we walked around with sandals on but the beds were okay and the bathrooms were small. There was a fridge in the room with a microwave and a small safe to keep your valuables. For the price I would recommend this motel but if you want to spend a little more for a close location you might want to look at the Best Westerns in the surrounding area.

Here is the deal. We were looking for a clean family oriented 2 room suite. Check. We wanted 3 queen beds instead of a pull out couch. Check. We would like it within walking distance of Disneyland. Check. We would like to walk to some good restaurants. Check. Free Wifi for all of my families smart devices. Yup. A pool would be great. Check. Oh..... and lastly, we're on a budget. Done. All we wanted was a place to rest at a reasonable price and The Islander was perfect.. Don't get me wrong, The Islander is not a 5 star hotel, but it doesn't pretend to be. It's just a solid place for a family to stay. Throw in a very courteous staff and you have a winner. Give this little independent hotel a shot. It will be our first choice next time we hit up Disney.

The hotel was clean (except for the carpet), housekeeping was great, the breakfast was enough to get you going, and the walk to Disneyland was easy (even with a 1 and 4 year old). For the price, its a great deal - you get what you pay for - no frills..... but a clean place to stay with a pool to cool off in, and really close to many restaurants. Parking lot can get a bit crowded, but the management make it work.  Would recommend for anyone with older kids or for shorter stays.   No frills, not fancy but a great price (especially when you can get 6 people in one room!!!) - perfect for people spending more of their time at Disney and just need a comfy bed at night.

Summary Heading: Good value considering proximity to Disneyland
Summary: While most hotels within a couple of blocks of Disneyland are over a hundred a night or skimp on amenities, this place has rooms for under a hundred (strangely, their rooms were a few bucks cheaper booked directly on their website than through travel sites) & their rooms come with a microwave, frig, coffee maker, iron & board, and in room safe. The TV is okay with the standard fare including HBO. Beds and pillows are acceptable. I found them to be comfortable enough to fall asleep fast after a long day at Disneyland, but I've stayed at places with softer pillows & more comfortable beds. I've stayed here twice & would do it again as long as the value is still there. It's biggest draw is it's only a block & a half from Disneyland. Even after walking around all day at Disney, it

Great price, great location, great service and great pool!  Highly recommended if traveling with children.  You won't be disappointed. Located close to great restaurants...including Bubba Gumps...all within walking distance.

For those of you looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel this is not your place, but if you are on a budget and want to be within walking distance to Disneyland then book this place.  Their rooms are a little dated but clean, the continental breakfast is very basic but good.  The staff was great, very friendly and helpful.  I am an early riser and was staying in a room with other members of my family, the staff was gracious enough to open the pool for me so that I could sit out there and read.  I felt safe walking after dark by myself  to the motel.  Another plus is the free parking, most other places in the area charge.  There are onsite laundry facilities, a microwave, fridge and small coffee maker in each room.  We timed our walk to Disneyland and it took 11 minutes to the front gate

Summary Heading: Our go to hotel when we visit Disneyland
Summary: My family has visited Disneyland at least once a year for the last decade. We have stayed at multiple hotels in the Disneyland area but after one stay at Anaheim Islander Inn about five years ago, this became our go to hotel. The rooms are good size and always clean. We have been here in the summer and winter and at each visit we have experienced excellent service from the hotel staff. They are courteous and smiling. The hotel is a short walk to the parks and there are many restaurants within walking distance as well. We are headed back to DL for our annual NYE visit and this is where we'll stay.

I was somewhat apprensive about this hotel/motel, but a big sigh of relief when we arrived.  The property is well maintained, the rooms are very clean and spacious (except for small bathroom), but with six in our group, three beds and lots of floor space worked well for us. Limited closet space, but plenty of drawer space. We took advantage of the shuttle 3-day pass to Disneyland, and the Islander is the first stop going and the first stop returning, which is a real positive!  Staff very helpful and congenial. Continental breakfast not the best, but the doughnuts were fresh, the oj was cold and the coffee good and hot!   We will definitely stay there again.

Stayed for 5 days in Islander Inn & Suite and am surprise that for the price we paid, the room is clean, spacious and offer free parking. The motel is well maintained and the housekeeping ensures you have the room clean daily. Breakfast is simple comprising of muffins, donuts, pastry, fresh apples, orange juice and coffee and sufficient for morning energy boost. The location of the hotel is within reasonable distance to The Garden Walk Mall and Disneyland. Food is easily accessible around the motel.  This motel is very reasonably priced and value for money and family friendly too.

Summary Heading: Clean, Close, Great Value for the Price
Summary: We stayed in the 2-bedroom family suite Easter weekend 2013. The room was perfect for 2 adults and 2 teenage girls - privacy for the girls at an affordable price. The staff were friendly and  responsive, the room was very clean and neat. Easy walk to Disney. Free parking. Free Wi-fi - four devices at the same time, no problem, though we probably could not all have been streaming videos (not a problem since we were in Anaheim for Disneyland). Free breakfast is very basic, but enough to get you going on your way. Highly recommend!

I'm an Embassy Suites or Marriot gal, but taking 4 nieces on a special trip meant staying someplace less expensive. I was hesitant to book here because I hadn't stayed here before, but they had the perfect set up for us without having to rent 2 rooms. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and I even saw housekeeping tossing blankets over the railing the next morning which I assumed means they get washed regularly unlike most hotels that wash them only a few times a year. Beds were good and we appreciated the fridge and microwave. The bathroom was tiny but had a door into each room. I kind of wondered why we were given fewer towels and washcloths than occupants each day. If the room sleeps 6, I would expect 6 towels in the bathroom.  The Parking is free and the walk to

We just spent several days here, and were very pleased with the accommodations.  Our two-room suite was large, clean and comfortable.  The shared bathroom was fine, but on the small side.  The hotel grounds were cheerful and immaculate, and the pool was great.  The rooms were recently updated and had everything you would need, and the staff was all friendly and helpful.  Free parking was a big plus.   There is a Disney shuttle stop right in front of the hotel if you don't feel like the 15-minute walk to the parks, and there are various restaurants and shops also within close walking distance.  I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

We had a wonderful stay at the Islander Inn and Suites.  Our room was nice and we especially liked the blinds.  They darkened the room almost completely which helped us all to sleep well.  The hotel was quiet and the grounds were nicely kept.   The staff was very friendly and the breakfast doughnuts were fresh.  The Disneyland bus stops at the Islander which we found very convenient. We were also able to purchase bus passes at the hotel reception. If we return to the area again, we will stay at the Islander again.

My rating is based upon the price paid.  You can obviously spend more and get a better place, but we weren't going to spend a lot of time in our room.  It was a short walk to disney from here.  Rooms were clean, modern, and the bed comfortable with nice size pillows.  A refridgerator is nice.  This is a smaller hotel which means not a lot of people to get in the way.  Fast check in and out.  Breakfast was only muffins, donuts, coffee and juice, but for the price it is was fine to get anything.  Free internet which is always a must.

Had all the basics we needed & only a 10 min walk to Disneyland. Breakfast was slim but coffee & pastries were ok to start the day. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable. Pillows were poor. Bring your own. Heated pool was nice. People were nice! Great value! Would stay there again!

I stayed in the Islander Inn & Suites while in Anaheim for a convention.  The hotel was very clean and the staff was courteous!  I enjoyed the stay, as the hotel was close to the convention center (easy to walk to) and right across the street from some great restaurants!  I would definatley stay in this hotel again. Chas S.

Summary Heading: Great Place Great People Leave the Car!
Summary: I cannot believe that a Hotel walking distance to Disneyland can be had for this price and offer immaculate rooms, a pool, and free parking for Disneyland.  Staff was exceptional. Great selection of places to eat within walking distance.  You will hear very excited kids in the morning getting ready for the day at the Park.  Who cares? It's Disneyland not Forest lawn!  Be a kid! See you next year.  Frank F.  Rochester, NY

We weren't going to Disneyland, but needed a one night stay in the area. The rooms are updated with shutter and nice bedding. There is a fridge, microwave and coffee-maker in the room. It was a bit noisy in the morning as everyone was getting ready for the park, but that is to be expected.free parking is a big plus in this area

The hotel was a half mile from the entrance of Disneyland,  which wasn't bad,  however with two tired kids at the end of the night,  it was a bit of a walk.  The room was average size.  The only thing that bothered me was that the toilet paper was never put on the roll which made me wonder what else the cleaning people were not doing.  Other than that the free breakfast was not worth staying there if you are looking for free breakfast,  it was basically donuts and muffins,  no cereal or fruit. Overall you get what you pay for.  Definitely will pay an extra $30/night to stay closer to the park,  especially if it's raining. With older kids it might be better.

We checked in on the 15th January 2013 and taken to our room.A few minutes after getting our caes in we found there was a problem with lighting so my son went to see the Manager and they moved us to another room right away and we finished unpacking. The room was extremely comfortable with a fridge & microwave in - the bathroom was spotlessley clean and the room very comfortable with table and chairs and TV. As the week went by we sat out by the swimming pool for our breakfast. The motel breakfast is very basic so we bought ourselves fruit and cereal to have as being English we are not used to Doughnuts or Muffins!! Staff and cleaners were all very friendly and jobs well done.Motel was within easy reach of Ihop as an alternative for breakfast and Cheesecake Factory just up the

We stayed for the first time at the Anaheim Islander on Valentine's Day. We drive from Northern California and stop in Anaheim a few times a year for a Disneyland trip with our kids. We are always looking for a good deal that doesn't sacrifice comfort and cleanliness - this was definitely a good deal. It is NOT a luxury hotel, but if you are looking for a clean place within walking distance to Disney than this is a great place to stay! Check in was fast and easy, we had our kids in bed within 10 minutes of arriving. The continental breakfast was just fruit and mini muffins, but it was enough to get the everyone through the morning without having to stop to eat breakfast at a restaurant. There are also several stores and restaurants near the hotel which you can eat at or grab

I chose this place for several reasons - free parking, price, free contintental breakfast, and walking distance to Disneyland. We stayed here for one night with another couple. We had a room with two queens. The other room was a two-room suite (two queens in one room and one queen in another). The rooms were decent size and equipped w/microwave, fridge, and free internet. Our room was clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.The continental breakfast was nothing to brag about. It consisted of some fruit, coffee, orange juice and some store bought pastries. I wish they had hot water to make tea, hot chocolate & oatmeal to add some variety. There are plenty of places to eat surrounding the motel. This by no means the Sheraton but overall isn't bad.

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, okay room
Summary: I stayed there for 3 nights with a buddy of mine to attend the NAMM conference at the convention center.  First of all, the location to the convention center was perfect.  5 minute walk and we were there.  I loved the fact that we didn't have to drive and pay the exorbitant amount for parking on site.  I wasn't there to go to Disney, but I can see how even the proximity to Disney would be awesome.  My buddy and I walked to downtown disney one night and passed all the main entrances on the way.  It was literally walking distance.  If your family can endure a half mile walk, then you probably don't even have to pay for parking if you go to the Disney parks.  I ran into 3 different people staffing the place during my stay and they were all super nice.  Very warm, friendly, and

We stayed here for two nights and had a very pleasant stay.  The room was on the second floor in the back and very quiet and very clean.  We arrived early (9:30 am) on our first day there and we were allowed to check in at that time because they had a room available.  That was nice to get settled in and then walk over to Disneyland. The staff was knowledgeable and answered all of our questions regarding Disneyland (they sell the tickets there also), transportation, and places to eat.  Very helpful.  I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Good values hotel around Disneyland area
Summary: This hotel is conveniently located 2.5 blocks away from the entrance to Disneyland resort. With the distance, you can opt to take a shuttle or just walk. Restaurants are within walking distance. There are pizza place, subway, and Chinese fast food resto by the corner of Katella and Harbor.   The hotel itself participated in Disneyland good neighbor hotel program, which enable guests to purchase Disneyland Hopper passes at discounted price. It helps, especially since Disneyland charge you arm and leg at the ticket booth by the gate.   As for the hotel itself, good value. It's intended to be a family oriented hotel. Majority of guests who stay here were families. The building itself is old, but the owner seems to maintain it real well. We had good experience during our stay and

My family and I stayed here in September. We had 6 adults and 2 kids in a 2 room suite. The rooms were decent sized and you can't beat the price. Located very close to Disneyland, the shuttle comes evey 30 minutes and its only about a 5 minute ride to the park. Check in was easy and the people were friendly.  Breakfast was coffee, juice, mini muffins and mini apples   Here's the problems: rooms were filthy. When we arrived there was gritty dirt on the bathroom counter and the carpet looked and smelled like it had never been cleaned. Kids went barefoot one time and feet were black. Found hair and dirt on the 'clean' towels. We found a random bottle of lotion on the ground and a beer can behind the nightstand. Rooms were musty and smelled like mildew and BO. Even with the great
Manager Response: Dear Tammy N Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are deeply concerned about your experience here at the islander & are currently looking in to this incident. Please accept our sincerest apologies.

Summary: They gave us a free upgrade from a 2 queen with a sofa bed to a 3 queen bed room. That was nice.. The room was large enough the bathroom was a bit small....but here is the problem.   There was a fire in the heating unit in my bedroom while I was gone.  So when I came back to my room to go to sleep there was no heat in my bedroom and the room smelled AWFUL.   I couldn't sleep in there because it smelled so bad and there was no heater.. The management didn't offer to help at all.  I wound up staying with some people I just met because they had already heard what happened and offered me one of their beds.  In the morning I went to the office and explained that given the fact I couldn't sleep in the room that I paid for that I should have the rate discounted or the charge removed
Manager Response: Dear AZactiveobserver, We are extremely sorry for the inconveniences caused during your stay. Here at the Islander we constantly strive to give all our guests the best experience possible. Your incident will be thoroughly looked into and is currently under review. We hope you decide to give us another chance to make it up to you.

Summary: I was taking a trip with my two sons to Disneyland and picked this hotel because of its location to the parks and it had free parking.  We arrived around 8 am and check it wasn't until 1pm but they let us park in the lot and gave us our parking pass.  They did this without us even checking us  in.  When we arrived later to check in, when they found out I was with my two sons they gave us a bigger room at no additional charge.  The room was clean, comfortable, affordable and only few minutes walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Nice folks, good value
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights prior to a Disney Cruise then 5 Nights afterwards. Rooms were good size, front desk staff without exception were very helpful and acommodating letting us leave bags to go to the parks on both occasions. We had first floor room and ground floor. Both rooms were fine. Dealing with some issues we had read about prior to our stay,   1. The Free breakfast, considering it was free it was fine we had something most mornings and although i agree coffee was not strong i used the Coffee machine provided and the free coffee from the room which was fine. If you wanted, at the end of the block there is a 7-11 and you could get some higher quality coffee for the room mchine if you wanted to.   2. The carpets, yes we did notice that they made your feet very dirty, we

Summary Heading: must stay if you have kids .
Summary: Clean , big rooms,can accommodate  5 people with out extra cost . Did disney and took a break (nap) and went back for the night. Left car at hotel ,save on parking and getting on bus agg that looked like a pain . Lots of places to eat , staff was great  price was fair ,      I reccomend ..

True enough....i have been loyal to the Islander Inn Anaheim for the past 12years and counting. I have been to many motels around Katella since my teenage years (Apollo Inn, Magic Carpet, Samoa to name a few) but never felt like being in Katella if it wasnt in Islander Inn. Its true that there are great motels around the area offering at lower rates but what stands out in Islander is its friendly owners, staff, its family warmth and security. i have seen how the rooms improved in standards incredibly for the past 12years. Whats great is Islander is situated next to the ART n OCTC bus stop (great routes to Mall of Orange, Huntington Beach n so forth). Its also across to Bubba Shrimps and the Anaheim Garden Walk. For Indian tourist, opposite the motel is the Ramada that have an

My brother and I stayed 6 nights in a two-bedroom unit.  We found the beds to be fine, the room was kept very clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We did not try the continental breakfast, since there was a fridge in the room we pretty much stocked up on fruit & such and did breakfast on our own.  The walk to Disneyland was about 15 minutes at a brisk pace, 20 on the way back when we were tired.  The pool looked nice, but we never spent any time there.  I would recommend this place as a good value, you can't beat the space in the rooms (they were larger than most in which I have stayed) and the proximity to the disney parks is good.  We will likely stay there again next time we go South.  The only negative for me was the TV.  Very few channels available, and

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We had a 5 night stay in a 2 bedroom unit. The place is clean and in a great location about 10-15 min walk to the gates of Disneyland. Breakfast if you want to call it that was provided. A tiny cup for coffee or juice,cake or pastry and a tiny apple. That's  it. The towels are pathetically thin and needed replacing 12months ago. We had a room on the ground floor and heard every cough, sneeze and conversation going on either side and above us. On our last night the family above arrived home at midnight ran up the metal stairs then proceeded to run riot until 3.00am. We did mention it the next morning but no apology was forthcoming. The price was cheap and I guess you get what you pay for. I'm in no hurry to return.
Manager Response: Dear GBDK, The management would like to sincerely apologies for the less than perfect stay. Your feedback is valuable to us and will be taken into consideration.

Summary: Four of us stayed for 5 nights in early Nov.  Had a 2Q and sofa bed (never used the sofa for sleeping)  We chose  the Islander because of Price and proximity to Disneyland, as well as having a fridge and microwave.  We were only in the room for sleeping, and a couple hours in the afternoons.  Kids enjoyed the pool a couple of times.  Reception desk always supplied extra towels for the pool.  We knew the continential breakfast was small, so we stocked up on breakfast items and ate in the room.  We had two issues with the room and they were remedied quickly.  WiFi worked well.  No issues with noise.  Beds were good.   If the price is right we will definately stay here again.  We were able to get a late check-out, and that helped to make the end of our vacation a bit less painful.

Summary Heading: Great location, well kept and clean
Summary: We stayed in room 228. The room was large, very clean and well kept. Pros:  42" Toshiba LCT TV, large refrigerator, microwave,, coffee maker, safe, small table with 2 chairs, comfortable beds, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, free parking, good closet and dresser space. Cons:  Continental breakfast barely qualifies as a breakfast. Everything is miniaturized. Coffee and juices are served in ~6 oz cups. Bran muffins are about 2 bites in size. I didn't realize they could be made this small. Apples are also available. Quite disappointing. The laundry room consists of one washer ($1.25) & one dryer ($1.00) so it stays quite busy. It is open from 8:00 am to 9:00 PM. It is only about a 15-20 minute walk to the Disney entrance from the hotel. The front desk was very helpful.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and close to Disney
Summary: Three of us stayed at the Islander Inn for 4 days/3 nights. It's quite close to Disney - it might be 10 minutes to the main gate, walking at a leisurely pace.  The Islander is close to fast food restaurants, table service restaurants and corner stores.   The room we stayed in was clean. It was a good size. The beds were comfortable. The room looked like it had been renovated fairly recently.  The front desk staff were very accommodating.   All three of us would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel that's close to Disney.

Summary Heading: Reasonable price and location, but marginal quality.
Summary: There were a lot of things I liked about this hotel, and some I didn't. The location is a reasonable walk to the Disneyland Park, about 15 minutes at a fairly fast pace. The parking was free, the WiFi dependable, and free, the room service was reliable, and the front desk folks were superb to work with, very accommodating. On the flip side, the continental breakfast was barely qualified as a breakfast and was promptly removed at 10 AM. The room was adequate, but worn, and the TV station choice was very limited. The beds were comfortable but if you pay for a sofa hideaway you'll be very disappointed in its comfort. The bathroom was very small, lacking counter space. The AC was great. All in all the facility felt old, worn, and tired, and it looked that way. If you spend most of
Manager Response: Dear Odysseus46, Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. Customer feedbacks are very important to us as it points out our strengths, but most importantly our weaknesses.  This helps us achieve our goal of providing the best value for all our customers. We have made recent cosmetic improvements throughout the property and our working on improving other areas of weakness.

Summary Heading: Excellent Location , You are paying for the location not the quality
Summary: This hotel met our needs for our family traveling.   I think  there are probably many other hotels that are nicer in same price range. I would probably not return, as there are so many hotels to choose from, and feel I could have done better.    It is close to the shops/restraunts at the garden walk, and walking distance of convention center.  The room was fairly nice size fridge, and microwave. The bathroom was very clean.   Carpet/floor,, not so clean, even after made service my and my kids feet were black.  Parking was tight fit. but it was free. and free is good.  Breakfast - we stayed there 4 nights and they offered same thing each day muffins (mini muffins),  danish and apples.   It  is in the lobby,so you grab and go back to your room and eat.
Manager Response: Dear mckinneygirl75070, we are blessed with being located at a very convenient location which a about a 10 minute walk to Disney. We sincerely value your feedback. All customer reviews are looked at and discussed amongst the management and appropriate measures are taken to make changes within our budget and business model.

Summary: Pros:10 min walk from Disney, 2 mins to cheesecake factory and ihop. Super-clean, big rooms and very helpful staff. For the price, can't imagine anywhere better to stay in the Anaheim area. Have stayed in some dives in this part of town but the Islander is very impressive. Cons: free breakfast is very basic. But it's free..

Summary Heading: First timers to Disneyland with Australian Family of 8
Summary: I cannot rave on enough about this Hotel.  We arrived at the Hotel from our 14 hour trip well ahead of our check in time, hoping they would hold our bags while we explored Anaheim.  Instead they checked us in promptly and the 4 Queen 2 brm suite was wonderful.  Nothing but Clean and spacious and we could park car straight outside.  Bathroom is tiny, but who cares?, it was clean and was sufficient for our means.  Bonus was the fridge and microwave so we could heat up our super size doggy bag leftovers when we ate out :)  Two wonderful Plasma TV's and having a Table and chairs to feed the kids their cereal in the morning was very convenient.  Laundry was cheap $1.25 for a load and $1.00 for the Dryer and just 2 doors down from our suite.  We will definitely be singing praises to

We took our children and grandchildren to Disneyland and just wanted a close, safe and clearn place to stay, at a low price.  Disneyland is so expensive that we really didn't want to pay high prices to just shower and sleep.  We rented 3 rooms from the Islander Inn and Suites.  For the price we paid, I wasn't expecting much, but how surprised we ALL were to find very  clean, large rooms.  Each room had a coffee maker, refrigerator, nice TV and the beds were extremely comfortable.  The front desk people, day and night were most hospitable and helpful.  Our entire family was very, very pleased by the service and amenities we received at here.  We would not hesitate to stay here again!

This hotel was just what we were after, budget friendly with rooms that were better than the average for this area.  Close to 7-11, Bubba Gumps and lots of other food options, like subway.  Right across the street from the Garden Walk shopping center.  ART shuttle picks you up first on its route which is a plus because by the end of the route on busy days the bus would fill up and people had to wait for the next bus to come 20-30 mins later.  You can walk to this hotel about a 15 min walk to the front entrance, at the end of the day it feels like a 30 min walk however.  The pool area is small but clean and a great place to relax at the end of the day, think pool was open till 10:00.  This hotel does have a laundry room but it is one washer and one dryer and gets used often so

Summary Heading: Simple dependable value, very good beds, friendly staff
Summary: Disneyland travelers: This is perfect if you want to save your money for the parks and souvenirs.  Parking is free for guests.  Walk (20 mins) or use the ART bus which has a 3 hotel loop route (15 mins to get to Disneyland and 6 minutes to return to hotel) and avoid the nightmare of Disneyland parking.  The last day, we didn't have a bus pass and checked out of the room, so we paid $15 and parked in the Downtown Disney lot and walked further than if we had just walked from the Islander Inn.  If you are going to stay in the parks all day and night, stay here.  When the lights go out, all is clean, comfortable, and quiet.  What else matters, if you aren't in your room except to sleep?  If you want a great breakfast, good pool, public internet, go somewhere else.  The breakfast

We took a bottom floor family suite was Islander Inn for 2 nights. Location wise, Islander Inn is very good - walkable to both Disneyland and GardenWalk (for food).   The rooms itself is nothing to shout about - they look like 30-40 years old, given a fresh coat of paint. Comfortable enough, just that one can hear the upper floor occupants quite clearly if they move about.

We stayed here (with our 2 young boys) for 4 nights in October 2012 and the property was perfect for us. We stayed in one of their family type rooms which has 3 queen beds (one in a seperate bedroom). The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the location of the property in relation to the Disney parks is great - just a 10 to 15 minute walk to the main entrances. There was a simple free continental breakfast offering each day (muffins/pasteries/OJ/Coffee) but as you have a decent sized fridge in your room (plus microwave) you can make up your own breakfasts easily. There are a couple of small markets (7-11 style shops close by for purchasing cereal, juice and fruit). The property offers free parking which was great too. There is a pool but as our time each day was spent at

Summary Heading: Budget hotel, decent rooms, worst "free" breakfast ever.
Summary: I'm here at Disneyland with the kids staying at your average Disney cheap hotel.  I've got to say, the room is fine.  Plenty of space and reasonably clean.  The towels are threadbare and a little "grey" but again this place was a bargain.    Thing is, this place advertised free breakfast.  I've been to about a dozen hotels close to Disneyland and was expecting the usual overcooked eggs, cold cereal, and a piece of fruit or two for breakfast which the kids love and I am fine with.  Thing is, the Islander Inn served nothing but coffee, some apples and stale pastry for  breakfast.  Even my non-picky kids wouldn't eat it.  So, while I saved $10.00 bucks a night on the room I'm now stuck with spending 30 a morning for breakfast for 5.  Honestly, you can do better for a few dollars
Manager Response: Dear David S,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. Customer feedback is extremely important to us to maintain and improve standards in all our areas. The breakfast we serve at the islander is a complimentary breakfast which consists of fresh apples, danish pastries, assorted muffins, orange juice, tea & freshly brewed coffee. Here at the Islander we constantly discuss ways in which we are able to give our customers the best value for their stay. Limited space and budget, currently prevents us from serving a complete hot breakfast at this establishment. We sincerely apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused during your stay here at the Islander.

Summary Heading: Great for families and great location!
Summary: Good value for money - this was the perfect choice of accommodation for our New Zealand family! It is smaller than many of the big chain hotels and very well located.  It was a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and saved $15 a day for parking – but if you don’t want to walk there is an ART bus stop right outside the hotel that takes you directly to the main gate at Disneyland.  Across the road is the Anaheim Garden Walk – a restaurant and shopping complex with plenty of choice for eating out.  It was also a 10 minute drive to a fantastic shopping outlet centre. There is a 7-eleven very close for essential purchases and if you have a car there is a large Food for Less super-market about a mile down the road.  We got a two-bedroom suite, so the kids (x3) had their own room with their

Summary Heading: All the way from Australia...the place was the perfect stay!!
Summary: If you want a place to stay that's large enough to accomodate a family of 4, great swimming pool, adequate breakfast to get you started, friendly staff and management, not to many people(there are only 30 odd rooms), have your tours booked for you, close to 7-11 for those day to day food purchases and a clean room then this is your place to stay for your disneyland holiday. We stayed here from Australia for 12 nights and it was perfect. We went to Disneyland, LA tour, Legoland and knotts. ART shuttle disney bus stop is out the front or 15 min walk to Disney. Don't pay higher prices at the bigger places with larger crowds, stay here and save at least $50 a night. Ask for a rear top room-its further away from the street-and you can see the fireworks from your room.

Summary Heading: Overated! Close to Disneyland. Awful Breakfast. Not clean enough.
Summary: Pros: - Room Size - Distance to Disneyland (less than 15 min walk) - Price (About $70 with taxes) - Close to restaurants - Nice and strong wifi signal.  Cons: - Worst breakfast I've ever seen. - It wasn't clean enough. - Towels are awful (small and with stains) - Blankets are not smooth. - The shower could be better. - Staff weren't pleasant at all.

The main reason for choosing this hotel was the location.  We were going to a baseball game at Angel Stadium and also to Disneyland and this was convenient for both.  The room was clean with comfortable beds however the bathroom was quite small.  The breakfast was very basic, just small muffins and pastries, coffee and orange juice.  Disneyland is within walking distance and there is a nice shopping mall opposite with plenty of dining choice.

I've read a number of the other reviews and have found nothing to dispute.  The bathroom is small, the beds were very firm (no pillowtop mattress) and the continental breakfast consists of small muffins, croissants, coffee and orange juice.  It is necessary to make a U turn to head toward Disneyland but it is within 10 minutes walking distance if you prefer to go that route.  We walked it with two 6 year old children for 2 days.  They were very tired after being at Disneyland all day until it closed but they made it.  We did not use the pool but felt the water and it was a comfortable temp and it was clean as was the room.  The TV was a flat screen LCD and worked well.  The AC worked very well and the microwave, coffee maker, and small fridge/freezer were adequate for our needs.

We stayed at the Islander Inn and Suites for 11 Nights in September.   I was very nervous about our reservation as you never know what you get with a smaller non-chain hotel.   The hotel room was comfortable and large enough to accomodate my wife and I and 2 children.    We had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa bed (which we never used).  The hotel is very basic but kept very clean.   The pool area isn't large but is very adequate for the hotel size (only 34 rooms in the hotel).  Most days we had the pool to ourselves.   The pool area is kept very clean and there is plenty of lawn chairs around the pool.  Our stay wasn't perfect.  Here are a few things that happened. 1.  We were moved after 1 night due to renovations. 2.  At first our room had a faint sewer smell.   I assume this

Summary Heading: Try the Super 8 across the street!!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel with my parents for two nights in September.  The location is nice, because it's very close to the Toy Story parking lot, but because of the median you have to make U turns.  The room itself was fine, but the bathroom was awful.  The sink was crammed in with the toilet and shower, so only one person could get ready at a time.  The bathroom also smelled like sewage, even though it appeared to be clean.  The bed was hard and uncomfortable, plus we had the added bonus of being awakened the first morning by someone laying carpet in the room below us at 8:25am.  The loud banging went on for half an hour before I called and complained to the front desk.  The woman who answered the phone said she would ask them to stop, and they did, for maybe twenty minutes
Manager Response: Dear Chiwawa4556,  We sincerely apologize for your unfortunate experience. We here at the Islander strive to give the very best of service to our entire occupancy. This matter is currently under review and is taken very seriously.  Thank you very much for your feedback.

Summary: I just got back from a Disneyland vacation which started my first two night in the Islander Inn on a Sunday and Monday night over Labor day weekend.   Note that is is a 2 star hotel, so this review takes that into consideration.  The downside:  The free continental breakfast was paltry by even continental breakfast standards. An option of one fruit, small applies, (who eats apples from breakfast anyway?) was a bit disappointing. I would have liked to see melons or oranges or anything else really. The did have Orange juice, which was good, and coffee, but only mini muffins and mini butterhorns completed the breakfast. It would be great if they added some granola and yogurt or something to add a bit more variety.   The pool was cold. It was early September and in the upper 80's

Summary Heading: Very clean, great price, and walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Disneyland is expensive, and to keep costs down, we really wanted to find a reasonably priced hotel. I'm not the Disney type--I went kicking and screaming with my husband and stepchildren.  Knowing I'd be in agony all day, I insisted our nights would be spent at a comfortable hotel.  This place worked out fine.  1.  It's not a new property, but it's CLEAN. I'm a germ freak, so that is most important to me.  2.  The pool is very nice.  I could have stayed there all day instead of waiting in lines.  3.  We got a two-bedroom suite, so the kids had their own room with their own TV.  Perfect.    4.  The shared bathroom was small, but CLEAN.  5.  The service from the hotel staff was outstanding.  Very friendly.  6.  The location is excellent.  We walked to Disney, and it wasn't too

We went to Disneyland to run the Half Marathon Labor Day weekend. Looking for a two bedroom suite at a reasonable price was proving to be a formidable task and then... The Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites popped up.  Reasonably priced, close to Disneyland, and the accommodations were great. We were able to walk to the start line at Disneyland from our lodgings. Couldn't have asked for a better location. Would return there in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Very convenient if you have a big family. Close to Disneyland.
Summary: We chose this hotel because of the room options. My mom was travelling with us and we did not want to have to get her her own separate room but we did want her to have privacy when staying in a room with us. We got a suite (?) that had 2 queen beds in 1 room and 1 queen bed in the another room but which was still in our hotel room, just separated by a door, and we shared a bathroom in which each "room" had its own door to. They also have 4 queens in 2 room suites and family rooms with a queen and a bunkbed.  Our service was poor, the man who checked us in was unhelpful and you had to pry the information out of him, he was also unwelcoming and ungrateful.The guy who checked us out was much better, way more friendly and helpful. The pool is very small. Our room was clean but very

Stayed at this hotel from 3 to 10 Aug. The person who checked us in was AJ and he knew Malaysia well...which was a pleasant surprise. The room was comfortable and sufficient for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. About a 10 min walk to Disneyland. Restaurants and shops are nearby. Breakfast was sufficient with muffins, scones and coffee. The only downside was the laundry room which was closed at 9pm and opened at 8am. As travelers, our schedule was packed, we were usually out by 8.30am and back only by 8.30pm, so there were several days we couldnt do our laundry.  Perhaps some arrangement could be made to allow guests to use the laundry room earlier or have it closed later. Overall, our stay was pleasant and we will come back again.

Summary Heading: A Very Nice Place to Stay
Summary: Made a last minute decision to go Disneyland for 2 days.  Our usual hotel was booked, this one looked like a great alternative by the reviews and location.  We were fortunate to get two rooms, they even gave us our request of top floor facing the Disneyland fireworks AND let us check in at 10:30 in the morning (we arrived early from our out-of-state drive).  The hotel was very similar to our regular (and much more expensive hotel), had a couple of Disney banners hanging from the top, it was small & cozy, with the pool in front which keeps the noise down. We were already happy and had not even opened the door to the room yet!       The rates are extremely reasonable here, quite a bit better than our usual place, and the only differences I could give you are:  it is a little

We stayed at this hotel for the July Fourth week. Most of the reviews already said what I wanted to say. The hotel rooms are comfortable and well equipped with family necessity like microwave, refrigerator, and a large safe (big enough for a 16.5" laptop, a plus for me). I did interacted with people from the front desk, and they are very friendly and helpful, the gentleman that helped me on the check out day even offer us a discount for future booking if I call the hotel directly! That is what I call a good customer service. The breakfast is basic just like most of the hotels in the area. We did enjoy our stay and we will be back to this property.

I can honestly say that, apart from breakfast, this is probably, the nicest room we stayed in and on a 35 night holiday, we stayed in a few. On arrival we greeted by a friendly guy (good luck in your bachelors btw) who checked us in at 10am! The room was great, clean and spacious with coffee maker, microwave and fridge. The pool area was clean too. The walk to Disney was approx 15 minutes if the traffics lights were on your side! There a few restaurants around (within walking distance) including Denny's, IHOP, pizza etc. Disney shuttle is $3 per person for all day use and stops outside the hotel although we did not use it. Free wifi too. Laundry $1.25 wash, $1 dry. Ice machine. Breakfast very basic but ok. Very friendly place and highly recommended.

We stayed here at the beginning of August 2012 for 6 nights.  The hotel is nice, but quirky.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  We were there during the Olympics and NBC did not come in on their tvs, so we were disappointed to not have that to watch in the evenings.  The Wifi was terrible and in the evenings it was impossible to use.  Every day the breakfast was cinnamon rolls, mini muffins, orange juice, coffee and a bowl of apples. We had the 2 bedroom suite with 3 queen beds total and that was such a great thing to have for our family with young kids because could put them to bed at 8 and not have to go to bed, too!  The bathroom is accessible by both rooms, but is very small.  The rooms were clean, but the carpets desperately need to be shampooed.  I had twin

I stayed between 7/19 and 7/21/2012. This place could be an Inn but certainly not a Suite. I needed a place that can accommodate 4 adults and one child. The Anaheim Islander provides 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The queen bed mattress was okay for me but the pillows were very soft. The sofa bed is right next to the AC (noisy) blowing air at foot/leg level. My wife complained of a smell when we checked in. The bathroom is tiny, really tiny. The breakfast? The breakfast is a joke. The only hot item was the coffee. I didn't interact with the staff. I didn't eat at any restaurant around this place. I paid $115/night plus tax. All in all it was not worth it. Will I comeback here: nope.
Manager Response: Dear Maifriend  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are sorry that your experience at the Islander wasn’t a great one.  The room you booked happens to be a regular room with a sofa sleeper and not a suite. Our suites do not come with sofa sleepers instead have either 3 queens or 4 queen beds with a door separating the suite for privacy which ideal for families of 6 or 8 people. We really appreciate your feedback and are currently looking into your concerns. Thank you very much!

Summary: We stayed at the islander inn and suites from 1st July to 9th July 2012. We had a very comfortable stay and would stay there again. We had a 2 bedroom suite which had a TV in each room a microwave and fridg,and this was ideal for 7 people. The bathroom was entered from each room which was great. The rooms were clean and the service was very good. The breakfast of muffins, pastries and tea coffee and juice was adequate. It was comfortable walking distance from disneyland and a 7 11 shop, also plenty of eaterie places and also Bubba Gump restraurant across the road. The Garden Grove shopping area was also handy.

Suite 123 at the Islander was a sweet surprise!  The location was superb.  The room was amazingly clean, and the staff was so very friendly.  While the bathroom was small, it was functional and that's all that mattered.  Any problems were handled immediately with grace and pride!  If you're looking for ultra modern and cookie cutter suites that could be anywhere, don't stay here.  If you want ambiance, great service, clean rooms, and an experience that you will remember, ask for suite 123.  You will be pleasantly surprised!

We stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites the weekend of July 20th 2012. We chose the two bedroom suite which was equipped with 4 queen beds, two 32 inch TV's, one frige, one mircrowave and one bathroom that can be entered from either bedroom. This place is not very large or fancy but was clean, convenient and met all the needs for a trip to Disneyland Resort and Califonia Adventure.  There were a total of two adults and 5 kids ranging from 8 years to 16 years old so the two bed rooms came in handy. I love being with the family but was you've had that quality time and you need a little quiet time, the kids can go into the other room and do there thing while you relax by the A/C in your room. The kids went swimming in the pool and it's not very large but then there weren't

Summary Heading: Pleasant little hotel with a friendly staff.
Summary: This is a basic hotel clearly designed for families visiting Disneyland. I was just dropping my grandson with his family, so all I needed was a place to sleep. But they gave me a room perfect for six people. Two double beds, a bunk bed, microwave, refrigerator, free wifi and a safe. My grandson liked my place better than the fancier hotel room his parents had.

I stayed in a 2-bedroom suite for 5 nights in June 2012.  The gentleman who was at check-in was very nice and helped us buy our transit passes for our stay.  Our room was on the 2nd floor and was a VERY spacious 2-bedroom suite.  The suite was very clean and bright and we felt at home right away.  The bathroom was in-between both bedrooms and the doors sometimes opened on to each other but, other than the limited counter space, it was a minor inconvenience.  The refrigerator in the room was especially convenient for storing sandwiches, snacks, and water for our days at Disneyland.  One other nice word about the gentleman at the desk - when he saw us waiting for the Anaheim Transit Shuttle for far more than 20 minutes, he called the company and asked them to send someone

Summary Heading: Good value and a good location
Summary: Stayed there for some Dland visiting.  The staff was friendly and responsive (not that I recall any issues).  The place was clean and had plenty of room. We used the 2 Queen with a sleeper so the extra space was welcome.  It is a good solid 10 minute walk to the parks.  Not a long distance but at the end of the day, it wasn't the most welcome stroll.  I would longingly look at the closer hotels as we slogged past.  There was a convenience store and some cheap eateries close by.  (It was nice to load up on Subway before venturing into the parks).  I had no real complaints and I would recommend to anyone.  Personally I may try for a closer location on the next go around but I'd stay here again.

The most appealing thing about this property is the rate; however, you get what you pay for.  We decided to stayed here for 2 nights and it was fine place to stay for going to Disneyland all day and just sleeping at night.    The room smelled like old cigarette smoke and was a little musty...  we opened the windows for awhile and we were fine.  The beds were clean but a little on the uncomfortable side.  The continental breakfast of mini-muffins and danish were okay.  Overall it was average...

This place is extremely basic.  The beds were fine, the room was clean, the location is a block & a half to the convention center/disney.  It's a little bit more of a walk to downtown disney.  The continental breakfast is not a continental breakfast--it's coffee, juice, and muffins.  That's it.  It was fine with me but if you think you're getting a breakfast with bagels or toast or bacon, you're not! :)  The distinctive thing about this place was the tv stations.  You get the local stations and DOZENS of foreign channels (mostly asian (japanese, korean) and spanish speaking).  But not like, normal cable channels.  Again, this was fine by us but if you're coming here with kids or expect to veg out and watch a bunch of vh1, this is not the hotel for you!  The pool isn't huge but

Good clean place.  Not too far to disney.  About 10-15 minute walk. Rooms were very clean and beds were fine. Bathroom was quite small though.  Breakfast was just pastries, coffee tea and orange juice.  They were very helpful with directions and organising transport to the airport. Would recommend.

We stayed at the Islander inn from the 18th-21st June 2012.  The hotel is in a convenient location for walking to disneyland, about a 10-15 min walk. What's really helpful is the fact that there was a 7/11 down the road which was open 24 hrs. It had lots of microwaveable food (rooms had a microwave for the late night munchies!) and sandwiches which were really helpful to take along to disneyland (their turkey ham sandwich was really good!)  Just round the corner, there is an IHOP and across from the hotel, the Anaheim garden walk (a restaurant and shop area, sparse though).   In terms of getting around to other places aside from disneyland, its not as convenient (there is a bus stop infront (The ART) but it only goes to disneyland). However the Anaheim garden walk is one of the

Overall, this place is an excellent choice when staying in Anaheim for Disneyland or a conference.  The rooms were very reasonably priced, they were clean, they had a microwave and a fridge, and there is guest laundry onsite.  The man at the desk who helped me when I checked in and out was extremely friendly and helpful.  The only negative I have about this place is that the cable in our room DID NOT WORK.  Every channel on the TV was "snow."  We tried jiggling the wires and connections, but everything seemed to be tightly connected. When my friend called the office to ask about the cable, he was told (not by the friendly man who checked me in, but another employee), "There must be some problem with the cable. Yes, thank you, goodbye."  Aside from that, though, I highly

Certainly not a 'five star' resort, but very adequate for a family stay. Inn is an older style motel, but nice and clean and a good size and certainly very close to everything. Disneyland is about a ten minute stroll away.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is very basic, so stock up at supermarket and have breakfast in your room, or IHop/Garden Walk restaurants are very near.  Tips: If you don't have a car (we didn't) we strongly recommend stocking up on food.The supermarket is about 5 minutes drive away - although the convenience store ( five minutes walk) stocks the basics.  If possible, get an upstairs room....we were downstairs and it was sometimes very noisy with guests stomping around above us at all hours. Other than that, hotel was far enough back to avoid

Summary Heading: A hidden gem a short walk from Disneyland!
Summary: My family which consists of my wife, two daughters aged 4 and 6 and myself had a unbelievably  good time at Disneyland and southern California thanks in large part to the wonderful stay we had at the Anaheim Islander. When booking I mentioned that I was a light sleeper so would like a corner unit, top floor away from any noise and when we arrived, they had a very nice unit tucked away in the back waiting for me! Instantly I knew I was going to have a good stay as I'd get sleep (and I did!).  The rooms are fairly nice looking and very clean. I'm borderline OCD when it comes to cleanliness and this place met my expectations.  I wish they would add a wall outlet right at desk level for things like cell phone, laptop, etc charging but there are ones around the room so this isn't a

This is a very family friendly hotel.  The suits have plenty of room and the microwave and refrigerator come in handy and save money when traveling with children.  It's also in a great location.  You're very close to some great dinning, like PF Changs, The Cheese Cake Factory, or Johnny Rockets.  You can walk and shop at the City Walk and you are a quick shuttle ride to the gates of Disneyland and California Adventure Parks.  The staff was fun and friendly and the rooms were very clean.  It has an overall charming appearance from the door mats at each door to the beautiful vines that surround the property.  Each room was decorated in a warm and inviting manor and looked to have just been remodeled and updated.  The pool was clean and refreshing.  It was just a great stay.  I

My husband and I were at Disney for one night, and chose this motel due to Trip Advisor. We were able to check in at 10 AM, and leave our car there. The room was clean, 2 queens and a sofa bed. Corner room 222 upstairs, allowed us to have cross ventilation which was good because the room smelled musty. Everything else was clean, even the vinyl shower curtain. We had a good nights sleep after walking miles all day long, and the price was right.

We found this hotel on tripadvisor and it was better than expected.  We stayed in two rooms closest to the pool and upstairs.     I really liked the blinds on the windows.  I know that's a funny start but they were easy to operate and very effective.   The WiFi worked good and when I needed to use a printer (we just had a laptop) they let me use the one in the hotel office.  The man at the desk actually suggested it so I didn't feel like I was imposing.    I would like a better breakfast but was impressed that the danish were fresh and I thought the OJ was good.  The staff was very friendly and appreciated our business.    We bought the shuttle to Disneyland but we could have walked.  It was cheap enough we wanted the option because we had kids with us.    The pool was nice and

This is our third time back and this time it was with the whole family. There were five of us, we had a two queen and a sofabed room. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were always clean and made up for us. One day we stayed in and made it a pool day and we told the housekeeper all we wanted were extra towels and that she didn't need to make the room up. She came back and checked on us to make sure we didn't want anything else and then later another housekeeper came by and checked on us again. The price per night that we paid was very reasonable. I've seen a couple reviews that didn't like their breakfast and I'll just say it was small. They have pastries and small muffins with OJ and coffee, whenever it got low the staff made sure they filled it back up even

We stayed on two separate occasions and had possibly the best room and the worst room in the complex.  Our first stay we had an upstairs room which was quite large (2 queen beds and a sofa bed).  Our second stay we had a smaller downstairs room right next to the ice machine (2 queen beds).  We noticed a noticable difference in the noise level and the light level between the two rooms, but it was literally a place to sleep, and the ice machine although quite noisy, certainly didn't disrupt anybody's sleep.   The pool was nice, the staff were friendly and helpful and it was great that you can check in at any time which was meant we could check in after spending the day (and night) at Disneyland. Easy walking distance to Disneyland, and there is a shuttle service (that you

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, great location, awesome price.
Summary: Flew into LA and needed 1 night stay before checking into Paradise Pier at Disneyland. Found this hotel through tripsdvisor. Excellent choice. Staff was friendly, helpful. Room was just right for family of 4 with 2 adult children (sleeper sofa and 2 queen beds). Great location. Would recommend for anyone searching for inexpensive, clean, friendly hotel near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location, size, and value, poor breakfast.
Summary: Rooms were large. Beds were not comfy. Limited pillows and blankets. Fridge, microwave, safe add to the room amenities. Breakfast sucked. Mini muffins, oj, and cheap coffee. No shuttle service. Good front desk help. Would stay again but prepare for Micky D's.

Our robotic team and families stayed here when we were there for the VEX World Championship. The rooms were clean and the hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were adequately furnished for our needs and the hotel location was close to the convention center. The breakfast was a little on the short side, I might suggest rotating the selection of breakfast items and large cups for coffee.

Great stay, close to Disney and plenty of eating houses. Washing/dryer room was handy and great also. Friendly and helpful desk staff, nothing too much trouble, organised tours plus Disney Tickets (discounted), airport shuttle, and bag storage. Breakfast snacks from lobby were fresh and adequate before setting out for disney park. Rooms light and roomy. Bath clean and plenty of towels.  Wifi , had no problems connecting nor with speed. No complaints, and can recommend for a great place to stay in Anaheim. Central, great rates, safe, family friendly, clean pool and rooms, and wonderful staff. Thankyou!

What we needed: 2 room suite for 2 couples going to Disneyland for the weekend. Limited time in room.  Review: This 2 room suite was very simple but had all we needed, and was clean and tidy. We are from just a few hours away doing a quick weekend trip to Disneyland and didn't need anything super extravagant. There is a shuttle bus out front that takes you to the parks, you buy the tix at the front desk (as well as the super discounted Dland resort park tix - highly recommend for So Cal residents), and we were on our way. Breakfast was skimpy - only danishes, coffee, and juice, but otherwise, completely satisfied. Would totally stay there again.   Maybe request a flatter pillow or bring your own, those things were huge!

We just retuned to Calgary from a week holiday to Anaheim. We stayed in this hotel and we are fully satisfied with their services and cnvinience. I would like to thank Mr. Dilip for his eagerness to help and for the satifactory customer service. This facility is highly recommended for its safety tp the guest and to the relaxing atmosphere.

Summary Heading: Super Friendly and Helpful Staff...and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We chose this hotel on Booking.com because it was 1 block from Disneyland (it's a little further, but close enough...15 min walk).  When we arrived the lady that checked us in was very well trained...she gave us the wifi login and password, the bus route number we would need to get back to the hotel, check-in/check-out date (to verify), and upon seeing my two 5 year olds, upgraded us to a slightly bigger room so they had a little space to play. That was the first 7 min of getting there.  The rooms are standard size of what you'd expect from one of the smaller hotels, which is fine...we weren't going to hang out in the room, we were going to Disneyland!  On the second day we stayed, I noticed the TV wasn't working (it was unplugged, but I didn't think of that).  One of the maid

We arrived last April 14 with my family and stayed there up to 21st. We are from Calgary and has tried this hotel due to impressive review from this website. We are not disappointed...Excellent service, great facility. This hotel is highly recomended for itsunparalled customer care and their willingness to satify their customer. Feels like home away from home. Thanks Mr. Dilip for your awesome service.  From Ed of Calgary

Summary Heading: Simply the best at a lower price
Summary: If you are the type of person who isn't spending much time in your room, but you want cleanliness, a nice bed, just a little more space, and every detail well thought out, along with solid construction to tamp down noise, this is it.  With this kind of attention to detail, such as knowing that your comforter and blankets are very clean, it is hard to pass up this bargain for a Disneyland trip.    The staff was extremely nice and kind and friendly and helpful.
Simple advice: - Near to Disneyland park.  - Good Attend.  - Fast to arrived on the outlet.  I really like this Hotel.

Summary Heading: Great value rooms, easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: We chose the Anaheim Islander due to its close proximity to Disneyland, an easy 15 min walk to the main gates. This was fantastic, as it was good exercise and there was also a 7-eleven and ABC Mart on the way home to pick up groceries. We had the family room (210) with 4 queen beds, 2 TVs, fridge and microwave. It had only one bathroom however, but we were aware of this upon reservation.  So if you think you may need two bathrooms, then it may be better to reserve two separate rooms.  Rooms were clean and well maintained. Reception service was always friendly and helpful. Wireless internet was good but we experienced a few dropouts. There was also a couple of days where fresh towels were not provided and we needed to get some from reception.  Free breakfast (mini muffins,

Stayed at this hotel from 29 march-7 April 2012. We had a room with two queen beds and a sofa although we had requested just a two queen room we was not charged anymore for having the sofa. The room was clean and spacious, the beds very comfortable,and lots of pillows. The walk to Disneyland was only about 10 minutes,it did seem longer on the way back when legs and feet were tired! We also had free wi fi which made my 12 year old happy! The staff were friendly and helpful! Only one thing that I would have prefered different was the breakfast, instead of pastries and muffins would rather have had cereal and maybe toast. This is the second time my family and I have stayed here and we will definitely stay again on our next vacation to America. A.Ogden, UK

Stayed Mar 15/12 - Mar 17/12 From the outside it looks like your a basic hotel but it was well worth the $230 (for two nights) we paid. 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland with a 7-11 just down the block and food (Bubba Gump Shrimp, Cheesecake Factory, etc) right across the street.  Great, comfortable beds with a number of pillows that were really good. Nice LCD TV with a mini fridge and microwave in the bedroom (proved useful after a long Disneyland day).  WiFi was good but loading pages took 5-10 seconds more than it usually would (i.e. at home). Maybe the only thing to be concerned about is parking, meaning if you don't get a spot you might be unlucky.  Very convenient and would stay here again as opposed to somewhere right across from Disneyland.

Stayed in family suites.  Rooms were generous with comfortable beds.  Hotel was very clean. No bed bugs!  Very near Disney parks.  Breakfast - OK, pastrys, donuts and coffee to take back to your room.  Really helpful in letting you know where and how to get around and has Disney and bus passes available to purchase on site.  We were from NZ and were impressed.
We stayed for a week and it was great. No complaints, staff was friendly, rooms were clean, continental breakfast was good. Would go back again.

Summary Heading: Simple, clean, affordable and good service.
Summary: When I made my reservation I did not expect too much from this hotel based on the cheap price but after staying here for 4 days I must say that this hotel is great. They let us checked in 2 hrs early, room is very clean, beds and pillows are very comfortable. The family 2 room suite is perfect for a family of 6 and parents has privacy. Distance from Disney park is not bad at all, we walked back and forth. This hotel is located at Disney Downtown, but very quite during night time. Breakfast is only donuts/sweet rolls, apples, coffee and orange juice but it was just fine thats all we needed. Housekeepers are great also. Front desk people are friendly as well.
