I will definetely stay here again. The price is reasonable...

We stayed at the Islander last week for 6 days, we couldn't have asked for a better location.  We arrived early on check in day and headed straight to Disneyland figuring 10 a.m. would be too early to check in.  We ended up staying at the park longer then planned so I phoned the hotel to make sure we had a room if we checked in late, it was no problem.  Check in went smooth and we were givien the room we requested, a two room suite with 3 queen beds.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  We bought the Anaheim Resort Transit tickets from the front desk as we weren't exactly sure how long a walk it was to Disneyland and if our two kids would be willing to walk.  We only waited for the bus one morning, the other mornings we walked to the park.  By the end of the day our feet

I booked a room for 2 nights so we could go to Disneyland for a birthday celebration. I gave them my credit card info, and I let them know we would be arriving late after 10pm. When we got there about 11pm, he told me they had overbooked their rooms and did not have the room I reserved that would accommodate my family! There was a convention in town and most hotels were booked. The man called their other property across the street and found us a room there. That hotel was $33 a day less and a very old motel that I wouldn't normally stay at but we were exhausted and ended up staying there. I think this is bad business and I am hoping it doesn't happen to others!
Manager Response: Dear Angelina758  We are currently looking into the incident and would like to sincerely apologize for the inconvenience that you have experienced. We really value your feedback. Thank you again for your time.

Summary: Clean, large rooms, family-friendly, free parking, walking distance to Disneyland and great price. Amazing find!
Great location within an easy walk to Disney Land and numerous food options nearby, the room was great the staff were fantastic

My wife and I just returned from our Disney vacation. We booked the Islander based on reviews from Tripadvisor and let me say we were not disappointed. The rooms were clean, the front desk staff was friendly and helpful, the cleaning staff were there every morning with a cheerfull "good morning."  The location is very close to mini-marts if you need to grab a few things for the family or yourself, which we thought was great. Overall, we will return here for our next Disney vacation as the Islander exceeded our expectaions. One last thing, just want to say hello to AJ at the front desk from Andy and Nina.

Travelling as a family of 5 , hotels that can accommodate all of us in one room are few on the ground. The islander is motel style and certainly not glamourous but it is clean, conveniently located and good value for money.

We've stayed here a few times in the family suites, so we thought we'd go again as a couple. They had only giant rooms, and put us in a corner.  There was no wi-fi access AT ALL from our room.  Since we were there on business AND pleasure, that was really a problem.  The rooms are always great, and this time was no exception, and walking to Disneyland is okay, but tough on the way "home" as it's one of the farthest to walk to.  Love having micro/fridge especially since the "breakfast" is pretty lame.  But if you need large, spacious rooms, this is definitely the place to stay.

This is my second year at the Islander Inn. I come to Anaheim for the NAMM show and stay for four nights. No bells and whistles here, but I travel on a budget and price was very important. I also demand cleanliness, and the Islander Inn is very clean. Service is great, especially at the front desk where they were more than happy to print things out for me and accommodate all my requests. I highly recommend staying here.

After searching long and hard, we finally settled on booking our 10days in Anahiem in May 2011 at the Islander Inn and Suites. It exceeded expectations given the price. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the owners and staff were helpful and full of advice to make our trip very enjoyable. With 2 Adults and 2 children (11 and 9) the rooms were roomy and well laid out.

Great hotel for a great price in a great location!  A short easy walk to the Disneyland Parks!  Hotel was quiet and safe with friendly staff.  Rooms were clean with comfortable queen size beds.  (Was able to look into some of the family rooms with bunks that could comfortably accommodate larger families)  Grounds well kept.  Breakfast was juice, coffee and fresh doughnuts.  Convenient microwave, coffepots and large mini refrigerator in room.  Free wi-fi (although a bit slow at times)  This is a great family value for those looking for easy access to the parks.  Close to other restaurants and shopping outside of the parks as well.  We will make this our hotel for future trips to Disneyland!

Stayed in the Kids Suite (#217) from Dec. 19-29, 2011 for our trip to Southern California. There 4 teens and momma. We also had a friend spend the night and there was plenty of room. The room was a good size with 2 queen beds and a dbl bunk bed. There was a microwave, apartment sized refer , coffee maker, free wi-fi, and a large flat screen tv in the room.  The room was clean, the beds were comfy and the handy laundry room was two doors down. The parking was free which saved us a lot of money too.  This motel is located 2 blocks from Disneyland and across the street from lots of restaurants like PF Chang and Cheescake Factory. The Gardengrove Mall is also across the street. On the opposite corner near Disneyland  - there was a pizza parlor, Chinese buffet, Subway, smoothie and

Rooms were perfect for us.  Had the option of 2 queens and a sofa bed pull out.  Rooms were very clean and area was quiet for sleeping.  Pool was on the cool side, but refreshing on a warm day.  Breakfast was donuts and juice.  Wi-Fi had very good reception and speed.  Walk was do able to Disney 1 mile, but the Anaheim transit picked up and stopped right in front of the motel for $4.00 a day and came every 20 minutes. Price was a good value with AAA discount.  They sold tickets out of a machine in the lobby, but I had already got a good deal on hopper multi-passes from AAA.  Staff was very helpful and courteous. Garden Walk was across the street with restaurant choices close by.

We stayed at the Islander for 2 nights with two young children aged 4 years and 15 months. The rooms were clean and tidy, the carpets were new, so it was perfect for my half walking and half crawling baby. The management of the hotel, run it perfectly. The reception was always friendly and helpful. The hotel is well maintanied with fresh coats of pain, the pool is clean and was warm to swim in. There was also a laundrey room, which was perfect as we had to do a load. Is is 10 minutes walk from Disney entrance, it is 5 min walk to the eating area. It is just a fantastic hotel, I highly recommend it, especially for young families. I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Poor ventilation and pot smoking neighbours were a bad mix, but the rest of the stay was great!
Summary: It took us 13 minutes to walk to Disneyland from the hotel, with 2 small kids, nice and close! The price was fair and the staff was very friendly. The "breakfast" was horrible, a few stale pastries and the coffee was hard to choke down. The rooms were very nice and updated and a good size. My only complaint would be the ventilation system in the bathrooms. Apparently they are all connected to other rooms - my 9 year old ran out of the bathroom claiming a skunk had been in there. My husband and I went into the bathroom to discover a very strong marijuana odor coming through the fan. We actually had to leave the room and let the smell air out.
Manager Response: Dear Travelbugs7882 Thank you for taking the time to write to us. On behalf of the management we would sincerely like to apologize for the incidents you mentioned. Your concerns and suggestions will be addressed during our meetings. Thank you again and have a fantastic 2012!

Summary: Very clean and the staff was courteous. We moved to another hotel because the rooms were a little small for us.

Booked a room for my daughter & me thru Venere.com, got a double bed room. Comfy beds and pillows, clean room & bathroom, maid service daily changed towels and made beds. Towels are thin, but use 2 per bath and ask for more. All electronics in room were in working condition. Location of hotel was 13min. walking distance to Disneyland, but we got the 3day ART unlimited buspass to help out the tired feet. Bus stop is at corner of hotel, 16ft. from lobby door. Bus comes every 20mins. so afternoon naps was do-able. Bought our Disney tickets on-line thru Mousesavers.com, just present your printout to ticket gate. Many restaurants in front of hotel to choose from. Free coffee & donuts in mornings at lobby. Not a 5-star hotel but decent & respectable place and management good. Highly

My family travelled from Maui, Hawaii and stayed here Nov. 2-14, 2011 and will return again. In Hawaii we are all about family and this place is owned and operated by a family and they are doing a great job. The rooms look like they were just remodeled and had clean carpet. We stayed in a 2 room family suite with 4 queen beds that accomodates a big family of 8 like ours all in the same unit. My kids loved the pool that is open late year round and the pasteries, juice and coffee every morning were more than enough to get us going.    The walk to Disneyland was easy and we always returned to a clean room with fresh towels. Housekeeping did a great job.    I worked a the front desk of the Hotel Hana-Maui for 7 years and there will always be someone complaining. Don't let that stop

We originally booked a 2 bedroom suite with 3 queen beds which suited our needs. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a room with 4 queen sized beds! Even better! Our kids didn't have to share a bed! There was free internet which was great! Rooms were clean and beds were comfy! Walking distance to Disney, Garden Walk (for restaurants). 15 mins to Knott's Berry Farm. Just be warned LA traffic is pretty bad, so driving into LA can take a while in traffic!

Summary Heading: Bring your own ice, food, and towels--and watch your step!
Summary: Our large family of 13 stayed here five nights, from Sat., Oct. 15-Thurs., Oct. 20, 2011. We had two rooms, a kids room and a 2-room suite. Our experience here was mixed. The kids room felt crowded, with two queen beds and a bunk bed lined up with barely enough walking space between them. Also it had only three dresser drawers for all six girls. (Not three dressers. Three drawers.) The 2-room suite, though, was more spacious, with enough area in the second room (with one bed) to set up our baby's portable playpen. Each room had a dresser with three drawers each. (Six dresser drawers total here.)  Both rooms had functioning refrigerators and microwaves, though only one fridge was cold when we arrived. The bathrooms were small, but adequate.   The 2-room suite set-up had two doors

We stayed here so that we had easy access to Disneyland and a few other attractions in LA. Walking distance to Disney, Car Hires, Shops and many restaurants (including the famous Cheescake Factory and Bubba Gump just over the road).  Staff were always so very helpful with directions, information and various bits and pieces. Very large car spaces if you need to park a big car.  Pool was always clean and was heated. Our Aircon was a bit noisy, but we just opened the window at night time as it wasn't all that hot at night.  We loved our stay and would certainly stay again without hesitation, felt really safe in this area as well.

This a nice little place to stay at. The rooms are clean and there's adequate parking. But whats best is the staff...  They make this place great!! Next time I'll take pictures but the rooms are a good size, the beds are comfortable, and I'm in love with the bedding here :)

Summary Heading: Perfect family suites, very close to Disney
Summary: When travelling as a family we like to book a suite, or at least, connecting rooms, so these 2 bed suites were ideal for our family of 4. So close to Disney; you pick up the shuttle right outside and get there in 5 minutes! Lots of restaurant choice right across the road at Anaheim Garden Walk, including Bubba Gump's. Juice, coffee and donuts available in reception every morning (we didn't realise the first morning, doh!) If I ever was lucky enough to get to Anaheim again, I'd definitely come back here...

Summary Heading: Our 3rd time staying- and it continues to be excellent
Summary: We've enjoyed staying at The Islander Inn & Suites so much the first time, we've now been back another 2 times.  The reason we keep coming back is simple: The hotel is super-clean, comfortable, within walking distance of Disneyland and offers great value.    The rooms are unusually spacious and accommodated our family of 5 without difficulty. The beds are large and the fold out sofa is great bonus.  I liked that they gave us enough towels for the whole family, and never made you feel bad if you needed more.  The pool is especially nice and private. The water is crystal clear and you don't come out smelling of chlorine.  Even in October, the water temp was warm enough to swim each day.  Since our last visit it looks like their internet connection has been improved.  It is now

I did lots of onlilne research before choosing this hotel for a one night stay before a day at Disneyland. It was perfect! The location was wonderful and a short walk to the park entrance and Downtown Disney. The decor was lovely and the room quiet and comfortable. We were allowed to leave the car parked at the hotel for the entire time we were at Disneyland at no extra charge. There was a AAA rate which kept the price well under $100. When we got back to our car very late at night and were ready to drive home, my daughter found she'd left her favorite pillow in the room. We went to the office and the staff looked in the laundry room and on the laundry carts, but no luck. What a nice surprise the next morning when they called to say it had been located and would be sent to us

Summary Heading: Fantastic Stay At The Islander Inn & Suites
Summary: My family of 6 stayed at the Islander Inn & Suites on Oct 4th for 7 days. We decided to stay at this motel from all the rave reviews we read on trip advisor. The thing that impressed us the most were the fantastic comfortable beds and pillows, everything was so clean from the towels to the linen. We have stayed at a lot of motels and holiday homes and I have to say you are getting a good service here. The motel is very roomy and has enough room to stow your luggage and clothes. It was reasonable walking distance to Disneyland's main entrance ( approx 15 mins). Just across the road from great family restaurants, shopping and movie theatre. A 7 Eleven and a mini market are just up the road on the corner (prices very reasonable) . We highly recommend this motel to any family

Summary Heading: Good value for money and very convenient for disneyland
Summary: I stayed here for 10 nights with my 8 year old in september 2011. In simple terms it is a very good hotel for the price and is in an excellent location for disneyland.  We arrived after a 13 hour flight and were able to check in straight away. We were in room 222 which is upstairs in the corner. I was told we were upgraded given we were staying for such a long period of time. The room had 2 queen beds which were fine and there certainly was enough room for my son and I and our ever increasing piles of shopping!! The room was serviced every day which was great. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance, as well as a 7 eleven. We managed to walk to DL and back every day but of course we sometimes felt pretty tired. There is an ART stop right out the front. The staff

Summary Heading: Good place to stay if visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is an older hotel where the parking lot is in the center of the the facility and you can park by your room. There is not a lot of extra parking (if any) for sure, so if they are fully booked I can see why they would not be able to accommodate you leaving your car there an extra day. However, going in the end of September for 2 nights we were able to stay two nights, check in early on the Monday and leave our car there Monday, Tuesday, and part of Wednesday for free. They were very nice about it.   We had a two bedroom suite with 2 beds in one and one in the other. The bedrooms were very spacious, the bathroom was a little small but had 2 door access. 2 tvs, a mini fridge, and a microwave. The water in the shower wasn't overly warm but adequate.   Loved this location.

Wonderful stay, stayed here one night on October 5th. Loved accommodations, comfortable room with flat screen TV, mini-fridge, microwave, and two comfortable queen beds. Very clean room and awesome, friendly staff. Hotel is very well put-together and looks and feels great. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

We stayed one night on October 5, 2011 and it was a delightful experience.  We drove early into Anaheim in drenching rain. The motel clerk allowed us to check in when we arrived and he upgraded us as well to the larger room.  We found the room to be very clean, updated and well maintained.  We have stayed in Anaheim many times and I have to say that this motel is of the same qualityas the chains hotels and motels we have stayed in at that location, and yet it is independently owned and operated .  I would stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to my friends.

I find myself to be pretty particular about hotels including sound proofing and cleanliness.This hotel was VERY clean NO BUGS at all dont know what the other people are talking about!! I didnt even feel the need to get out my clorox wipes(which i always do) I would highly recommend this hotel not only was it clean and very large....they even had firm pillows :)   ( we got a two bed suite with four beds) They ALSO let us check in at TEN not 3 because they werent full unlike all these other fancy hotels nearby and let us leave our car there (no extra charge) so we could go to disney early......AMAZING AND FRIENDLY PEOPLE.Thanks SO SO much Islander this will be OUR new Disney hotel EVERY year with our daughter :)  BOOK HERE YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!!

My family and I stayed here for just one night after a long day at the Disneyland Resort.  The hotel was clean and comfortable.  If what you're looking for is a place to rest your head - then this is your place.  They also offer many room types depending on how large your group is. This hotel offers a great value for proximity, cleanliness and overall convenience for those who are attending the Disney parks.
We stayed here twice in August.  Rooms were clean and very friendly staff.  Great pool and pool area.  Would definitely stay here again

We stayed here abit over a year ago and said we would be back and we were very happy again with Islander Inn and Suites. Front desk was always friendly and helpful. Our room was always clean and we just enjoyed our stay. Again the ART being right out front was extremely helpful for this trip we did not bring a car with us. Just used Supershuttle to get here and ART to go back and forth to the park. We will be back.

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, helpful staff
Summary: We spent a week staying in this hotel/motel in early August 2011.  The hotel is located within an 15 minute walk of Disneyland and provides easy access to major highways.  We paid $90 a night for our stay and were very impressed with the clean and spacious room.  The staff answered all of our questions and even allowed us to use the office computer for internet access.  The room's frig and microwave worked well.  We were on the move constantly during the week so just used the room as a home base.  It suited our family of four's needs perfectly.

We were in Anaheim after my son graduated from MCRD Marine Corps. We needed a hotel to stay in while visiting Disneyland, when we arrived I informed the man that we needed a down stairs room to stay in the only one they had was the one with the ice machine out side near the room. I informed him that we would not mind taking that room he was worried it would make too much noise. We stayed for two nights and were treated wonderful. It is close to Disneyland which makes it easy to walk. I would recommend this to all my friends and family if you need a place to stay this has got to be the place to do so. The price of this hotel was great it made it so much nicer than having to spend a huge amount of money. I will be back to stay when we come into Anaheim again. Thank You all for
Manager Response: Dear Ilovemydad,  It was a pleasure to have you here as our guests. We wish you and your mother a wonderful and prosperous new year!

Summary: We have stayed here twice now. Their rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable. The whole staff is very nice and helpful. They serve great pastries for breakfast also. Their one bedroom suites are great for families because the bathroom has 2 doors and there are 3 queen beds. There is also a nice pool too!
Manager Response: Dear Steve Y  You guys are awesome! Please do keep coming back. Have a great 2012.

Summary Heading: Very good service, friendly and helpful
Summary: This was the second time we stayed here, having found the place from Tripadvisor three years ago. I always read the worst reviews first, and those for this hotel involve personal niggles none of which applied to our experience. The thing that impressed me though, was that the management usually answer those negative reviews with apology and concern.  In real life the motel is clean and efficient, everything worked and was present. The double family room, which consists of two rooms and four queen beds, was large and pleasant. The management are particularly helpful, letting me use their business computer both to check in our flights, and to find news about the riots in England, which had escaped us while at Disneyland. All the staff were friendly and accommodating. The motel is
Manager Response: Dear JoeLacey  We hope all is well and back to normal in England. It was a pleasure having you all as our guests. Wishing you all a wonderful new year!

Summary: We spent 7 nights at the Islander Inn in a suite room we where very happy with the room. the staff were very freindly and very helpful. we arived a lot earlier than when we could get into our room and they looked after our cases and got the room ready as soon as they could. The room was spotless and cleaned daily. The staff helped us greatly finding the cheapest and best way to get to and from different locations ie best places to shop. Fantastic location and great value for money i would stay here again
Manager Response: Dear 255364Hislops,  Thank you for your kind words. We always do our best to accommodate special request. Glad to be of service. See you all here in 2012.

Summary Heading: A good hotel for visiting Disney
Summary: Easy parking and walking distance from Disney. Good rooms and a nice pool. Don't rely on the breakfast though. You can also buy Disney tickets from the reception!
Manager Response: Dear SusannaSofia,  Thank you for taking the time to write to us.  We are pleased to hear of your overall satisfaction. The breakfast is a modest continental breakfast consisting of coffee, juice, Danish, donuts and apples. Have a fantastic 2012!

Summary: We stayed in the two bedroom suite (1 double bed 2 Twin double beds) .  It was very clean and comfortable, and suited our stay at Disneyland.  I didn't see any cockroaches or any any other insects for that matter.  The staff were very helpful and polite, not a problem at all.  I would definately stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Kazzabear,  Your complete satisfaction means a lot to us. Our staff really enjoyed having you as our guest. We would love to have you back on your next vacation. Have a great rest of the year and we hope all is well in Australia.

Summary Heading: Really nice staff and clean rooms...good value
Summary: The staff was very polite and helpful.  I had an issue purchasing my tickets to Disneyland because of my bank and the staff was very nice and patient while I corrected the situation.  The rooms are clean and maintained,  We got a 2 room (3 bed ) suite and it had plenty of room for the 5 of us. The room was equipped witha decent sized fridge and microwave.  the carpets left black on your feet from the pavement in the parking lot outside but wasn't bad.   The pool is small but very clean and we rarely had to share it with anyone for the four days we were there.  The ART bus stops right in front of the hotel which was very convient for shuttling back and forth with 3 kids to Disneyland.  It is within walking distance of restaraunts, shopping and the movie theater.  It was one of
Manager Response: Dear Takintrips,  We are constantly striving to offer better value for all our customers. The carpeting throughout the entire hotel was just replaced a few months ago and so was the parking lot tarmac. As you mentioned this may have been the result of the black left on your feet. Thank you for talking the time to write to us.

Summary: Not sure why all the problems with everyone else rating this place. It was exactly as described. We had 4 adults and 4 teenagers in a 2 bedroom suite. We had 4 queen beds and the rooms were very large. Even though we had to share one bathroom, we made it work. The staff was very nice and even let us keep our vehicle there after we checked out, so we could finish our day at Disneyland. I knew ahead of time what kind of breakfast to expect, so I found it fine. For the 2 days we stayed there, we never saw any problems with the room at all. It was a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and the $4.00 shuttle stops right in front of the hotel, although we did not use it. We chose this hotel for accommodations, price and closeness to Disneyland and were not disappointed. Thank you Islander
Manager Response: Dear Norcalfamily94534,  Fantastic! It’s wonderful to hear those words “You made our stay great”. This is what we strive for everyday of the week. Our mission is to make your stay the perfect one on every occasion. Thank you for letting us know that we are doing a great job.

Summary Heading: Perfect location with a nice scenery as soon as you get there
Summary: The rooms were very comfortable and conveniently located by disneyland and other shops and restaurants. They serve breakfast and have a nice pool to go swimming and get a tan. For the price it was more than worth the stay.
Manager Response: Dear jshadkam  Located about a block and a half away takes about 10 to 15 minutes to walk depending on your pace. It is a very manageable distance for the vast majority. Our pool is open all year round and heated for extra comfort. We are very pleased that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: This hotel is different, aside from the front desk person will welcome you, There is also a good welcome from the "COCKROACH", It really ruin our vacation, especially I reserved 2 family room, one is the realfamily room and the other one, they cheated us because its just a deluxe room that they put the bunk bed to the extra space...This Inn & Suites is the worst ever we have...Don't waste time to stay in this hotel you're gonna regret it.
Manager Response: Dear S2pify  Here is a copy of our previous response to you as our investigation reveals this being a review from a member of the same party as the previous review.  The management would like to give a complete picture with regards to the incidents leading to the above mentioned event. The original guest in concern for this reservation never checked into the hotel. The reservation was done by a third party for the residing guests. First and foremost there seems to have been a huge misunderstanding with regards to the type of room reserved. The original booking was made online for 2 kids’ rooms and 1 deluxe room where the description and pictures of the rooms are clearly posted online on our website. The guest initially tried to cancel the rooms at short notice prior to arrival. The hotel policy clearly states that a minimum of 48 hours notice be given for any cancellation or changes. The management still made an exception and allowed for one room to be cancelled without any penalty. On the day of their reservation a different group of people checked in with consent from the original party who made the booking. The guest who made the booking never checked in. The management also made an exception with regards to the two extra vehicles with no additional charges. The staff went the extra mile to accommodate the special requests made by the guests as well as giving as much leverage as possible to all their special needs and keep their rooms close to each other. This matter is still under investigation and we do give it our highest priority.

Summary Heading: WORST PLACE TO STAY!!! Do not ruin your vacation here!!! COCKROACH INFESTED!
Summary: Booked 2 family rooms a month before our stay and all was confirmed. when we arrived the first night, one of ther rooms is just a standard room with a bunk bed that was squeezed in to make it look like their "family room" omg. and not only that, it came in with a free huge cockroach just crawling at the wall! We requested another room but they were out. so they transfered us the next day to the vacant one, next to our 2nd room, and omg there is also a cockrock in the room! this time its a baby one. how cute!! we reported it again and guess what compensation we got.. they charged us fees for having extra person in our rooms. infants are counted as adults according to them, we requested a roll in bed for extra convinience but they charged us extra fees because having the extra bed
Manager Response: The management would like to give a complete picture with regards to the incidents leading to the above mentioned event. The original guest in concern for this reservation never checked into the hotel. The reservation was done by a third party for the residing guests. First and foremost there seems to have been a huge misunderstanding with regards to the type of room reserved. The original booking was made online for 2 kids’ rooms and 1 deluxe room where the description and pictures of the rooms are clearly posted online on our website. The guest initially tried to cancel the rooms at short notice prior to arrival. The hotel policy clearly states that a minimum of 48 hours notice be given for any cancellation or changes. The management still made an exception and allowed for one room to be cancelled without any penalty.  On the day of their reservation a different group of people checked in with consent from the original party who made the booking.  The guest who made the booking never checked in. The management also made an exception with regards to the two extra vehicles with no additional charges.  The staff went the extra mile to accommodate the special requests made by the guests as well as giving as much leverage as possible to all their special needs and keep their rooms close to each other. This matter is still under investigation and we do give it our highest priority.

Summary Heading: Clean but accommodations didn't work out for our family
Summary: We are a family of 5 (3 teenagers) and stayes in the Kids Room with two queen beds plus a bunkbed. We were excited to have found a room where every kid could have an actual bed to sleep on. (our daughter is usually stuck on a skinny, crappy roll-away) The room was smaller than implied with the help of a wide-angled lens. The small bathroom included the sink/hairdryer so this made it difficult for more than one person to get ready in the morning. With five people it took us two hours to get out the door that way. The lighting was absolutely awful. I felt like I was in a dungeon. Hotels have to find a way to better their lighting if they are going to use the "going green" mantra. My daughter & I tried using the mirror outside the bathroom to put on make up and we just couldn't see

We got the suite and we loved it. My mom stayed in one room and my hubby and I in the other.  Beds very comfy, clean and friendly staff. Breakfast sucks! there is no breakfast really!  In any case, great value. Very close to the parks. Walking distance there is also a shuttle that stops right in front the hotel

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel to stay near Disneyland
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Disneyland. We stayed seven nights at this hotel. The price was very reasonable. We received a two-bedroom hotel room. My wife and I stayed in one room and the kids stayed in the other room with their own beds. The hotel provided continental breakfast and had a deal for Disney tickets. There is a shuttle to this hotel from Disneyland as well if you don't want to walk to the theme park. The Garden at Anaheim (a shopping center) was directly across the street from the hotel. So there are plenty of restaurants from which to eat. You can see the fireworks from the walkway in front of the hotel room. The pool was heated in the evening. But the hotel was a great price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!  THIS IS MY DISNEY HOTEL
Summary: This place has the best customer service I have ever had.  Our dryer quit working and before I could hang up the phone, someone was knocking at the door bringing us another dryer!  The maid service was excellent!  They even folded our clothes and set them on the bed for us.  The place is clean, the beds comfortable, the staff is very friendly.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland.  The Disneyland Shuttle stops right out front.  The gentleman at the front desk is so nice and helpful.  He even let us leave our car for the day after we checked out.  Great stay for the money.

Summary Heading: A rip off. We won't be back.
Summary: I cannot wrap my head around all the glowing reviews on trip advisor which made me feel confident about booking a room here. First of all, the name of this "inn" is totally misleading. In reality, there is no island theme and there is no "inn".  It's a claustrophobic motel with a glorified name and a misleading website which promises "casual elegance". For $110 a night,  (because they charged an extra person charge of $10 for 3 people staying in the 2 queen room) I expected more than a room the size of a shoebox, a TV with a remote that didn't function properly, an extremely loud air conditioner which would go off and on throughout the night, a weird mildewy smell in the room, a coffee pot which plugged into a non working outlet, tiny parking spaces that were very difficult to
Manager Response: Dear westsidelori  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. Your concerns have been noted and are very valuable to us. The management is very sorry to hear that your experience was not as what you would have expected it to be.  We really appreciate customer feed backs as it helps us improve our service to all our guests. Please do give us another chance and we promise to make it outstanding!

Summary Heading: The best value for a Disneyland Vacation
Summary: I took my family this past weekend to Disneyland for a short vacation.  We were looking for a hotel that was within walking distance to Disneyland, but not too expensive.  I found this hotel and booked about a month ahead of time just to make sure it didn't get fully booked before our visit.  We actually arrived before check-in time but they let us unload our stuff and go in the room early since they were already done cleaning it/ getting it ready for our stay.  I was surprised how close this was to Disneyland.  It is about 100 yards from the light at Harbor and Katella, and from there about 500 yards to the entrance to the park.  Across the street from the hotel there's several reasonably priced places to eat like Subway, a pizza place, mexican food, chinese food, and a liquor
Manager Response: Dear Matt95355  We are delighted you experienced an outstanding stay! It’s always good to know that are efforts have made a difference. Our management here is very flexible and we always do our best to keep our customers happy. Being located close to Disney is a definite plus for us which adds great value to all our guests.  We thank you for taking the time to Wright to us.

Summary Heading: Good value and no charge for parking
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights in early June. Rooms were clean and quite newly decorated.  Bed linens and towels good. Although the rooms were newly renovated (about 8 weeks ago), the appliances (microwave, fridge and tv) had not been replaced and were old and not in good repair (microwave had knobs missing, tv was not flat screen and fridge was battered!). If all had been replaced, I would review higher. Breakfast (served in reception but eaten in your room) was pastries, doughnuts, apples, juice and coffee.  This as poor and we were sick of the same old thing after 4 nights! One major plus however, was no charge for parking the car (some hotels in the area were charging $14 per night to park in their car park.  What a rip off!!         Although we had a query with our bill (wrong room
Manager Response: Dear Ellesmereporters  Unlike most hotels in the area we do offer free parking as well as free WIFI for all our guests. We really value you feed back. This helps us constantly update and improve our facilities to give our customers the best possible value. We thank you again for choosing Islander for your stay and hope to see you here soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for our large family group
Summary: We stayed at the Islander the week before Memorial Day to go to Disneyland.  With 12 in our group we booked 2 rooms with 3 queens in each room.  The rooms were clean and comfortable and the one bed in a separate room worked great to help put the younger children to bed before everyone else.  The bathroom (sink, toilet and tub/shower) are all in one room with access from each room.  It was small but it worked fine for us.  We stayed 5 nights and had great housekeeping services each day.  The front desk was always helpful with advice, maps, directions and even shipping something we forgot!  The walk to Disneyland is a bit far--at least 15 min. but there is a shuttle.  A couple of times we dropped people off but mostly we walked.  The breakfast selection is limited but we always
Manager Response: Dear Homestakerocks  The suites are very popular with larger groups like yours. We also offer a slightly larger suit that has 4 queen beds with slightly more space for groups consisting of up to eight individuals. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We really enjoyed having you guys as our guests. You were all wonderful!

Summary: Comfortable, clean and spacious rooms.  Very friendly and accommodating management. Free parking was great and was within walking distance to Disneyland.  Continental breakfast very limited but overall great value.
Manager Response: Dear Sherry73  We are please to here that you had a pleasant experience here at the islander. Providing great value is one of our main goals. We hope to see you here soon on your next vacation. Have a great rest of the year!

Summary Heading: Friendly staff and great value for the price.
Summary: My friend and I were looking for a reasonably priced, clean, comfortable, no-frills place to stay within walking distance of the Disneyland complex, and this hotel was just great for that.  The man at the front desk was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay -- from check-in to the purchase of Disneyland tickets to check-out. He even gave us a bogo coupon for a local eatery.  The 2-bed room wasn't very big, but it was fine for the two of us. The closet space was a little tight because of the micro-fridge taking up that area. Also, the bathroom was pretty small (very little counter space), but again, this was fine for two guys with minimal toiletries. Everything seemed clean and well taken care of.  Because the door (outside corridors, by the way) didn't have a tight seal
Manager Response: Dear RidesCoaster,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay. Since your last visit we did quite a few renovations and upgrades to the property. Incidentally brand new doors were installed on all rooms hence addressing the issue you had with the seal. Furthermore minor cosmetic upgrades were performed throughout the premises. Carpeting was replaced throughout the hotel as well. We are thrilled that you loved our service as our goal is to provide an exceptional level of service to all our customers all the time. Your feedback has been invaluable!

Summary: Clean rooms , reasonable prices, and best of all efficient friendly staff. When we asked for extra things they were brought to us within 2 minutes. We could not have asked for better service.Within walking distance to Disneyland.If you don't want to walk a shuttle stops right at the door of this inn.  Microwave,coffee pot and fridge in room. All said it was a great experience at reasonable rates.
Manager Response: Dear sweetooth_4  Wonderful to hear that you all had a great stay! We really enjoyed having you all as our guest. Thanks for letting us know that we are doing an excellent job. All our staff here at the Islander would love to see here on your next vacation when you visit Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Separate suite rooms were just what we wanted
Summary: My colleague and I stayed at the Islander for a convention center conference. We had separate rooms which had a connecting door, but which also had a private entrance to the bathroom. Just what we wanted. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, with two TV's, a refrigerator and microwave.  25 cents is needed for the ice machine! Have not encountered that before. Parking was easy and we loved the white shutters and flowering vines around the hotel. Pool looked inviting. Breakfast was just sweets, apples and coffee. Had to heat my water up in the micro for tea. Our only concern was the distance from the convention center and I ended driving my colleague from the convention center, as she has back problems and trouble walking. Overall it was a great stay, and the price was
Manager Response: Dear Marlicar  The suites are very popular here at the Islander. They are very reasonably priced and convenient for groups that require a certain level of privacy. Renovations and upgrades are constantly being performed here at the Islander to keep up with the growing customer needs. The complimentary continental breakfast consists of Danish, Donuts, Fresh Apples, Orange Juice and freshly brewed Coffee every morning. It is surprising that you had to pay 25 cents for Ice as the Ice machine on our premises dispenses free Ice.  Thank you for taking the time to write to us. We really appreciate your comments.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights in April to visit Disneyland. floor plan was good with 2 BDrm suite, with 3 queen beds.  Rm was clean and beds comfortable. Microwave and refrig good size. Grounds were clean and the pool was nice size and warm.  Price was excellent for location to Disneyland.  Breakfast was a bit small and having to buy ice at 25 Cents was annoying.  Otherwise, Great stay, Great Bargin. We would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Rcor1999  We are thrilled that you had an exceptional experience. It’s wonderful to hear that we are doing a great job! Our staffs constantly strive to make things better for all our guests every single day. Our refrigerators are of decent capacity and easily accommodate big soda bottles and 1 gallon milk cartons. We have found this to be very useful for large families staying in for longer periods. The Ice machine on our premises dispenses free ice to all. We are surprised that you had to pay a quarter for ice. We will certainly look into this matter. Thank you very much for taking the time to review your stay. This helps us as well as potential patrons to make an informed decision about our premises.

Summary: Our stay was wonderful!  The facility was so accommodating for my family of 11!  The facility was clean and well-kept.  The location was perfect for us to walk to Disneyland.  And, of course, the staff was friendly and available at all times if we needed anything.    We would definitely stay again and would also recommend the Islander Inn & Suites to our family and friends.  Thank you! The Wall Family
Manager Response: Dear Wall Family  You guys were great! Please do come stay with us on your next vacation. We promoise to make it an even better experience. Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your stay. Have a wonderful rest of the year.

Summary: Originally had a booking for 5 nights but checked out after 1 night. This place is extremely noisy, the walls are paper thin and it is on a busy road. It appeared that the rooms were not that clean. Sheets and towels are long overdue for replacement. The breakfast is not even worth mentioning. Far better choices are available.
Manager Response: Dear Dazzchris  Thank you for taking the time in giving us a feed back about your stay. On behalf of our management, I would like to sincerely apologize for your experience. We take all feedback very seriously and our reviewing your experience and the events that followed. Our goal is to identify and resolve all feed back to the best of our abilities. Thank you again and have a great day!

Summary Heading: Great Service, Comfort and Rooms for the Price
Summary: I picked this property because of its proximity to Disneyland and cost per nights stay. I was a little leary until I opened the door to the room, my wife was impressed by the cleanliness (she didn't have to take out her Clorox Wipes) and the comfort of the bed. Room was good size and had a decent sized refrigerator (hold gallon size milk) and microwave. Staff at the desk were very nice and helpful. We will be staying at this pro[perty again.
Manager Response: Dear Bosleys  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We very much enjoyed having you as our guest. Our hotel did undergo an extensive remodeling and we also put in brand new carpeting in all our rooms just a month ago. Mattresses were replaced recently as well. Our staff is well trained to give you the customer the best possible experience all the time. We hope to see you here soon!

Summary: Perfect spot for visiting WestPack Convention 2011 and It is walking distance to the Convention with two breakfast options on the way.  At $70 a night with free parking you do not half to hassle with the car.  This place was base camp during the whole show and worked out great.  WiFi and basic cable
Manager Response: Dear Jerrydriscoll  Located less than a block away it only takes about 5 Minutes to get to the convention Center by foot. As you mentioned the free Wifi really helps our guests aswell as the free parking which allows you to make this your base camp. Thank you for mentioning these key points as it helps others decide if Islander is the perfect spot during a convention.

Summary Heading: very friendly envoirenment,with great staff in a good location
Summary: Walking distance of Disneyland ,plus many resturants in close proximity. Great for family vacation. Two bedroom suite good for 4-6 people.
Manager Response: Dear Leroy8123  Thank you for taking the time to let us know that we are doing a wonderful job. We really loved having you guys here as our guests. We have a loyal following from New Zealand and Australia who make it here every year when they visit Disney.

Summary Heading: Really good option for Disney Anaheim
Summary: This hotel is very good, close to Anaheim Disneyland, walking distance, rooms clean and very friendly and supportive staff, it is not a Resort Hotel, but close to everything and if you only need to sleep and be close Disneyland this is a really good option. I travel with kids and teens
Manager Response: Dear MXvoyager1  Our goal is to provide the best value and service possible for all our customers. We are glad that you recognize and value our establishment for what it is. We would love to have you back again on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Fantastic experience for first time travellers
Summary: My brother and I stayed here for 3 day during November for our visit to Disney. It was my Brothers first overseas experience and staying here made us both feel very comfortable in a new country. Easy access to shops, food and transport. Disney is less then 1Km away we were able to walk to the gates with ease. Staff were very friendly and informative. rooms were very spacious and well maintained.
Manager Response: Dear Kendokatraveller91  We are very fortunate to be located close to Disneyland, Gardenwalk and the Anaheim Convention center which are all whithin 5 to 10 minutes by foot. We are glad that you and your brother had a memorable and fantastic experience. We hope to see you here on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Excellent value and service - we strongly recommend this hotel
Summary: The location was perfect! You can walk to Disneyland or take the convenient shutlle from right outside this hotel. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. I stayed with two kids and we all had a wonderful stay. Beds were very comfortable, and having a microwave and a good size fridge was very convenient.   If you are looking for a fancy hotel, this is obviously not the place. But if you're looking for a convenient and comfortable place very close to Disneyland, with great value and excellent service for a family, then I strongly recommend this hotel.   Having their free Internet access was a huge plus for me. My kids thoroughly enjoyed the stay there as well.  I plan to recommend this hotel to everyone who asks me for a great place close to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Dear Gotarheels_2011  You are very kind. We are very happy to hear about your experience. We are extremely glad when our customers have had a great experience. Have a great 2011!

Summary Heading: Very Good Hotel. Just need to replace filthy carpets
Summary: This hotel is so close to Disney and the room we had was a giant 4 bed two room suite and cheap. Walk to disney 15 minutes.  The only thing I didn't like was the carpets filthy and there was no plug for the bath, so we improvised..... You can see the Disney fireworks from the balcony..... Free Wifi...
Manager Response: Dear travel00001  Thank you for taking the time to let us know as to how we are doing. We are sorry that your stay did not meet your level of expectations. All reveiws are taken quite seriously. We hope to replace all carpets at the hotel by the end of march. Please give us another try so we can make it up to you.

Summary Heading: Great room for a great price and location
Summary: The islander is in a fantastic spot to get to disneyland and california adventure park, with only about a 10min walk. Its also close to the anaheim garden walk which is full of shops and resturants. It was great because we also travelled to Knotts Berry Farm, and it was only a trip away. The question is what makes this better than the other hotels in anaheim? It was very clean and the rooms are quite big. The beds were quite comfy, however the only thing we didnt like was that we were quite cold at night as the heater wasnt the best. For the price we paid it was worthwhile, and they sold disney tickets at competitive prices. All up it was a great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Kateshev  We try our best to offer the best possible service for the price. Its great when we have been acknowledged for our efforts. Your concerns also have been noted and steps have been taken. We would love to see you here back again on your vacation. Thank you very much for your time.

Summary Heading: Exellent value for money with lovely staff
Summary: First time to the Islander and we will use it again if in the area.Very clean and large rooms with very helpful and pleasant staff.Ideal position for disneyland.An all round exellent hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Martinbull,  We are glad you had a wonderful stay here at the islander. We really enjoyed having you here as our guests. We hope that all is well in the united kingdom and hope to see you here soon on your next vacation.

Summary: Our stay at the Islander Inn and Suites was disappointing.  We were in Anaheim for a very large family trip to Disneyland.  In all, we stayed in two, two room-four bed suites and one room with two beds.  The price was great, but I now know why.  First I will list the stuff that I was happy with......The staff was friendly and the beds were comfortable.  There was a good-sized fridge, so we were able to save money by buying some food from the grocery store.  Having the shuttle pick up right in front of the hotel was nice and I enjoyed the free Wi-Fi and parking.  Now, the stuff that I was unhappy with.....The hotel room carpet was disgusting (this was the case for all three rooms).  My children’s knees (from playing on the carpet) and feet were black.  I had to restrict them from
Manager Response: Dear TheWfamily4  We here at the islander are very serious about all our customer reviews and infact have noted your particular concerns. We hope to have new carpeting installed throughout the entire hotel by the end of March. A few additions have also been made to the continental breakfast that is offered to all guests free of charge. We really hope you reconsider giving us another try so we can make it upto you. Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Clean, cheap and really close to Disneyland
Summary: If you are looking for a cheap, family-friendly hotel, I would totally recommend Islander Inn & Suites.  The rooms are quite simple, but they are large, quiet, tidy and comfortable.  The hotel parking is free and we saved US$15 a day (plus the hassle of parking at Disneyland) by simply walking to the park each day (about 10 - 12 mins walk away).  There are plenty of shops and restaurants within 5 mins walk The wireless internet access is fast, and FREE.  Other hotels we stayed at charged us   $15 a day for internet. The pool is a good size & depth and impeccably clean. It wasn't heated, but still was still swimmable in Mid Oct. The staff were really helpful and friendly.   We've stay there twice now and will be booking there again next time. Don't expect the Ritz, but for less
Manager Response: Dear PhilMcintosh  Thank you for taking the time to give us a detailed review and description of your stay. It is very much appreciated. This helps the vast majority of hotel shoppers who are looking into making a reservation as well us the team at islander to improve on its services. We look forward to seeing you here very soon.

Summary: I & my daughter along with a couple of our relatives had stayed in this hotel for 5 days. We had travelled from India & this was our first trip to LA. I found the hotel very conveniently located for visiting Disneyland. One could make a quick trip back to the hotel in case one wanted to relax & get back again to the parks without loosing too much of time. The staff is very helpful & courteous & are willing to accommodate additional requests. The rooms are large & very comfortable will all the necessary amenities. I would surely stay in the hotel again if I visit the area.
Manager Response: Dear Sumitabh  We are glad you had a great experience at the Islander and would love to have you back as our guests. It is very kind of you to review your stay even though you are half way around the world from us. You have made a difference to many by sharing your experience. Thank you very much!

Summary: I have stayed at the Disneyland owned Hotels and quite a few of the surrounding hotels.  I have to say that for the price, the Islander is a great value.  We were planning on spending most of the days at Disneyland and just wanted a room to sleep in.  When you say that you really mean that you want a CLEAN room with CLEAN bedding to sleep in.  This was it, clean room, clean floors, very clean bedding, comfy bed, clean bathroom.  No frills, but that isn't what we wanted for this trip as we planned to be at Disneyland til they closed.  Good parking.  It was a bit of a ways to walk with kids, and I didn't want to wait/pay for the shuttle that comes right in front, so I drove the family to the 15 minute parking lot right at the gate, then drove back and walked myself.  You can also
Manager Response: Dear StephenMP,  We here at the Islander work as a team to bring the very best of value to all our customers. It is always good to here guests tell us when we need improvement but also wonderful to here good things when we have done a great job. It boosts a moral and keeps us going. Thank you!

Summary: I can't understand why people would pay hundreds of dollars to stay in a big name hotel when you've got places like this. The room was large with sofa, fridge, coffee and microwave. The bathroom was a good size with a nice shower. The pool was small but very welcoming. If your on a long road trip like us, save your washing until you get here, 2 weeks worth washed and dried for $2. One thing a lot of people moan about was the complimentary breakfast, for those who don't know complimentary means free, you don't pay for it so how can you moan. It was danish, apples, coffee and orange juice, we found it very useful. I see one person moaned no decaf, get a life is that a reason to moan about a hotel. It is only a 10 min walk to disney so you need to be very lazy to get the bus, and a
Manager Response: Dear Scrappy8  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We do our very best to cater to a broad group of people. Some are happier than others with their experience. We really value your opinion and comments as this helps in the decesion making process of future guests. Please comeback soon!

Summary: The staff was freindly, the hotel is clean, but needs to be updated.  The room that we were in had 2 queen beds, would have preferred a King bed.    I had booked this hotel for one night but we changed our minds and needed an extra night which we got.  The staff was GREAT.  Didn't use the pool, but looked clean.  Did not eat breakfast, to small,  walked 1/2 block to an I-HOP.   Didn't go to Disney, but if I was going to Disney this would be ok, it is a long walk to entrance, but you can take the shuttle or bus.
Manager Response: Dear Bflynn013  Thank you for your comments and views. We take customer suggestions quite seriously and will do our very best to make changes for the betterment of the hotel and satisfy the customers needs. We would love to see you here on your next vacation.

Summary: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay while visiting Disneyland and this turned out to be a gem. The rooms looked like everything in the one we had was new. The front counter staff was super friendly. We also took advantage that the ART was right in front of the Inn so we did not have to drive and park. Another feature I liked is there was no hidden "bogus" resort charge. I actually changed from another hotel to the Islander due to this. We will be staying here again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear DwarfPlanet,  We thrilled that you had a great experience. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We definitely look forward to seeing you here again and providing with you with the very best of service and value that you have come to expect from us.

Summary Heading: Islander Inn A Great Place To Stay
Summary: We Recently Stayed At The Islander Inn A Family Vacation To Disneyland. The Hotel Was Very Clean And The Hotel Staff Were Very Accomidating. The Hotel Was Only A 15 Minute Walk To The Park But We Purchased A 5 Day Transit Pass Which Picked Us Up Right Outside The Hotel. The Breakfast Was Small But Very Good. We Will Stay Here Again On Our Next Trip. We Stayed In A 1 Bedroom Suite And Had Plenty Of Room For The 5 Of Us.
Manager Response: Dear Albert99,  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and found everything to your satisfactory. The shuttle is a great way to travel especially after an exhilarating and exhausting day at the park. Thank you again for sharing your experience. We shall see you back on your next vacation!

Summary: We had never stayed in this hotel before and as most people, I did not fully know what to expect when deciding to commit to booking our stay with them. I did however read the reviews beforehand and was somewhat reassured that we would likely have a good experience. Well I can tell you firsthand now from experience….WE LOVED OUR STAY AND WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN. The following are some of the attributes that made our stay memorable. Close walking distance to Disneyland, free wi fi connection, free continental breakfast, nice pool to cool off in after a long day, clean rooms and great maid service, small and cozy atmosphere not like the mega large hotel environments, safe and free parking in front of your room, and most of all they had GREAT rates for the value of what you received
Manager Response: Dear Johnsonpst,  Thank you for taking the time to talk about us. This helps us make changes and improvements as well as helps potential guests make an informed decesion. Thank you again. We hope to see you here soon.

Summary: What a great place to stay.  Stayed here for 4 nights while at Disney.  We had booked the 2 queen/1 sofabed room. The sofabed was okay, but only used the first night anyway. Staff at front desk was amazing!  Let us check in early with no problems. We needed a lightbulb and extra pillows and they were brought immediately.  Housekeeping is always cleaning the grounds area. They take a lot pride in their work. Pool was amazing! Big and the perfect temp! Shuttle to Disney goes right in front, very convenienct.  If you choose to walk, it took us 13 minutes.  Sometimes we beat the shuttle!  Continental breakfast is pretty lame....danish, apple and orange juice, but it was enough to get by. They don't have a business center with computer, but if you ask them to use the computer, they
Manager Response: Dear Earnhardt8carfan  Thank you very much for taking the time to write to us. The front desk staff our thrilled to hear your comments. Here at the islander we always strive to give you the customer the very best of service at all times. We are extremely glad that we made an impression and made your stay perfect!

Summary: We spent 2 nights here during peak season at Disneyland. Very spacious room (5 in family) ,walkable to maingate, super clean pool.
Manager Response: Dear jmo100  We wre pleased that you enyoyed are lovely pool. Most people choose our location for its proximity to the maingate. We are glad that you received great value! Be sure to visit us again on your next trip.

Summary: First time to the States and this hotel was great. Staff could'nt do enough for us as we were a party of 7. Stayed in the 2 bedroom unit and it was big enough for all of us. We had heaps of luggage due to shopping as well. Hotel owners were prepared to park there car elsewere so we could park in the hotel .Staff even let me use there computer to catch up on news in Australia. We are going back in November 2011 and are not staying here cause we want to try other hotels, but if you've got a big family i would clearly recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Wrightoz  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We are always happy to go the extra mile for our customers. That has always been our philosophy here at the islander. We have many guests who travel here from Australia and you guys were a really great group!

Summary Heading: Clean Room, Great Location, Amenities & Value. A+ In My Book!
Summary: My wife, kids, and I decided to spend the night near Disneyland having a little fun and looking around at some of the new sights. We didn't want to spend a lot, but still wanted a nice room and something that was easy and convenient for the kids since it was just one night. The Islander Inn and Suites provided that for us as we got a nice clean room with all the amenities that we needed and more. Plus, we had enough left over to really enjoy the new places that are right across the street at the Garden Walk and the kids had a blast at Bubba Gump Shrimp. Later in the night while returning to the room, the Disneyland fireworks started and the kids were looking almost right up at them as they are right across the street as well. All in all, the kids were happy, I was happy and we
Manager Response: Dear Salsurra  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are extremely delighted that you had a great time. We hope to give great service the next time around aswell.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Islander Inn and Suites
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Islander Inn and Suites.  The front desk staff were very courteous. The room was extremely clean, spacious and had nice decor. My family and I enjoyed swimming in the pool and afterwards walked across the street for a stroll on the Anaheim Garden Walk, where we then enjoyed a lovely meal at the Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant. We will definitely stay at the Islander Inn and Suites again. We had a great time.
Manager Response: Dear Msurra  We always do our very best to give the best possible service to all. We are glad that we made a difference during your vacation and very much enjoyed having you here. Thank you for choosing to saty with us again and we home to make it an even better experience.

Summary Heading: Roaches and dirty...... do yourself a favor and look elsewhere
Summary: I booked this hotel last minute because I wanted to be near the park. It is a 10 minute walk - it does not seem like a long walk but when you are done with disneyland and with kids, you wish you would not have to walk back to the hotel.  Anyway, here is my review:  PROS - Close to park - spacious room (i got a 2 quen br + couch) - close to shopping stores/restaurants at the garden walk - Room with microwave and small fridge - tiny pool on site - Maid service people were nice - Wifi included  CONS - super dirty carpet: feet get black at the touch - had to go through a lot of socks to avoid dirt on kids feet (make sure to bring and wear sandals) - Couch was dirty and with spots (of what?, i dunno). I had sheets on it at all times. - Sheets had also spots but I assumed they were
Manager Response: Dear Omarrodz  We here at the islander are very sorry to hear about your experience here. Your feed back is valuable to us. We do take customer complaints very seriously and our looking into this matter in detail.

Summary: Our family stayed there for just a little less than 2 weeks...and we were very impressed! We payed less than $100 a night and tons of room for the entire family to spread out. It's in a great location....we got to walk to DIsneyland, and the bus came right to our hotel every morning for our furthur out journeys like Universal Studios and Legoland. The pool was awesome. Our only complaint was the continental breakfast-it was pretty much just danishes, and we got very sick of eating them, they weren't that good. But besides that we enjoyed our stay and would go back.
Manager Response: Dear Caribby96  Our team is delighted to here about your positive experience. We too really enjoyed having you as our guests. We plan to try out some different combinations for breakfast and really value your time for writing to let us know. Thank you again. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We had spent hours online reading reviews of hotels before we chose one.  I was glad I did, and glad we chose this hotel to stay at. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff were an absolute pleasure to deal with.  They were helpful and informative and very nice.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area and will definately stay again!
Manager Response: Dear sunnycoastaussies  We have a huge Aussie fan club. Thanks for being a part of that wonderful loyal customers. Our goal is to always provide you with the very best of service. See you here on your next trip.

Summary: Happy to recommend. Good housekeeping.  Staff eager to please and offer help
Manager Response: Dear Jandtw  Thank you for your kind words. We are glad that you are happy with your experience during your vacation here and that we were able to make it a wonderful experience. Please to come stay with us again.

Summary: The suites were dirty! My family and ended up leaving! We had rowdy neighbors!!! The walls and ceilings are WAY too thin! Bad customer service called night front desk at 1 in the morning to see if he could ask neighbors to calm down an hour later music got louder and we called front desk again and he was just plain rude! My family could not take anymore and we left hotel! AWFUL!!!! Do yourself a favor and spend a couple of bucks more and get a better place... you'll thank me for it in a restful and peaceful night sleep!  I would rather sleep in my car then spend another night in that lame hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Caldude02  We are extremely sorry about you unsatifactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again.

Summary: We stayed here a couple nights with the family traveling to Disneyland. It is a nice short walk to the park. The location is great. I loved that you didn't have to pay to park. The rooms are nicely remodeled. And the prices are great! The bathroom was sadly not the best. Very tiny and shared between a two room suite with seven people was tricky. That was pretty much the only bad thing. There is a mini fridge and I think a microwave too. It's just a short walk to Cheescake Factory and some other nice restaurants. The pool area was not bad either. The kids took advantage of that. Oh and don't expect a very big breakfast! The staff is very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear hotscrabblequeen  We try our best to offer all our guests with great value. The maintenence crews work very hard to give you the customer a clean and safe environment. We really appreciate your feed back. Thank you again for choosing us.

Summary: We booked a family room but were upgraded for free to a 2 room suite when the family rooms were sold out, which was great! The front desk man was great. He gave us great information on where to eat and shop. The setting was like a small apt complex. It was good for the kids. Breakfast only consisted of apples, OJ and danishes, but were already told that by staff. We left our car parked there even after we had checked out and spent our day at Disneyland. The walk to Disneyland was not bad, even with two five year olds, but the walk back was torturous after spending over 11 hours at Disneyland. Overall it was a very pleasant stay!
Manager Response: Dear Mater2006  Thank you for taking the time to review us. We really value your feedback. It helps us look at the things we excel in and the areas that need improvement. Hope to see you here soon.

Summary Heading: Great Quality for the Price--5 Days & No Complaints
Summary: I stayed at The Islander for 5 days this March (2010), while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. It was my first visit to the Inn (after a lot of research) and I found it to what most online reviewers’ said: a wonderful value, clean, and staffed by friendly help.  Specifically, I thought the beds were quite comfortable, the desk chair was good quailty, and I liked that the windows opened.   I especially appreciated the free parking and complimentary daily Internet.  I’ve stayed at many hotels in that area over the past 14 years, and they tend to nickel-and-dime for any extras.  Not here.  The pool is VERY small, but I didn't mind b/c my requirements are only that a pool is clean and in the sun.  I enjoyed my stay and have already rebooked for next year’s
Manager Response: Dear Highroads_and_Byways  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We try our best to maintain the level of service appreciated by guests like you and are very thankful for your insights and suggestions. Once again thank you for your loyalty and we hope to make your stay an even better one next year!

Summary Heading: Just great as I expected family motel style accommodation
Summary: Located perfectly for Disneyland a short walk to the main gates. I travelled with my wife and two girls (10 & 15 yrs) and my mother in law. We chose a two bedroom unit and it was spacious and clean. Simple and a little dated but perfect for a short stay to visit the theme parks. Shops and eateries are a stones throw away. I would stay here again and would reccommend to friends wanting an inexpensive ,clean, friendly place to stay for families. The staff were helpful which added to a more than satisfactory place to stay. A simple breakfast is complimentary which is a nice touch, a pastry a coffee and a juice can be taken from reception to your room which is a nice start to a day at the theme parks, certainly not a substantial or gourmet breakfast but we thought it was a nice
Manager Response: Dear TravelKiwis  Thank you for choosing us for your stay during your vacation. We are delighted to hear that you had a very pleasant stay and that you were very happy with the level of service you received. Your feed back is very valuable to us and helps us maintain and improve on our service and quality. We would be very pleased to have you here again on your next vacation.

Summary: When we arrived, the owner offered to take us to the nearby grocery store so we could stock up.  Then when we needed transportation, they arranged everything.  The rooms were larger than expected.  They were clean and well maintained.  The continental breakfast was not great but for the price we were super happy.  Only a stones throw to Disneyland and the convention center.  We will definately book again and again.  Thanks for a great experience.
Manager Response: Dear Mnncd  Thank you for choosing to stay with us. It was a real pleasure having you as our guest. I'm glad that the customer service you received was to your expectations. We hope to see you again soon on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Affordable motel style accommodation 10-minute walk to Disneyland
Summary: This motel style accommodation was great value for money considering its close location to Disneyland, which is only a 10-minute walk to the main gate. We booked a room that had 2 bedrooms with a total of 3 queen beds, which was great for our family of four. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable and in a quiet location. Parking is free and so is breakfast, however I wouldn’t get too excited about the breakfast because it is only a pastry, apple, coffee and orange juice. There is an ihop just around the corner but we just drove down the road to the supermarket and purchased fresh fruit, yogurt and cereal that we were able to store in the good size fridge provided. For other meals there are many options in the new shopping complex located just across the road. All of the
Manager Response: Dear journeydesigner  It was a pleasure having you here as our guest during your vacation. We have many guests like you who arrive from Australia every week. They all appreciate the pricing and the proximity to Disneyland. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know.

Summary Heading: NEVER stayed there and they charged me $91!!!
Summary: I have never stayed at this hotel nor made ANY type of reservation there, however a charge of $91 was applied to my credit card. When I spoke with the owner he told me he would not issue a credit and that "It sucks to be you! Call the Police!" They had my contact information as well. I will be pursuing this, but be careful. Someone there may be running a scam!!!

Summary Heading: Excellent Location, comfortable rooms and friendly, helpfull staff.
Summary: I stayed in the Anaheim Islander Hotel in December with my wife and two kids. We stayed in a two bedroom suite which, although not particularly luxurious, was clean, comfortable and perfect for our needs. The hotel is a stone's throw from Disney and there are lots of restaurants literally across the road. The staff were friendly, courteous and extremely helpfull. I have no reservations about recommending this property to others and would not hesitate to stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Earlofsuave, Thank you for choosing to stay with us and thank you for taking the time to complete this survey. It gives us the opportunity to keep up the great work and work on any concerns and improve the standard of our establishment. Have a wonderful new year and hope to see you all soon.

Summary: I choose this hotel based on the reviews I read here. Not upscale at all, but clean updated rooms. We reserved the two room suite with one bathroom for my husband, myself and two teenagers. Each teen had a comfortable queen bed. The bathroom was small with no separate vanity area outside, so the morning rush to get ready was tight. The friendliness of the staff can't be overstated. The blow dryer didn't work the first morning and they  had a replacement up in five minutes. The guy at he front desk was very helpful with directions. We walked each day to Disney and saved the parking fee and hassle. I've paid more for worse rooms and grumpy service. I'd stay there again next time we go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear leecypoo, Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We really do appreciate all your comments and feedback. We do sincerely apologies for the minor inconveniences but are glad to hear that our front desk officers took exceptional care regarding your incident. Hope to see you all soon, on your next vacation to Disneyland.

Summary: My adult daughter, a family friend and her 10 year old son and I stayed at the Islander Inn for five nights at the end of September.  We had a two room suite and it worked very well, the only complaint about the room would be that the bathroom was fairly small and the set up with the two rooms each having an access door made it seem smaller.  The people at counter (the owners, I believe) are very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay there again
Manager Response: Dear Langleytraveler, Thank you for staying with us on your vacation. We try our very best to accommodate all our customers needs and requests and be of help at the same time. We are very happy to hear that you would be staying with us again on your next trip. We promise to do our very best to make your stay an even better experience.

Summary: I choose this hotel 'cos of the good value and walking distance to Disneyland.  The room was enough for 2 Adults & 3 teenages, 2 Double Bed & 1 Sofa Bed.  Our bathroom is quite small. We didn't have breakfast have breakfast, so idea abt it. The hotel is right opposite of the Shopping District, Garden Walk. Plus alot of Restaurant & shops nearby. My Sis, Bro & I went to Disneyland so we are having an excellent time overall.  Compare to my parents, who spend most of the time in the hotel find it miserable as the room is quite dark.  I would likely go back there again 'cos of the price and if my accompany doesn't spend most of the time in the hotel.
