Manager Response: Dear Claudia_KM, Thank you for selecting that Islander to stay during your vacation. We are well reputed for offering excellent value for all our guests. We are very pleased that you acknowledge this fact. We do apologies for any inconvenience that may have arisen during your stay at the Islander. We promise to make your next visit an even better one.

Summary: We based ourselves here for 5 nights in May 2009. Excellent location if you are visiting Disneyland. (about 15 minute walk). If you have children consider catching the bus. Directly across the road from large shopping complex. Rooms were very good. Clean, decent size and there was very little noise. Continental breakfast consisted on juice and pastries (2 selections) served at check in area. Excellent value for money. I would recommend this to all travellers who are wanting to visit Disney.

The Islander Inn was the perfect choice for our family trip to Disneyland.  We selected this property because of positive customer reviews, reasonable rates, and proximity to Disneyland.  We were not disappointed: our suite was large enough to accomodate 3 adults and 2 teens with the 2 queens and sofa sleeper, it was very clean and well-maintained, the cost was incredibly affordable, and it actually is within a 15-minute walk of the front gate.  The property was quiet, safe, and although we had no time to swim, the pool appeared clean and inviting.  The staff could not have been more helpful: they were great!  Book this property with confidence!

Pay the extra $20-$50/night and stay somewhere else. Place not very clean and the owner is cheap. the breakfast is a joke(no tea, no milk, no decaf coffee, only danishes!!) One of the worst hotels I ever stayed at!!!

Summary Heading: Great, inexpensive place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: The Islander is a smaller, older property that is clean, well maintained and been updated recently.  It is a couple of LONG blocks from the entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure so we chose to drive and park at Disneyland.  You can also catch the trolley right our front to get to the theme parks.  Nice pool and pastires, fruit, juice, and coffee provided each morning.  Inexpensive property that worked great for our family.

This is a tremendous place to stay, especially if you need two rooms. We had a large party and so got a two room suite basically for the price of one room. The people working at the desk were always friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and this hotel was generally well maintained. They are a very short walk from Disneyland which made it possible for us to come and go from the park easily. Parking was free. A couple of things to note. Firstly, the breakfast is kind of sparse. Secondly, the cleaning staff turned off the AC during the day so when we came back to the room it was hot and took a while to cool down. Overall, you won't find better value for money in a great location and a good clean hotel.

Summary Heading: Islander--A Great Value and Very Close to Disney!!!
Summary: My wife and I had previously stayed at the Islander on a whim two years prior to this trip and happily returned for two nights this time.  We were not disappointed. Because we were flying in from the East Coast that day and would be a little tired we requested a quiet room towards the back of the complex on the second floor and the inn indeed granted us a nice corner room on the second floor.  It was perfect for us.  Parking was a snap as we were able to park our car undercover and just down a flight of stairs from our room.  That made our luggage movement really easy.  Being just two blocks walk to Disneyland, we knew we would not be using our car for the next few days.  The room was clean and comfortable with a nice LCD television.  We felt right at home once again. The

I have stayed in numerous hotels and for the price range of this hotel, it has the most comfortable beds.  It was clean, quiet and close enough to walk to Disneyland.  The owner offered us to leave our car parked their after check out so we didn't have to pay parking at the park.  Staff was super friendly and supplied us with extra pillows, blankets and towels with a smile!

We spent 4 nights in a two bedroom suite - basically, interconnecting rooms with a shared bathroom, two queen beds in each room.  Very clean, very spacious, very comfy beds. The manager is fantastic, he just can't do enough to help!  The rates are unbelievably cheap.  Location is great. Anaheim Garden Walk is right across the road, Disneyland is only a 15 minute walk. There is also a shuttle that goes to Disneyland - we took advantage of this as we were travelling with my Mum who is in her 70's. There is also a very handy 7-11 on the corner, only a couple of minutes walk away.  There is also a pool which looked nice, but we had no time to use it as we had only a brief and busy stay.  My only complaints are very minor - being an English girl (living in Australia) I'm quite fond

This was our first trip to Disneyland, I did all my own bookings and had trouble finding a hotel that would accomodate 2 adults 3 children and 2 babies they all wanted us to book 2 rooms accept the anaheim islander.Our room was huge 2 queen beds and bunk beds, there was a fridge, microwave & safe and fee internet & parking no other hotels offered all of that at no charge. The room was recently renovated and very clean, the staff was great with directions and cleaned the room spotless daily. Our strollers did not arrive on time so they lent us 2 for two days at no charge.The breakfast was juice/coffee and danishes but we purchased groceries and made our own breakfasts. This hotel was very close to Disney ( 10 minute walk max) and right across the street from the garden walk mall/

Summary Heading: Walking Distance to Disneyland - Nice Hotel and a Good Value
Summary: Our family of 8 stayed had a four day stay at the Islander Inn & Suites. I was very pleased with the close proximity to Disneyland, area restaurants, and the Anaheim Garden Walk mall. We were so close we did not need to pay for Disneyland parking. The hotel was refurbished in late 2008 so has a modern, attractive and clean appearance. The room rates are very good. I felt the hotel was an excellent value. I WILL BRING THE FAMILY TO STAY HERE AGAIN.

This is our third time staying here for our yearly family Disneyland trip. We have always been so happy with the clean rooms and friendly staff. With a group of 8 adults and 5 small children, it is very convenient so close to the park we can walk. We will be back next year.

Summary Heading: No Frills, but Cheap, Functional & Close to Disneyland
Summary: We arrived at the Islander about 9:00 on a Thursday night.  The Islander is a small, horseshoe-shaped property, two stories tall, with outside entrances to all the rooms, and parking spots arranged around the inside of the horseshoe.  The building is clearly pretty old, probably dating to the sixties, with not much in the way of upgrades since; its appearance, at night, is more than a bit on the seedy side.  A postage-stamp-sized pool fills out one leg of the horseshoe, while the tiny motel office makes up the end of the other leg.  The lobby absolutely reeks of…something.  Could be cleaning product, could be an “air freshener,” but it is difficult to spend more than a couple of minutes at the desk, due to the fake-citrus smell.  Check-in was efficient and we were given exactly

Summary Heading: Air Freshener Caused an Asthma Attack
Summary: I attempted to check into the hotel only to be greeted by an obnoxious air freshener scent in the lobby. I had a severe asthma attack and I began shaking. I asked the man behind the counter if the rooms are also treated with the same air freshener and he said yes. I told him I could not stay because of my breathing difficulty. The manager came to the counter and began yelling at my daughter because I had to move myself to the outside and breathe in some fresh air. When I realized what was going on, I poked my head inside to see why this person was yelling at my daughter. She was telling her it was my fault I did not request my room to not be sprayed with air freshener. I then told her it was not publicized that air freshener was used! It ended with my leaving to find another

Close to Disney!  Walk time  was no longer than 15 minutes.  This is the perfect time to visit Anaheim- no crowds, no lines, just a magical family vacation.  We had a lovely room, and could tell it had been recently updated.  Our reservation was for a 3 bed suite, but we received a 4 bed suite instead at no additional charge.  The amenities are very basic; you definitely get what you pay for.  Breakfast consists of apples, danish, and coffee.  There are several restaurants very nearby, for all budgets, and all of them are within walking distance.  This hotel is very small, and I can see how parking would be an issue during a busier time.

The Islander Inn was perfect for our 7 night stay in Anaheim. It was very well priced, wonderful service, and fairly close to Disneyland. My kids were 7 year old twins and a 10 year old but we still couldn't walk to Disneyland and back everyday. Our feet were killing us! The shuttle was very useful. I think my only complaint was how dirty the hotel room floor was. Maybe it is a Canadian thing, but we don't wear our shoes indoors and I made my kids wear them at all times, when they weren't on the beds.  We stayed in room 234, which was the two room suite, queen bed with two doubles. It is right on the end of the hotel by the pool, upstairs. It was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with a budget.

Summary Heading: $70 and less than 1 mile from Disney...you can't ask for much more.
Summary: Look, this motel is within walking distance of Disney (about 15-20 min) and it's only $70 a night.  What more do you want?  I have to wonder where the people who are complaining are from.  Being from Chicago, I don't really expect much for $70, especially right outside the gates of Disney. The rooms are decent in size (two queen sized beds and a fold out couch), have a mini fridge, microwave, coffee pot and internet access.  The beds are comfortable, the staff is friendly and if I was brave enough, I would have used the outdoor pool (it was just too darn cold).   Also, there is a small laundry room if you need it.   Across the street is an upscale mall with restaurants like Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs and California Pizza Kitchen.  A little further down the street is a

We stayed here from October 30-November 10 2008 and loved it!  Simple motel set up BUT nice clean rooms, awesome staff, great location. cheap too! Hot showers with good water pressure. Laundry on site that was cheap to use, nice clean pool (was a tad too cold for us Aussies!)  The manager (Dilip) was friendly and helpful, always willing to go one step further to make your stay perfect. Told us that we may want to move as we were on bottom floor, had no kids and may not like the noise of people walking past us (didnt bother us)  All other staff, including housekeeping, were friendly, helpful and polite. Dilip's lovely wife (sorry, we forget her name! Sorry!!!) even drove us to the local Food4Less supermarket so we could get some groceries. She told us any time we wanted to go

We stayed here because the reviews seemed reasonable and the price was superb for being so close to Disneyland.  The staff was very helpful, and we didn't experience any problems.  Our room was clean and spacious, though the odd arrangement of the furniture made much of the space difficult to use.  In particular, the placement of the fridge made it difficult to access the closet.  The lighting was also inadequate.

I booked this hotel based on review that i saw on line.  Who the hell is staying in this hole and giving it good review, you are misleading people!!!  This hotel is far from clean, and when you walk into your room it has a unpleasant smell.  We stayed two nights and i just could not stay any longer, and we were there to sleep only.  We had to lay the extra blankets on the floor so our kids could play.  I understand that many  hotels in this areas see alot of traffic on the rugs, have you heard of a carpet cleaner?  We went across the street and stayed at the holiday inn, and the rooms were clean, not to mention that more than one person could be in the bathroom, and after walking on the carpets your socks did not turn black.  I will say the staff at the islanders were kind and

The Hotels Location was great. They just finished remodeling. On the Phone They were very accomadating. That ends once you arrive. I asked for a 4 bed room and they gave us a 3 bed and denied the request. Offered us a rollaway at no extra charge. great. Never saw it. We had a crib instead. figured they gave us that .Maybe they were out of rollaways. At checkout I had crib charges. They said Crib was extra because of the elusive rollaway. Didn't believe me about rollaway. Had to call housekeeping to verify no rollaway. When I got Home there is almost $200 in seperate charges Made before we even checked out. They deny it and than after several phones call said they were reversed. Days later they are still there. They have no recollection of this charge. I suggest if you stay book

we, 8 of us, 2 families stayed there for 5 nights. we travelled with young children and teenager. It was our longest hotel stay during our vacation in C, USA. In general hotel was nice, the front desk workers were really helpful. There was funny smell in the room but not that much. it was in acceptable level. we had a problem with W.C. at first night. Toilet was jammed. But it was solved immediately even with old methods. we heard same problem from other rooms at that night. but never heard again. the hotel is close to everywhere, walk distance to theme park. the breakfast was quite bad. I do not recommend breakfast part.  but other things were really nice. Room features were ok.

Great staff and friendly.  I spilt our baby formula on the carpet and the housekeeper came within a few minutes to clean it up!  Wonderful.  Rooms were spacious and clean.  Very kid friendly.  Gated pool and shuttle service to Disneyland was perfect.  We have 3 childern under 3 and could not have asked for anything better.  Dining across the street and the rooms were quit.

Islander Inn has the most comfortable beds; it is quiet, and very clean.  Our room was faithfully cleaned every day- we stayed 8 nights.  The service was friendly; the front desk helped us fine some unique shops and allowed us to use their computer when we needed to print out some information.  Our rooms where spotless, this is one of the few times we did not have to ask for cleaning supplies - we are very picky.  We appreciate the high quality of cleanliness at Islander Inn; it allowed us to truly enjoy our vacation.  We also enjoyed the pool, the close walk to Disneyland and near-by shops.

Summary Heading: Great Find for the money...clean, friendly and great location!
Summary: When I made my reservation, I was skeptical because of the low rate, but I decided to take the chance on past reviews.  This place is a great stay!  My boyfriend and I recently visited from September 18-21st. We arrived late at night.  The young man at the front desk was very friendly.  Our room was basic but most importantly clean!  There was a small dorm size refrigerator and microwave.   The location is perfect!  The walk to the park is maybe 10 minutes.  There is a IHOP conveniently located near the corner of Katella and Harbour (not the one across from the main entrance) where we went every morning for breakfast.  Across the street is Anaheim Gardenwalk which recently opened.  There you will find a outdoor shopping plaza and restraurants where we would usually go for drinks

Our family of 5 stayed at the Islander for a week's vacation in Anaheim; mainly to visit Disneyland. The accommodation was basic but comfortable and the staff very friendly and accommodating. Considering the amount of time you will spend in a hotel if you are visiting Disneyland this was fine. The free internet access was handy too as we did have our laptop. It was about a 10min walk (with children) around to Disneyland and no problem, even late at night. Can highly recommend the Garden Walk across the street for eating at restaurants and a bit of shopping if you have time.  Don't expect to fill up for breakfast, all they offered was danish pastries and apples to take out from the reception area - but don't let that stop you. We used the on site laundry facilities and the pool

We chose the Islander Suites and Inn, principally because it had  true two bedroomed suites and was close to Disney. Although  we had to share the bathroom (there are two doors), each bedroom was large, one with a king bed and the other with two queens.  Apart from that we were presently surprised top find how nice the hotel was and only about ten to fifteen minutes walk from Disneyland entrance. The walk there is fine, coming back a bit more difficult, although there is a bus.  The hotel has free wifi, free parking, a swimming pool and a simple breakfast included and all at a reasonable price. What more do you want, when  you are likely to be out all day anyway.  A recent advantage for tor this hotel is that the new Anaheim Gardens Mall has opened close by and many of the newly

Summary Heading: Nice & simple place to stay! Cheap too!
Summary: My partner and I stayed at the Islander Inn & Suites in May 2008 for 3 nights.  We paid $78 per night for a Private Queen Double.  Breakfast is included in the price, however it is only coffee, juice & a pastry.  With an IHOP or Denny's around the corner there are better options.  There are no Internet facilties except for WIFI in the rooms.  It looks like your typical motel as you enter, however is it clean & looks nice.  There is a pool, sun beds & drink machines as you enter to the right.  Our room was on the second floor at the back of the complex.  The complex is set in a U shape so you can park your car under or infront of your room if need be.  The room was huge with 2 Queen Beds, couch, desk, big wardobe, fridge, microwave & TV.  It was very clean & comfortable.  The

When we got to the hotel we were tired from a long day of traveling and dealing with the LA Freeway system.  We were very pleased to find a large clean room with everything we needed.  We had pre-booked a crib for our daughter and it was waiting for us in the room.  No we didn't have to set the crib up as it was done for us including the necessary linen.  The staff was friendly and courteous.  They were more than willing to share info about the area including best routes to different destinations.  We bought a one day transit service but it was really unnecessary.  It was honestly, 10 minutes to the gates of Disneyland and California Advertureland.  It was an easy walk even with a 22 month old.  There were many restaurants in the area but found many were fairly pricey.  IHOP was

Okay first of all, I can't even believe this place gets business.  The front desk people were polite.  HOWEVER, the rooms were smelly, floors were dirty, and I refused to use the shower.  We booked two rooms.  One of the rooms had a funky shower stall.  If you plan on staying in the Disneyland area and are particular about the bathroom of you hotel, this is not the place.  I also found hard candy that had been stuck to the side of the bed, and some type of grease on the side table.  Semi nice people work here, but until they update the bathrooms and beds, this place shoud be charging 40 bucks a night.

Yes, it's a good deal and the location is excellent. The free internet is nice, but the free breakfast is a joke. The rooms are clean and functional. The bathroom is tiny.  The pool is very small. Staff is efficient and friendly. Overall it's a good value for money hotel, but realy nothing very special.

we arrived on a sunday afternoon. Check in was fast and they were very friendly in the office. We checked in to our refurbished room[ basic room] .There were 7 of us . If your looking for somthing fancy .Then I would'nt recomment this hotel .But for a nice clean basic room that accomidates a larger family and within walking distance to disney . I would highly recomend it!

Summary Heading: STILL the Best Family Hotel near Disney
Summary: Stayed here last year and wrote a review, and folks, nothing has changed! This hotel is still the best bargain within 2 blocks of the Disneyland entrance for families or couples. Pool was still clean, Staff was VERY helpful, Room was exceptional as always, had same room as last year (210) and was always clean. Only complaint was that each day , housekeeping would turn off air conditioning and open the blinds which made coming back from park on a 106 degree day a bit much, but once you cranked up the AC , all was well. When you check in, also check the refrigerator, as it may not be plugged in ( Guess the hotel REALLY wants to save on electricity!) All in all another sucessfull stay at a well run privately owed hotel.  I had previously raved about the CoCo's Bakery restraunt down

Lately I have been using Trip Advisor to see what others think about hotels before I book them.  I did this before booking at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites and thought I would do the same for others.  This was a great place to stay.  From the outside, it looks like a quaint little place, but they have everything you could want.  Many smaller hotels have a regular key lock, but this one does have the card lock.  It had a mini frig and microwave which came in quite handy.  Continental breakfast was ok, danish and apples, coffee and orange juice...enough to get you going in the morning.  Free internet connection was a huge plus for me as I was attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center, which was a 5-10 minute walk, another plus.  I also walked to Downtown

We loved our stay. About a 15-20 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland. The pool was clean and heated to a perfect swimming temperature. Our 2-room suite was large, clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. We'll stay here again on our next visit.

I wasn't expecting too much because the rate was below than the average in Anaheim.  However I was totally surprised.  everyhting there feels fresh. The room was clean.  I had 2 double beds for 4 of us in the family.  The bathroom was clean..sparkling.  We had a 29" tv, a small refrigerator (not a minibar..but a real fridge), coffee machine, iron and board and plenty of towels.  They even have 2 extra pillows and a blanket already in the room.  And everything is inclusive.  NO ADDITIONAL CHARGE.  We loved the stay  and will certainly stay there again.  4th night we had to move out since the rooms were taken and we didn't have reservations to extend the night there.  Moved to Super 8 motel across the road.  The hotel is terrible.  The appearance was not inviting.  Needs a

This was a great hotel for us.  We needed somewhere that had separate rooms, a bathroom, a fridge, microwave and a pool.  The only complaint we had was the floor was quite dirty.  What do you expect in a hotel room.  We took ART to Disneyland because we knew we would be walking all day.  The ART stop was right outside the hotel.  There were plenty of good resturants within walking distance.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  HAving just come from the Pointe Hilton in Phoenix, we were a bit nervous but as I said this hotel was exactly what we needed.    Once again great stay and thank you to the staff at the Islander.

We have been going to Disneyland every year since our kids were 1, they are now 21 and 17 and now friends and finance's tag along...this hotel is great for us my hubby and I get own room while still conntected to the kids...sharing the bathroom is not that bad. Staff was very nice and accomodating, parking was never a problem rooms were clean and everything worked! i would highly recommend this hotel with anyone traveling with  tweens or teens! just wish they had a jacuzzi..

I needed accommodation for 2 Adults and 2 teenagers ( 16 & 15) As the kids would not share a bed I found it very difficult to find a place that had at least 3 beds in the one room. A two bedroom place was not in our budget. After great research found the Anaheim Islander Inn & suites had a "KIDS ROOM". This had two double beds and a bunk bed. This was great. The room was also bigger than the normal room. The Islander also had a pool  and laundry facilities. It was in walking distance to Disneyland and restaurants. Breakfast was available in the foyer of the office each morning but there was not much choice. We had breakfast at Subway. A coffee making machine was in the room but it was a pity that a jug or kettle was not available to be able to make a cup of tea. Asked for a jug

My sister and I have just arrived back from our stay at the Islander and I can't say enough good things about it. We were travelling on a budget and chose the Islander for this reason. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, nothing was too much trouble. They helped us book trips and  were always there to answer questions.   The rooms were very large as were the beds. The inclusion of a microwave & fridge were a great help. The rooms were cleaned every day and the towels were white and plentiful.   Across the road on the right from the hotel were lots of amenities, a 711 amoung them and on the right 5 large restaurants including the Cheesecake Factory and McCormick & Schmidts.  The shuttle bus for Disneyland picked you up at the front of the Islander and it is the 1st pick up

2008 was our second year staying at the Islander, and we will certainly be back again next year.  I cannot say enough good things about the Islander:  big, comfortable beds, clean rooms, bright and clean bathrooms, a nice pool, and a short walk (really!) from the Disney parks.  The rates for the rooms are superb for the location, and the staff has always gone above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable.  We will never stay anywhere else but the Islander when we come to Anaheim, and I recommend it without hesitation.

A friend & I have stayed at the Islander two years in a row. It is just a quick walk from Disney with wildly reasonable rates for the Anaheim/SoCal area. Every employee we've encountered has been incredibly kind and the rooms are always spotless (something regular travelers can treasure). Room service is efficient & unobtrusive. This year we had to cut our stay short by a day, and the owner of the Islander was gracious enough to refund us for one night's stay -- something he most certainly was not obligated to do. We will most certainly be regulars at the Islander as time progresses, because this one has been a diamond in the motel rough.

We stayed at the Anaheim Islander during a spring break trip to Disneyland. It had the same dirty carpets that you can find throughout Anaheim. My husband's hypothesis is that people pick up grease on their shoes at Disneyland. The room met our needs (two queen beds for us and our two children). It's hard being on a second floor with no elevator. I did like the microwave and fridge in room. We never checked out the continental breakfast because we prefer to make our own cereal in our room. Oh, bring quarters for the ice machine! I had never seen an ice machine at a hotel that charged.  There are new restaraunts within a block of the hotel (California Pizza Kitchen, PF Changs, and Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.) making hotels on Katella more desireable than they once were.

The hotel is 15 minutes from SNA Airport.  We were late check-ins which was no problem. The front desk clerk was extremely nice and the room has a microwave and a small refrigerator--perfect for a family on a budget trip to Disneyland!  The room was clean with two queen beds, a sofa, cable and a swimming pool just outside the door! Parking is free and the street is lined with great restaurants. (Disneyland is a 10 minute walk but we drove so it took 3 minutes! ) The only thing to keep in mind is that this is not a luxury hotel-it is a simple, comfortable, clean and friendly place to sleep while you're visiting the attractions. We plan on staying here whenever we visit Disneyland...

This is a great little hotel!  We were pleasantly surprised and very nervous as it is a two-star, but the rooms were very clean and there were plenty of towels.  We travelled with a 2 year and a 5 year old and booked the double rooms so we had four beds and two spacious rooms between the four of us.  The fridge and microwave were an asset as we had breakfast in the morning and made sandwiches for lunch at Disneyland.  Our other family members also stayed in the hotel and found it great as well.  The staff is very helpful and friendly and the price was unbelievable value.  It is only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland or you can take the shuttle for a few dollars.  There is lots of restaurants nearby, a 7-11, and a few bigger grocery stores within a few minutes drive or a couple of

A very good, clean, well priced hotel. Just 15 mins walk to the Main Gate at Disney. A few mins to eating places and 7/11 Owners very friendly and helpful. Have stayed here many many times and would always come back here. In fact have booked already for 2008. Mick London, UK

We stayed for four days at the end of our trip to California. Location is very close to Disneyland, lots of restaurants etc around in walking distance. Staff were very friendly and helpfull. Rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. And all this for a reasonable price. What more would you want? Only one thing, but that was by all means not the motels fault, we had very noisy neighbours, but you always seem to get those on the weekends for some reason. Other than that a great stay!

I originally booked this hotel because of the reasonable price.  When we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised.  Very friendly and accomodating staff.  We found the room spacious, extremely clean and quiet.  Excellent location (close to Disneyland).  I would definitely recommend this hotel.  Thank you Dilip and staff!

We stayed for 2 nights.  The beds were uncomfortable, the carpet was dirty and the bathroom was small.  Everytime the people in the room above us walked around we heard them loud and clear.  Parking was also a problem and the room had a funky smell to it.  We won't stay at this motel again.

Just got back from the Islander Inn and Suites. We spent three nights there. The location to Disney and surrounding attractions is excellent. The room was of a good size and we asked for a position at the rear of the building as the front is situated on a very busy road and could be noisy. As mentioned in a previous review we too found the carpets very dirty and had to keep our shoes on. I appreciate it is difficult when the entrance to the room is directly off the outside, but we did not find this problem while staying at another Anaheim motel. Breakfast was juice coffee and a pastry which could be enjoyed by the poolside. The pool was small but quite adequet, a little noisy as it is situated right alongside the road. We found Cocos Restaurant and Bakery a great find thanks to

Family stay - grandparents, parents and 1 daughter - in the family unit . B/r living room, plus seperate spacious b/r (both with 2 x Q size comfortable beds) with shared interconnecting bathroom/toilet. Very reasonable rates. The owners were really helpful and obliging. Handy to Disneyland.  And if you're hungry - try Mimi's - fantastic! We can thoroughly recommend this for any Kiwis looking for NZ Motel type accomodation.

We stayed here for one week at the end of August. My wife had stayed here before with one of her friends and we stayed based on her experience. We stayed in a large suite with two queen beds in one room and two double beds in the second room. We had 3 adults and 3 adult children (ages 18 and 19). We payed around $90 per night which is incredibly reasonable.  I've stayed at several places around Disneyland and this was the best value I have ever had.   This place is very close to the park, although we used the Anaheim Resort Transit system anyway. At the end of a long day in the park, the last thing I want to do is walk home. An added bonus is that the Islander is the first pick up and drop off on route G. There are only four hotels on this route so the trolley comes about every

Between the two families on holidays, we have been to the Islander Inn 5 times!  Party of 6, 3 adults, 3 teens (2-19 y.o., one 18 y.o.) Booked 2 room suite, plenty of room although bathroom VERY small for rooms of that size! Clean carpet, very tidy, clean room and bathroom, all updated recently!  Cleaning staff are great! Nice to have a fridge and microwave too! Front desk staff wonderful, very knowledgeable. Anaheim Resort Transit "G" route outside office, best deal in town, first stop of four. (Why aren't ALL the neighbouring resorts on the routes???) Continental breakfast was apples, coffee, orange juice and a variety of danish ... okay to start the day, always fresh. The pool was warm enough, but was a little yucky as the skimmer had come away from its holder (lots of floaty

My family stayed at the Islander Inn for 3 nights, we found that the Islander was everything we had hoped it to be. It was clean and  comfortable, the staff was very friendly and answered all of my questions. the Disney shuttle stopped right in front of the motel and was only $3 for the whole day. I would suggest the shuttle if you have small children, because it is about a 4 long block walk to Disney. Our LA tour bus also picked us up right at the motel for our wonderful city tour. The two things that could be upgraded is the amount of TV stations available and the breakfast, but we did not have to much time to watch TV and the breakfast helped us start out  our days. I would recomend the Islander to anyone who goes to Disneyland or Anaheim.

We stayed at the Islander Inn for 4-nights with two rooms--one for 5 teenagers, one for 2 adults.  We found the rooms very clean and recently updated.  The air conditioning worked well and overall very comfortable, roomy accommodations.  Not upscale, but very good.    The teenagers shared a room with 2 queens and a sofabed, and there was still room to easily walk around even with the sofabed pulled out.  They were comfortable, and a bargain for 5 people in one spacious room ($110 per night plus the $16 room tax).  Negatives to be aware of:  The included breakfast is just assorted danish, apples, oj and coffee.  The towels are a bit thin/small.  The walk to Disneyland is bit longer than some of the other 'bargain' hotels, but not much.   Overall, we were very happy with the place

Just returned from a 3 day stay here and I can truly say I've seen the best and worst that the Islander has to offer.  The worst: Room 133 at the front of the hotel. It was dark and noisy. Lots of street noise could be heard starting at about 6:15am, plus the ice machine was just outside the room, buzzing & cycling all night. The room was dark because of the ice machine and stairs to the second floor blocking part of the only window. Other little annoyances were things like the button to turn on the shower in the tub being broken, and drawers in the chest not rolling properly. The carpets, however, were clean and the decor seemed fairly up to date. The best: Room 214 and other corner rooms at the back of the property. Very quiet, large rooms with 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper.

We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children aged 11 & 14 and have just returned form a 3 week holiday touring California. I booked the Islander Inn and Suites after careful consideration and review of comments made on Trip Advisor. I booked a 3 bedded suite. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The staff were always helpful, able to anwser our questions. Although Disney is an easy, flat 10 min walk from the hotel we accepted the offer to be driven by the hotel staff on the first day. We did walk to and from Disney to take a break and enjoy the pool. The accommodation provides excellent value for money, in a location that makes Disney easy access and would stay here agian.

We are a family of four who stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights. The positives to this Hotel are : - Location  - Separate Bedroom - Large rooms which were clean - Warm Pool - Good price for the area  Weaknesses to this Hotel are : - Location from Disneyland is slightly further out than others on Harbour Blvd.  Overall a positive experience with this property and our family slept well. As we walk everywhere, the location wasn’t a problem. Recommended for families and couples.

We stayed at the Islander for 4 nights in March for a family trip to Disneyland.  We chose the hotel because we had a fairly large party (6 people), we wanted something close to the park, and the price was right.  The room we booked was their Family Suite, which has two connecting rooms and a single bathroom.  One room has 2 queen beds and the other has 2 doubles.  There is a TV in each room.  One room has a table and a couple of chairs, the other has a single armchair.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The microwave and the fridge were both working fine. The pool looked OK but we didn't get around to using it.  This property is the first stop on the "G" route for the ART shuttle that goes to Disneyland.  That means that if you are going there first thing in the morning, you

My husband and I  had planned on going to Disneyland but last minute "life emergencies" left us strapped for cash. If it hadn't been for the great deal at the Islander we probably wouldn't have gone. We were able to get a 2 room suite (a friend was going to stay with us) for $89 a night. They cancelled on us last minute so we down graded to the standard room $49 a night. The hotel looked friendly and clean from the outside and when we checked in we were welcomed in a friendly matter. Our room was very clean and I couldn't believe how we got so lucky. The only excusable problem for me was it smelled like they just put new carpeting  which,  after opening the window for about an hour, was no longer a issue.   You can walk to Disneyland from the hotel you need to cross 2 streets

Well, we saw some previous review of this hotel and kind of knew what to expect.     The Good:  Close location to Disney (just two blocks walking distance  and located on major cross street - Katella, with easy access to I-5 for our trip to Six Flags Magic Mountain.  Parking was not the nightmare we had read in previous reviews.  We never had a problem getting a spot close to our room.  Lot (hotel) is small so if you can't walk 50-100 feet, you probably haven't got any room to complain about parking and walking distance to your room.  Nice little pool.  Then again, we are from Washington and outdoor pools are something of a novelty to those of us from colder/rainy climates.  The flaws of the physical plant aside, the staff we dealt with was friendly and acommodating.  The Bad:

Summary Heading: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!!
Summary: Stay away from this hotel!!  I booked this hotel a month in advance because it had a nice internet site but I was sure wrong to do so.  When we arrived it looked nice from the outside but inside the rooms were a different story.  The room smelled musty, the microwave didn't work, the refrigerator was warm, and the beds were as hard as the floor ( $50 matress at best).  During the evening around 8:00 I took a walk we recieved several complaints from the people below us that we were jumping up and down on the floor, when all we were doing was walking around putting things away for our extended stay.  After the second phone call I went down to the office to talk with the person there.  He told me to quit having my 5 year old son jump up and down.  I told him that he is in bed

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights for the 50th Disneyland celebration.  The room was very clean and comfortable; sheets, towels, carpet, fridge and coffeemaker were all spotless.  It was great having the appliances!  We came back to our rooms for a mid-day break and made lunch and put our feet up.  The second day I had to go to the emergency room and we had no idea where it was, the desk clerk was VERY helpful and actually concerned for us -- he gave wonderful directions and told us he could help us with checking out if we had to leave.  I was fine after the visit and the medication and was able to still enjoy our last couple of days at the park.  The desk clerk made sure I was fine and was relieved everything turned out okay.  We are planning to go back to Disneyland

We have stayed here on the New Year. Booked it 3 weeks ahead and chose it because it had the bunk beds and 2 queens’ beds, and most places within walking distance of Disneyland were full or very high prices. I would stay there again because it was a great value. We only used the shuttle once, and it was good but the walk to the main entrance only 10 minutes so walk rest of the days.

When you are a larger family on a budget but still want quality for your dollar this is the place to stay.  The rooms are very clean and the staff are so outgoing and helpful that it makes you feel like you are at your own home away from home. We are a family of seven and this hotel was so comfortable and close to great eating places that are in walking distance.  The shuttle to Disneyland stops right at the entrance to the hotel.  The staff was so helpfull on giving advise as to were to go and eat that wasn't to expensive yet good food, and also booked shuttles for us to other activities and the airport.  The continental breakfast each morning was the worlds best danishes and hot coffee and juice and also fresh fruit.  The kids loved the pool and it was nice to just sit around

Never stayed in hotel. Had a death in the family so we cancelled our trip to Disneyland. Hotel refused to cancel reservation even though we cancelled 48 hours prior to arrival. Staff very rude, made up information about cancellation policies, whole thing was a scam. Would NEVER book this hotel again due to the insensitivity of the booking staff. Finally hotel said they would cancel the reservation but would have to charge my credit card anyway and that they would reverse the charges 3 business days later. We are reporting them to the Anaheim Better Business Bureau as well as the authorities.
Manager Response: Thank you for informing us the issue. We appreciate the effort of sharing your opinion in this forum. According to our policy, our system will automatically authorize the credit cards that we have on file for all guests arriving in the next 48 hours. As this guest called us in the 48 hours period, the authorization has been processed and in order for us to reverse it is to re-transmitted it back to the bank. Even if we re-transmitted it on the same day, depending on the bank, it normally takes a minimum of three business days to neutralize the balance. We have showed our courtesy by not charging this guest due to the death in the family as stated, disregarding the fact that the guest called within 48 hours of arrival. All of the above has been explained to the guest directly on the day of the cancellation.  We credit our success in the lodging industry by providing good service and accommodation at affordable prices. We up-hold our high standard in the industry to maintain a good level of satisfaction from our guests and we will always keep it in a good standing.

Summary: We have just returned from disneyland - LA. It was a great stay at islander inn.  Hotel staff is very friendly and very efficient.  The hotel is very good for parent with kids,

Stayed in the family suite for 6 nights in September 2006.  Rooms definately need to be renovated especially the small bathroom.  Good location about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Breakfast was a small sweet danish, a piece of fruit with tea and coffee.  Probably next time I would pay extra money for a bit more luxury.

We've been to Disneyland many times and have stayed in many different motels.   This stay was for 6 nights.  The Islander met all of our needs and is a teriffic bargin.   Comfortable beds, clean remodeled rooms with Wi-Fi Internet, continental breakfast, parking space right outside the room, courteous staff, close to Disneyland.  We picked a suite with 2 rooms for a small additional fee.  Great to have the kids in their own room.  Brought our portable DVD player and hooked it up easily to the room TV with RCA jacks.  Staff is exceedingly friendly and well informed.  We had a low tire with a nail in it Sunday morning just before we were going to make a day trip to San Diego.  I figured the whole day was shot, but they directed us to a place that was open Sundays, only a couple of

The Islander Inn and Suites was excellent for our stay, clean and comfortable.  We took the 'Managers Special' which included 3 free tickets for Disney.  What a saving!  The location is within walking distance of the theme park and there are plenty of restuarants within easy reach. The Manager even gave us a lift to the park, what a deal.  Would highly recommend.

This hotel is a great choice for a family on a budget. It's a full 15 minute walk from Disneyland if  you have kids in tow; there are 3 signals to get through. It's clean and attractive--nothing fancy. We stayed for four nights. Morning, afternoon, and evening -- I always saw two or more parking spaces available. The parking is free. The pool is average sized with shaded areas and lounge chairs; I've been to 3 star hotels with smaller pools. The pool offers privacy,  and is just a bit on the cool side. The staff was pleasant. There were plenty of towels. The complementary breakfast is great in a pinch: apples, OJ, coffee and danish. There's a soda machine and ice machine onsite. We stayed in a family suite with two rooms. Each room had a TV that got a few local channels and HBO.
Great location, and good price only 2 blocks to disneyland, very easy walk.  Rooms were clean.

I stayed here in Feb 2006 visiting Disneyland for the 50th. I would say that this was a neutral experience because nothing went terribly bad, but it wasn't that terribly great.  Parking is limited, unless you are lucky and come back to hotel before 10-11PM. By midnight its  virtually impossible to find parking. I never had this problem, but did notice the parking lot packed when I would go outside to smoke. I was kind of scared to leave the car out there, only because the "Motel" next to it is very run down with all sorts of bad people.  Every day that I stayed there I had the little door handle sign saying NO SERVICE. Meaning I wanted no one in my room, as I have had things messed with (i.e. stolen) before and didn't want anyone and we weren't staying too long we needed

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a Great Price
Summary: Islander Inn is great for the price.  Outside looks like a compound, but the room was Disney clean and very spacious.  We walked to the park, restaurants, variety and liquor stores.  We stayed at 3 hotels in our tour of Califonia and this was the best.  The beds were very comfortable.  Cable TV has very limited choices (I missed my CNN and Weather Channel, but my wife reminded me that we were here to forget the world's problems), pool is adequate, laundry room is limited but served us well.  My only real complaint is that house keeping shut off the A/C when they cleaned.  We were on the top floor and the room got very hot by the time we returned from the park.  It took 3 hours to cool down.  However, it was abnormally hot when we visited with temps in the mid 90's.  Overall I

Just came back from a 5 night stay.  We had a group of 27.  Rooms were large and clean; each group had a different size room (1 group of 8, 2 groups of 6, & 1 group of 7).  Since we had 16 children the pool saw alot of action.  Towels were plenty and never ran short since we must of used at least 30 a day.  The pool is small but was able to fit our group.  The staff was very acommodating, i.e. needed to do laundey but was able to finish load after closing time or pick up clothes since we stayed late at Disney.   The internet costs $3 a day.  It worked fine the 1st day but had problems the next day.  All and all we would stay there again especially with a large group.

We stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn for 1 night after a 4 night stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  The manager could not have been any nicer.  We had booked a 2 queen bed room with a sofa bed, but we were given our choice of a 2 queen with bunk beds or a suite with 4 queen beds.  My kids loved the bunks - double lower and single upper so we opted for that one.  It was very clean and the fridge was great, along with a coffee maker and a small microwave.  The continental breakfast of pastries, coffee, juice and fruit was good. For $72.44 total (incl. tax,fees, etc) this was a real bargain and we would stay there again The weather was too cool to try the pool, but it also looked very clean.  There were laundry facilities available.  K

Summary Heading: Cancelled reservation and didn't let us know until we went to check in!
Summary: I made my reservations for this hotel on March 31, 2006.  On April 18, 2006 when we went to check into the hotel after 9:00p.m. they had given our room to someone else.  They said there was some problem with our credit card and the hotel clerk said that a person's reservation automatically gets erased when this happens.  Now why wouldn't they let us know ahead of time there was a problem with the card?!  They shouldn't have been trying to charge us for anything until we checked in.  Needless to say, I wasn't happy and ended up staying down the street at a much nicer place.   I will always remember this experience and tell others not to stay there.

Summary Heading: good rates, good service, would stay again
Summary: We were pleased with our room, one of the few available near Disney that was large enough to fit our party of 6. Two adults, three teens and a senior. The price was affordable. This is an economy motel, so don't expect all the bells and whistles, but it was enough for us.   THe staff was friendly and efficient.  The parking lot was small, but we had no problems finding a spot. Pool wasn't "hot-tub" warm, but it was refreshing and clean.    The rooms are well away from the road, and it is nice and quiet. The walk to Disney is about 10 minutes, and there are busses available, but we didn't mind the walk.   We will stay there again next time we visit Disneyland.

i simply cannot adequately express what a pit this motel is and how poorly we were treated. first of all, the motel is nothing like it's website. our suite was dirty and had had the slight smell of sewage (we later found out why.) the *free parking* only applies if you can find a spot. if not, *free parking* is only available at the crack house next door. and no, that was not hyperbole. the *continental breakfast* was stale danish and bruised apples. that's it. the *laundry* facility consisted of one washing machine and one dryer. needless to say, this was not sufficient for a family of five on a nine day trip with only four days worth of clothing. the *year round heated pool* was only *heated* to the point where there was no longer ice on the surface. it was freezing and i do
Manager Response: Anaheim Islander Inn & Suites has been serving our guest with great hospitality. We provide good service and accommodation at affordable prices. I thank you for taking a time to let us know where the improvement is needed. So that we may continue to maintain our high standards. The Anaheim Islander does provide continental breakfast which consists of assorted Danishes, orange juice, coffee & apples. The hotel does have a free parking for its guests. When some guests bring more than 1 car we assist them by directing them to additional parking at the hotel next door.

Summary: After a long flight from Australia it was good to be greeted by the friendly staff, we found the staff to be really helpful and friendly.  They went the "extra" mile for our boys charging up Ipods and letting them get onto the e-mail to friends.  Travelling with two older teenage boys the large rooms allowed us all to have a bit of "space".  All the amenities were good and workable.  The location was ideal just a short walk to Disneyland.

Upon arriving to check in, we noticed the parking lot was small and we kept our fingers crossed that when we returned from the parks at night, there would be parking; there was LOTS of parking and no problems.  Check in was fast.....our room was clean and comfortable.  We reserved (AND received) the 2 room "suite" that has 2 queen beds (along with table & 2 chairs) when you walk in (plus fridge, micro, coffee & tv) and the second bedroom had 2 double beds (oversized chair & another tv).  Both rooms shared access to the 1 bathroom.  Over 625 square feet of room is what I read.  The hairdryer in the bathroom has a built in, small, red nightlight and the light switch plate in the double bed room, has a green glowing nightlight...but if you are traveling with kids, I recommend

We were on the tail end of our six week trip and chose the Islander Inn from reviews I had read and the price.  Was not expecting too much, but more than satisfied.  Nice, big room with all the amenities (including fridge and microwave), although I had to clean all the black hair off the bathroom floor when we first checked-in - (not a problem after that though), and we had to wait until 5.30 for them to bring us fresh towels.    Went for a swim in the pool - was nicely maintained, but a bit noisy from the street if you are after a quiet spot to sit!  The staff at reception were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.  They hung onto our bags on the last day as we were not leaving for the airport until 7.30 that night, and we checked out at 11.00 a.m.  They even helped

We stayed at this motel for the last few nights of our holiday and decided to pay a bit extra to get good rooms to end our holiday with. Their website looked fantastic but when we arrived, we couldn't believe it was the same place. It's basically a small traditional 2-storey motel with units surrounding the car park. It's incredible what you can do with photography - the pool was tiny and right by the road but you'd never guess from their photo. The rooms were less airy than the photos and were also less clean than they should have been. There were sticky drink marks on the table and the chairs were stained. Putting aside our disappointment, it IS very convenient for Disneyland, being just ten minutes from the main entrance. If we hadn't seen the website we would have found it

Summary Heading: Decent room for a discount price
Summary: Our family of 2 parents, 2 kids, plus sister-in-law, stayed there in August 2005 for one week. We found that the room was clean and well-maintained, the house-keeping and counter staff friendly and nice, and the location was both fairly quiet and the location (a 15 min. walk to Disneyland entrance) was good.   The continential breakfast was basic, and consisted of a Danish or apple and coffee.   Based on the prior reviews, we were prepared to leave if the hotel wasn't any good, but we found that wasn't necessary and we were quite satisfied. We found it was a decent, clean, no frills room, but at a good price.  We'd recommend it, and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.  Jay - Kelowna, B.C., Canada

I stayed here with my wife and two small children in Sept 05. I did a lot of research on Trip Advisor beforehand in order to find the best deal - based on the price, the distance from Disneyland, parking, and cleanliness. This looked like the best deal, and it was. The price was great; the hotel was two full blocks from Disneyland, which was wonderful, because I didn't have to pay for parking; the room was clean enough to stay in (I have had countless problems in other hotels - even very nice ones - so I must be a little picky); the workers were friendly and helpful; parking was free. AND - they allow you to leave your car in their parking lot for the rest of the day after checking out (saves another day of parking fees). I highly recommend this hotel, if you understand that it

Great value for your money. Clean and safe. Block and a half from Disneyland entrance (about 10 minute walk)or use their shuttle if you want. Close to IHOP and Denny's. Can accommodate 6 in a room (two queen beds and a pullout sofa sleeper).

The hotel was as expected by other reviews I had seen, and by the price. It was a good location, clean room, nice price. I was comfortable. The parking was bad, we had to park next door as requested by the hotel manager and that hotel parking lot was SCARY! We took 6 teenage girls and the place we had to park at 1:00 in the morning was like a crack house. It was really bad! People standing out front fighting, old cars that had the windows busted in, a guy sleeping in the parking lot in a sleeping bag next to his car with the doors open and someone in the car smoking who knows what....  I wouldn't stay at this hotel again simply because I was sure our car was going to be broken into, or stolen. We go to L.A. at least twice a month so I know what I'm talking about....Too bad

We stayed at the Islander the weekend before disneys 50th anniversary. When we arrived we were surprised at how small it was, as the pictures we had seen on the internet had been decieving. The staff seemed very helpful and answered all our questions. The location is good, only 10 minutes wlak form disneyland. We were staying for two nights, and as they got our booking wrong, we were moved after one night to another room. The rooms were 'ok', but very smelly. The sheets seemed clean and the bathroom, yet the fridge or kettle did not work. Everything felt sticky, like they needed cleaning. The pool was small, and overlooked by the road.  Out of 10 hotels we stayed in on our holidays this was the worst.

We wanted a motel-style property with a separate bedroom, so we could spread out, without having to pay the cost of 2 rooms.  Islander Inn was excellent value for money, two large rooms, two TVs, nice pool, we walked to Disneyland, clean and tidy and comfortable and handily located.  Only thing it could have improved on was by having enough glasses, cups, sets of cutlery, plates for each person in room so we could heat some food and eat at home occasionally, without balancing the pizza on a napkin.  Would definitely come back and also recommend to friends.

We stayed in a two-bedroom suite at the end of July. We thought the Islander was very good value although simple. Basically clean with (mostly) friendly and helpful staff. It's convenient for Disneyland which is about a 15 minute walk.  Only drawback was the pool which was very cloudy(although, to be honest, we didn't really have time to use it) We were warned off using the pool by the maintenance guy who said it didn't receive frequent enough checks.

The hotel isn't fancy, but was clean and close to Disney.  We weren't looking for fancy as we wanted to spend our time doing theme parks.  We stayed for a week, and never used the shuttle.  We had a suite - two rooms, 4 beds.  7 of us stayed.  The people were fantastic!  Any questions and they were more than happy to help.  Price was great!  We had a great time and would definately stay here again!!

During our 14 day trip to California , we stayed in Los Angles, Queen Mary, Radisson Hotels etc but we found Anaheim Islander Inn & Suites The Best one by miles !!! The rooms were wonderful, neat and  clean. Reception staff were wonderful, pleasant and helpful. We love to be there in our future stay.

Had the room with 2queen and sofa bed there were 5 of us there was enough room. House keeping was great front desk very friendly and helpful. Pool was good and clean. Had the shuttle on the street 3.00  a day but it was easy to walk the 15min, close to some restaurants 7 11 and food mart.We  brought some food and bought some and used the fridge and micro for some meals and made deli sandwiches for lunch in disney. House keeping did a great job cleaning always got what we asked for and more. The carpet were a little dirty could use a clean but not bad.We paid $85. us a night which from looking around was a good price . Some places were cheaper but you got no fridge microwave and laundry which we used the laundy twice. Our first trip to Disney we stayed and the Hampton Inn was

Although the Islander Inn was built in 1962 (I asked) the rooms were completely remodeled in 2002/3 looked very nice and very clean inside. Because of timing on my part, (last minute) I wanted to stay there for 5 days and I had to stay in two different rooms, one with 2 full size beds and bunkbeds (room 218), (kids liked that idea) because each of my 3 teenage children had their own beds on those nights and this room was very roomy, we didn't feel cramped. There is another room like 121 quite a bit smaller with bunkbeds as well, (I looked in when they were cleaning this room.)  Days 3,4 and 5 were in the Queen suite (like room 226) with a locked door (mom and dad time together) and the two full size beds in the other room for the kids.  Breakfast is from 7:00 to 9:00 they had OJ

Me and my family stayed in the Islander Inn and was not too impressed.  Looking on the internet for a decent deal and going off of the Islander's current ranking of #29 on Trip Advisor, I decided to book our stay.  Our room was decently sized with 2 queen beds, refrigerator and a microwave.  I checked the room, I found the rug to be a bit dingy and I'm usually not one to be a clean freak, but I found walking on the rug barefooted to be a bit a disgusting.  We found tiny insects flying around the room, there was a cricket in the tub one morning and 1-2 ants could always be found somewhere in the room.  The rooms furniture was in a sad state of condition.  The cabinet drawers were falling apart, the chairs were falling apart, most furniture surfaces had a tacky feeling (like it

We stayed at the Islander Inn trying to save some money at the end of our Disney vacation.  (We had stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for the 2 nights prior.)  For the money we "saved", we would have been money ahead to stay where we were because my picky family didn't care for the cellophane wrapped danish, so we then went to a restaurant for breakfast.  We didn't use the bus service since we were finished with Disney, but many other hotels provide a shuttle service for free, so this was another disappointment.  The hotel itself was "OK", but I wouldn't suggest it for Disney convenience, because you can get much better accommodations and service for about $12 more.

Summary Heading: Not overly impressed, felt it was overpriced.
Summary: After spending hours & hours online, getting prices and reading reviews, we decided to stay at the Anaheim Islander Inn & Suites.  For what we paid we were very disappointed in what we got.  The room was $95/night plus 15% taxes. We were expecting 2-room suite (there were 5 of us). Instead our "2 queens plus queen sofa bed" were all in 1 room - very cozy. I am not one to complain, but I even went back to the front desk because I thought we had been given the wrong room.   No - a larger room would cost about $35/night more - yikes! We also highly doubted that the beds were queen sized - they looked like doubles.  Aside from that the beds were comfortable, the staff was very nice. As other reviewers have pointed out, the continental breakfast is very skimpy - coffee, orange juice,

Summary Heading: Good place if on a budget
Summary: We stayed here on 5/1/05-5/4/05. The room was clean and  the continental breakfast was decent. The pool was useable. The price was fantastic! You cannot find another hotel closer to Disneyland for the price of 48.99 a night. We were the first ones  picked up on our route with ART and the first dropped off. We walked home one night from Disneyland and it was not that far or long of a walk. For the price I think we got our money's worth.

We recently stayed at the Islander Inn and Suites on our trip to Disneyland and enjoyed the stay.  Staff:  all of the staff were very helpful and courteous.  From the intial conversations during booking to our requests on site during the stay everyone was friendly and kind.  The prompt, cheerful service helped make our stay wonderful.  Housekeeping was efficient and discrete  Rooms:  the room was fully functional and just like the website indicated.  The carpet was a little dirty (we just kept our shoes on.) The linen was clean although a little worn, and the beds were comfortable.   The atmosphere was calm and quiet.  Amenities:  The pool was refreshing. The breakfast was very minimal although the coffee was good.  We found a reasonable priced grocery West on Katella Avenue

Summary Heading: Not Overly Impressed - Get what you pay for
Summary: Stayed here three nights.  Not an impressive looking place, just a basic motel type.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was nice, I've stayed in worse.  The thing that really put me off was when I went to bed the first night, I was in bed and then I got up and looked and saw a weird looking little bug crawling on the white sheet.  I freaked and killed it immediately.  It kind of looked like a mini scorpion bug, but I really didn't get a long look before I killed it.  I then looked and saw a little blood stain on the sheet where my leg had been.  Maybe it was a tick, or a bed bug, I don't know, but I was freaked after that.  I kept checking the bed over and over, but there was nothing else.  Also, the sheets made me itch.  The hotel is walking distance to the Park,

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if on a budget
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites for 2 nights last weekend.  I searched online through all the regular travel websites like travelocity and expedia, but found the best price was going straight to this hotel's website, ---- .  I booked the room with 2 queen beds and the sleeper sofa for 4 people.  It was only $46 per night before tax.  The room was simple but clean enough.    The fridge was larger than most hotels and the microwave sat right on top of it.  If you're someone concerned about tv size, you should know it's only a 19 inch.  We only needed somewhere to sleep after a long day at Disneyland and California Adventure so the room suited our needs just fine.  The restroom wasn't a cramped space and it actually had a fan so the bathroom wasn't overwhelmed with

We stayed at the Islander in rm 105 for 2 nights 12/18/04 - 12/19/04.  Good value at $69 + 15% rm tax.  The room was *clean*, large, and pleasantly decorated (one step up from the typical off-white painted walls) Fixtures were in good condition and there was a refrigerator, microwave and couch.  The rooms are in a 2 story U shaped building.  This is a "classic motel room design" and as such the one window is next to the door and faces the walkway/ parking area - so no view and no privacy unless curtains are closed.  We did not notice any road noise in the room -- it looked like the windows had recently been upgraded to dual pane.  The air-conditioner/heater unit was an "in the wall model" and as I have come to expect with these air-con. units, noisy.  The included breakfast was

We stayed here last year and we are going to stay here again. The manager told us to book direct and we saved even more $$$. You can walk to the park if you're not in a hurry. Even walking from the Disneyland hotel is a trek, but hey, if you wanna sit on your butt, stay home!  Good hotel and great service. Not a four-star, but more than worth the price of admission.

stayed at islander inn this october was very pleased with the room..2 beds and a sofa sleeper for 46 dollars a nite.The people in the office were very helpful and friendly too(sometimes in hotels you don,t get friendly)..the room was very clean..we could walk to disneyland in about 10 minutes(and we are older and alittle out of shape) so think how fast a young person could walk it..oh by the way did I mention all rooms have fridges and a microwave for no extra cost...this place was great.............

Summary Heading: Two family suite is great value
Summary: We stayed in the two family suite for three nights in October 2004.  There were 4 beds, two queens and two doubles with a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.  This enabled us all to be in the same section, but gave us our own privacy at night with a door to separate the two bedrooms.  There is one bathroom with a door going in from both bedrooms so you don't have to disturb the other family in the middle of the night.  The decor was pleasant.  We walked to Disneyland the first day and took the shuttle the second day after walking around the park all day the first day.  The kids on the trip were all under 7, so they rode free.  We were able to come back to the unit for lunch and dinner and rest for a while and then get back to the fun.  This is a great place to stay if you

Summary Heading: Loved the Islander Inn and Suites
Summary: Stayed at the Anaheim Islander Inn and Suites. It was great. We had a friend with us and got the suite. It was well set up with two separate rooms and T.V.s and coffee makers. FABULOUS. It was quiet and near the parks. I recommend it.

Stayed at the Islander Inn & Suites in March 2004 for 7 days. It was a  nice hotel, 2 rooms with 4 beds, fridge, microwave and 2 tvs. Toilet was running, but called the office and they fixed it right away. The bathroom was small especially when you had to assist children in there.  The rooms were always cleaned beautifully each day. No idea how they got the pictures on their website of the pool, very misleading - it is smaller than they make it appear.  May be better to request a room on upper level, we were on the lower level and upstairs it sounded like 10 people where in the room and the children up there were early risers, you could hear every word and cry and them jumping off the beds.  Laundry facilities are not accomadating, only one washer and one dryer and dryer took

Summary Heading: There are Better Closer to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed there in Feb for 5 nights during the Valentine holiday with * of us.  The hotel had a feeling of being old and tired.  The pool was ok but cold, my children are die hards when it comes to swimming.  The room had 2 room with 4 beds and one bath.  It smelled a little musty.  The breakfast was not good.  There were stale danishes and juice, most of the time when we got there they were gone.  I would not stay here again since I can stay a little closer to the park for the same price.

Summary Heading: Terrific value, looking forward to stay #4 this fall!
Summary: We have stayed at the Islander over the Thanksgiving holiday in 2000, 2001 and 2002 (we skipped last year due to my son's basketball team commitment) and plan on staying there again this year.  We usually stay in the family suite, and one year we booked three rooms to accomodate even more friends and family.  The hotel is definately within walking distance of Disneyland, even my 65 year old dad had no trouble walking back at night after a full day at the park, but the shuttle is fine too.  If you have toddlers, take a stroller and you will be fine.  The rooms are clean and spacious, and the pool has been heated in the winter when we were there.  The refrigerator is handy and we had plenty of hot water and towels.  The staff is friendly, helpful and keeps great records, because
This hotel was great. It's good enough if you just want someplace to sleep. The walking distance to Disneyland isn't far at all. Maid service and staff were accommodating. No problems here!

Rain was in the forecast for Anaheim so I called everyday for 3 day's to see if we should postpone our trip. Eachday Sam (front desk clerk) was very friendly, helpful and patient. When we finally did arrive he knew who I was from my voice. Check in was fast and easy. We stayed in the 2 room family suite for 6 and found the rooms to be spacious, clean, no smell noted and there were plenty of towels. The contential breakfast consist of danish, apples, juice and coffee. Not very filling. Housekeeping was very friendly and helpful. The Anaheim Resort Transit Shuttle(ART) was awesome. Buy the passes from the hotel, $3.00 per person, pick up and drop off outside our hotel, runs every 20 minutes. We didn't have to look for parking, and because it was an unlimited day pass we were able

We stayed 4 nights starting Feb 1, 2004 in a 2 room Family Suite. Both rooms were large and clean. The location is great and it is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. The staff is friendly and helpful. The laundry facilities handy so you don't have to take home all your dirty clothes. Overall we were happy with the Islander and we will stay there again the next time we go to Disneyland.

Foung the Islander very good value for money. Stayed in a 2 roomed suite, although basic it was good enough for the time spent in the room. Breakfast was fine if you love danish pastries and apples, but plenty of coffee and juice.  5 mins walk to cafes so eating out is no problem. Approx 20 mins to gates of Disney, o.k if not with small children. Staff very friendly and helpful and all maintenance requests dealt with promptly, even helped me break into my suitcases after keys left in U.K. If you have a car parking is good and if you're lucky you can park outside your room.  Would stay again if visitng anaheim.

Summary Heading: Happy with our stay at the Islander Inn
Summary: The rooms were very clean and I loved the shower heads they are the ones with the adjustable streams. The price was very reasonable for the rooms we got. We stayed in both the standard rooms and the family suite. The only thing about the family suite was there was only one bathroom for a 2 bedroom suite. Plus plenty of extra towels and blankets were left in the room. The staff were very courteous and helpful. I would stay there again and have recommended The Islander to friends.

Summary Heading: we will always come back to the islander!
Summary: We have stayed twice at the Anaheim Islander, each for 1 week. Their prices can't be beat! If you don't mind walking, it is just a 10-15 walk to Disneyland. Saves on parking! The hotel management is so very helpful. When we were there in March 2003, my oldest son got the flu during our stay. Needless to say, he got sick all over our room and the bathroom. The management sent someone up right away to clean it up. The daytime office gentleman directed me to the nearest pharmacy to get some items for my son and even offered anything I needed for my son if he happened to have it at home for his kids. Their customer service is great! We plan on visiting again in October 2003, and will be staying at the Anaheim Islander!

Summary Heading: You REALLY pay for what you get!!
Summary: We were down there for a a couple of days. The non-smoking room had this foul smell to it. Changed to another room and it was still the same. The walls are paper-thin, so you hear everything. They take the "service" out of customer service. Will not recommand it.
